Steam cooking, reinvented.

Introducing Wulcano - a completely new way of cooking with steam. This revolutionary food steamer is made of high quality stainless steel and without any plastic. You can prepare the most delicious food in a particularly healthy way. Cook up to four courses on a single hotplate, saving energy and our planet.

The tiers of the Wulcano system can be easily built up from two components: Place the food on the Wulcano plates and the Wulcano ring will form the steaming zones. Through the central positioned ""Volcano"" the steam flowes quickly and efficiently to all levels. So you can build up to three levels over our Wulcano Casserole.

Preparing dumplings, vegetables, meat and fish simultaneously, no problem the dishes keep their authentic taste on every tier. And as a special feature, the delicious steamed juices full of vitamins and minerals are collected thanks to the unique volcanic design. 

 

Four components, many possibilities.

The Wulcano steam cooking system has four components: (1) Casserole: Ø 242*130*1mm  - 4,5 Lit. (9,5* 5,1*0,04""- 1,2 gal.), (2) Steaming Plate: Ø 315mm (Ø 12,4""), (3) Steaming Ring/Cake Ring: Ø 246*75*1.2mm (Ø 9,6* 2,9*0,047""), (4) Closing Sphere: Ø 16mm (0,63""). 

The stackable design offers the possibility to steam a variety of dishes at the same time and on every tier the food's authentic flavors are maintained. Due to the jet effect of the Wulcano, even the top tiers are perfectly supplied with steam. At the top tier, simply place the closing sphere on the Wulcano and all the steam will remain in the system. 

 

Suitable for all types of stoves.

Our ingenious wulcanic steam cooking system is compatible with all types of stoves and cooking methods, also for induction. 

 

It takes up little space and fits in every kitchen.

In addition to the scalable, space-saving and strikingly beautiful design, the individual elements of the steamer are also versatile. You can use the cooking pot on its own, the steaming layers as serving plates and the steaming ring for baking.
Take your steam cooking experience to the next level.

Wulcano is all about pure taste. Many good memories have been created over good food. Whether you cook for yourself, your family or friends, prepare your meals extra healthy, taking everybody on a culinary ride full of flavors.
Steaming is one of the best cooking methods for maximizing taste while retaining the most nutrients and it is super easy!
Visit us on Instagram for more steam cooking tips and tricks @wulcanokitchen
Use your Wulcano steam ring for baking cakes and pastry.
Due to the strong design and a wall thickness of 1.2 mm, the Wulcano stainless steel ring has enough weight and is perfect for every cake adventure. (The Wulcano Friends-Set includes three rings!)
Prepare up to four dishes at the same time.

With Wulcano, the new stainless steel steamer, it gets even better: it is specially made for everyday use and adapts to all of your needs. Get out the maximum from steam energy. You only need one hotplate to prepare a complete menu. This saves energy and is good for the environment.
Nothing brings people together like good food. Wulcano makes it even better. Whether on your own, with your family or at a cooking event with friends, food connects and creates happy experiences.
And to top it all off, you can stylishly serve your cooking creations straight to the table.

The best quality for long lasting pleasure: Made from 304 stainless steel, 1 mm wall thickness - Base: right-angled seamless encap base with 5mm alu core, combined with an 430 stainless steel layer, which makes it magnetic and induction suitable. With capacity marks inside in half liters.
We do not use any plastics, this means your food remains intact from any synthetic substances when heated. Made of high-quality stainless steel ensuring you a long-lasting Wulcano experience.

Make a difference, choose Wulcano. There are many cheap plastic electric steam cookers on the market. When heated these synthetics release toxic chemicals into the food and ruin a healthy nutritional process. Furthermore, its short lifespan is leading to huge mountains of plastic waste.

Our team of inspired craftsmen built countless prototypes and models. Many tests, trials and adaptations later, we are proud to present this brilliant piece of cooking equipment with amazing features and breathtaking design.
Learn how it all began, what motivates us and meet the people behind the product on our website.
We can’t wait to start mass production. We have been looking for an independent cookware production partner that can manufacture Wulcano in the highest stainless steel quality.

Since the market is controlled by a few big companies with countless brands in their portfolio who keep their factories closed tightly, our search wasn’t easy. We were lucky to find Allinox in Belgium. They specialize in individualized stainless steel cookware and they will be able to manufacture the perfect product.

Christian is a product designer from Italy, living in Vienna. He invented and patented the new cooking and steaming system. Christian is a visionary who strives to create beautiful, relevant and functional products that meet the highest demands.

Kathi is our communication specialist from Carinthia, based in Vienna. She turns our vision into reality, creating and distributing the message through the appropriate channels. And of course, developing a trustworthy relationship with our audience.
Karl is our financial mastermind. He has the overview, pushes us forward when we are unfocused and helps us keep our feet on the ground.

An is innovation manager from Vienna, currently based in Berlin. He has accompanied many transformation projects and start-ups in Germany and Switzerland. An brings a lot of experience and strategic thinking skills to the team.

My name is Chelene, I am 23 years old, and have just been diagnosed with T Cell Lymphoma for the second time in 2 years. The first time I was diagnosed with stage 3 T Cell Lymphoma, was in July 2010.

I became severely sick and was hospitalized. After 16 days of grueling test, exams, blood work, the doctors discovered I had T Cell Lymphoma. During the next 4 months I received 6 rounds of chemo therapy, and Neupogen shots. The combination of these treatments was absolutely devastating to my body and the aftermath left me with Neuropathy, which is nerve damage that affects my arms and legs. I finally went into remission in November of 2010.

Now my T Cell Lymphoma cancer is back and my doctors have no stage to label my cancer , the doctors are taking an aggressive approach to treatment. I am scheduled to start my first round of chemo on 3/26/2012. I will have to have 2 weeks of 8 hours a day, 5 days a week. Then I will need a bone marrow transplant directly after.

Currently I am trying to work at two hair salons, as a hair styles to financial recover from all the medical bills from my first bout with my cancer. This is difficult on me due to the Neuropathy I have, and now I will have to quit my jobs to start treatment again.

Before my first treatments, my doctors recommended that I harvest and freeze my eggs. Not only did I not have the funds to do this, but because I was so sick and the cancer was at stage 3, this was not an option for me. Starting a family of my own is no longer an option.

After being independent and out on my own, I have had to move back in with my parents. Both my parents are hard working, blue collar, people who struggle financially every month, just like most of us do. My first round with cancer drained what little savings my parents had and now I am faced with, God only knows what kind of medical debt will come.
What I Am Asking

As of right now I am still receiving phone calls and letters daily and weekly form debt collectors, still not knowing how to pay them, or the on coming debt. My goal is to raise a minimum of $10,000. The money that i will be receiving from all of you wonderful and generous people will be used to help pay for my chemo, bone marrow transplant, medication, picc line, injections, lab testing, scan testing, co-pays, and gas to and from my treatments.

I would like to say thank you to all of those who have helped and who are helping. A few dollars might not seem like much, but those few dollars could pay for another injection, or test that is needed. I would also like to say thank you to everyone for all of your love, support, prayers, wishes, and thoughts, they are more appreciated than you know!!!

Mark Tate was diagnosed with Progressive Muscular Atrophy in August 2010. Progressive Muscular Atrophy is a subtype disease of Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), formally known as Lou Gehrig's disease. The disease severely limits mobility and the limitations continue to increase with time. The disease has not only been a hardship physically for Mark, but it has also become difficult to shoulder the financial burden on a daily basis.
Your donations will provide financial assistance for expenses of everyday care for Mark.
Pass along this information to anyone that you can.  Any help will be greatly appreciated!

<h3>Hi there! We are the Ebling's, Amber and Rob. We met each other when Rob
was 18 and I was 20... our relationship started as a wonderful
friendship, full of fun times and big laughs. We were married in July of
2000 (Rob was 22 and I was 24) , we still had big dreams for our

column2: finishing school before having children being a must! So as I

column1: finished up getting my Bachelors degree the baby fever hit! And it hit
hard!  I researched everything I could about trying to conceive
naturally and the adventure began! Well we had no idea what a
heartbreaking adventure it would turn out to be. After a year &amp
half of no success on our own we decided to look into fertility options.
Things started out pretty easy and not incredibly expensive. Our doctor
recommended we start with IUI which consists of taking my husbands
sperm weeding out the imperfect swimmers and putting it directly into
myself (this way those swimmers have less hurdles to go through to reach
my egg). Well after 3 failed attempts at $400 buck a try (not including
the 2 ultrasounds each cycle at $200 each), our doctor said we should
consider the next step: In vetro fertilization. So in 2006 we decided to
take all of our savings and give it a shot. $13,000 got us our doctor
visits and ultrasounds covered, the retrieval of my eggs and the
transfer of any fertilized eggs into my uterus.We were fortunate enough
to have 23 eggs retrieved from my uterus 19 of which fertilized
successful That $13,000 did cover all the transfers until those 19 eggs
had all been used, it did not cover any of the numerous and expensive
medications that I had to take each time we did a transfer.  These
medications we an added up to an additional expense of $500-700 each

time.  

We went into this process full of hope and excitement!
For us it was the thought of ""how could this not work??"", well to our
surprise our first transfer of 3 eggs was not a success along with our
second, also of 3 eggs. On our 3rd attempt we were amazed and delighted
with a positive blood pregnancy test!! Although when the nurse called to
tell us the news she said ""it is positive, but it is a very low
positive"". Any number less than 5 is considered a negative for pregnancy
and anything above 25 is considered a good positive. Ours came back at a
12 so we were in that grey area. Once you have a positive number come
back you have to have a blood test every other day to determine if it is
a healthy beginning, if it is that number should double every other
day. Our second test came back at 19, not a good sign and from there it

decreased back down to zero resulting in an early loss of the pregnancy.

So
again we picked ourselves up and decided to try again, we still had
frozen embryos and we were not going to let them go without a fight.
This time we transferred 4, we were less concerned with multiples
considering none had survived so far. This time we again had a positive
test result.... but it was low... AGAIN! We went for two weeks having
tests that the numbers just never seemed that good. Our Dr. decided for
us just to have and ultrasound to see what exactly was happening. What
she found was and empty uterus, failed again! And to make things worse
it seemed as though that little egg had decided to embed itself in to my
fallopian tube instead. So now I had an ectopic pregnancy (only happens
about 5% or less with in vetro)  that even if it was a good embryo, it
would not be able to survive. I had to be given a shot that was 95% of
the time suppose to dissolve the remainder of the pregnancy so that I
wouldn't have to have it surgically removed. Well a couple of weeks
later I had such an intense pain in my abdomen that my doctor ordered me
to the emergency room in my town. There the nurse stated that she
really didn't see anything that concerned her, she gave me Vicodin and
sent me home. That night I was in such excruciating pain that I could
hardly stand. In the morning we again called our Dr. who said go back to
the emergency room, I refused because of the treatment I received the
night before and told here we would drive the 2 hours to her office.
When I got there and had the ultrasound done my Dr. calmly walked out of
the room for a moment then came back and said "" I've called for an
ambulance, you will have to have emergency surgery. Your abdomen is
completely filled with blood and this is life threatening"". I was rushed
into surgery to have the ruptured fallopian tube and the remains of the
pregnancy removed. When I woke from surgery I remember asking about my
tube.... did it have to be removed?? Without it I would only be able to
get pregnant naturally 6 times a year instead of 12. So great, I lost one tube.... I'm

even more infertile!

After that we actually felt excited to try
again because we had revived a positive result, we thought it was a good
sign! So in 2009 we again transferred 3 frozen fertilized eggs.... 10
days later we got wonderful news a blood test result of 29!! We were
bouncing off the walls! Our next test came back at 56, but the nurse
said we had tested just shy of 48 hours so it should be just fine. Our
3rd blood test came in well above the 116 we needed, so our doctor said
let's schedule you for a 5 week ultrasound. Things were going perfectly
and we couldn't be any happier!! At our ultrasound we got to see the
fetus and had measurements taken to see if it's growth was were it
should be. Sadly we were told that it was measuring a week behind and
that we shouldn't keep our hopes up for it being a viable pregnancy. We
left that visit with heavy hearts but still clinging to hope of a
miracle for us. The next week our Dr. was shocked to see that growth had
continued (even though it was still about a week behind), and to our
surprise we were able to hear the heartbeat! I will never forget the
surprised look on our Dr.'s face and the uncontrollable tears of joy

column2: my faces. We were going to have our

column1: little miracle! We left that visit talking of the future and how

wonderful it would be!!

That excitement was short lived, within 2
weeks I began to have some bleeding that concerned us so we made an
appointment to have it checked out. The ultrasound showed that the
growth had slowed considerably and as our Dr. searched we came to the
horrible realization that the heartbeat could no longer be found. I was
only 9 weeks along but to my husband &amp
column2: I both, we felt as though we

column1:
had lost a part of ourselves.

Now we are faced with what our Dr.
believes are an issue with my eggs. Although I am still young 35, my
eggs are acting as though they are much older. Our Dr. believes because
of my many positive tests that I am able to carry a pregnancy, I just
need healthy eggs to do it. So we have been left with the option of
using a donors eggs with my husbands sperm, this would allow me to carry
the pregnancy. I have always dreamed of carrying our child and Rob
often talks of how he would love to see my body grow and change with
life inside of it. We have been together 15 years, 11 of those married.
We are each others best friends and have always wanted to have a family
of our own. But the amount of money it has cost us so far (upwards of $60,000, no of which insurance covers) has left us
with nothing to show for it other then broken hearts. We are asking for
help to raise money for a donor egg cycle, these cost between <span style=""color: rgb(153, 0, 51)
column2: >$30,500- 40,000. We are trying to come up with as much as we can out of our own

column1: pocket, but there is no way for us to come up with it all. We are not asking for everything, but anything would help bring us closer to our dream.  Please help
us to hold our little dream in our hands... a baby to complete our

column4:
>Where the funds will go:
IVF procedure and medications for Myself and Donor Approx: $16,000-19,000

Total Donor Agency Program Fees Average Approx. $14,500-18,000

Included in the program fees:

column1: - Compensation for the Donor: $7,000 First Cycle
- Donor Travel and other Donor Expenses: $1,000 Local / $4,000 Out of Town

column2: Genetic testing by licensed PFC physicians.

column1: • Psychological Testing (PAI) and evaluation performed by a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist.
• Genetic Counseling performed by a Certified Genetic Counselor.
<li> Genetic testing and preliminary FDA blood work (Cystic Fibrosis,
Hepatitis B, ABO and additional testing dependant on donorâ€™s ethnicity)
• Contractual agreements regarding all agency relationships with donor/recipient.
• Coordination of purchase of donor catastrophic medical insurance plan.
• Interface between EDA and the Clinic.

again because we had revived a positive result, we thought it was a good
sign! So in 2009 we again transferred 3 frozen fertilized eggs.... 10
days later we got wonderful news a blood test result of 29!! We were
bouncing off the walls! Our next test came back at 56, but the nurse
said we had tested just shy of 48 hours so it should be just fine. Our
3rd blood test came in well above the 116 we needed, so our doctor said
let's schedule you for a 5 week ultrasound. Things were going perfectly
and we couldn't be any happier!! At our ultrasound we got to see the
fetus and had measurements taken to see if it's growth was were it
should be. Sadly we were told that it was measuring a week behind and
that we shouldn't keep our hopes up for it being a viable pregnancy. We
left that visit with heavy hearts but still clinging to hope of a
miracle for us. The next week our Dr. was shocked to see that growth had
continued (even though it was still about a week behind), and to our
surprise we were able to hear the heartbeat! I will never forget the
surprised look on our Dr.'s face and the uncontrollable tears of joy
that were streaming down Rob & my faces. We were going to have our
little miracle! We left that visit talking of the future and how
wonderful it would be!!That excitement was short lived, within 2
weeks I began to have some bleeding that concerned us so we made an
appointment to have it checked out. The ultrasound showed that the
growth had slowed considerably and as our Dr. searched we came to the
horrible realization that the heartbeat could no longer be found. I was
only 9 weeks along but to my husband & I both, we felt as though we
had lost a part of ourselves.Now we are faced with what our Dr.
believes are an issue with my eggs. Although I am still young 35, my
eggs are acting as though they are much older. Our Dr. believes because
of my many positive tests that I am able to carry a pregnancy, I just
need healthy eggs to do it. So we have been left with the option of
using a donors eggs with my husbands sperm, this would allow me to carry
the pregnancy. I have always dreamed of carrying our child and Rob
often talks of how he would love to see my body grow and change with
life inside of it. We have been together 15 years, 11 of those married.
We are each others best friends and have always wanted to have a family
of our own. But the amount of money it has cost us so far (upwards of $60,000, no of which insurance covers) has left us
with nothing to show for it other then broken hearts. We are asking for
help to raise money for a donor egg cycle, these cost between $30,500- 40,000. We are trying to come up with as much as we can out of our own
pocket, but there is no way for us to come up with it all. We are not asking for everything, but anything would help bring us closer to our dream.  Please help
us to hold our little dream in our hands... a baby to complete our
Where the funds will go:IVF procedure and medications for Myself and Donor Approx: $16,000-19,000Total Donor Agency Program Fees Average Approx. $14,500-18,000Included in the program fees:
- Compensation for the Donor: $7,000 First Cycle
- Donor Travel and other Donor Expenses: $1,000 Local / $4,000 Out of Town
Medical & Genetic testing by licensed PFC physicians.
Psychological Testing (PAI) and evaluation performed by a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist.
Genetic Counseling  performed by a Certified Genetic Counselor.
Genetic testing and preliminary FDA blood work (Cystic Fibrosis,
Hepatitis B, ABO and additional testing dependant on donorâ€™s ethnicity)
Contractual agreements regarding all agency relationships with donor/recipient.
Coordination of donor appointments & travel arrangements.
Coordination of purchase of donor catastrophic medical insurance plan.

This campaign is to provide seed funding for a social venture to provide access to electricity to off-grid rural health dispensaries in Tanzania.
This project will be implemented by Opportunity Developers Inc., a consultancy I founded after returning from Tanzania where I volunteered at a renewable energy NGO (TAREA).

This project will also be implemented by a Tanzanian solar installer/retailer (ENSOL Ltd.) ENSOL is highly respected in the solar intallation industry and has regularly worked with with other humanitarian organizations including the Clinton Foundation and the United States State Department Aid Agency (USAID).
This project is the extension of a successful world bank backed pilot.
According to a recent study, Each year the United States uses more energy for air conditioning than the entire African continent uses at all.

Like much of Sub Saharan Africa, less than 3% of rural households in Tanzania are connected to the electrical grid. The paucity of modern energy in rural Tanzania poses a number of environmental, economic, gender and health issues, such as deforestation, the burden on women and children in collecting and buying firewood, and smoke inhalation. In this context there have been a number of efforts to implement projects to increase electrification in Tanzania’s rural areas.

In 2010 ENSOL Tanzania Ltd. was chosen from over 80 received proposals to implement a rural electrification and health care project by The Rural Energy Agency, an organization supported by the government of Tanzania and the World Bank. Ensol was awarded $99,800 to install solar pv systems in 20 dispensaries in both the districts of Mbinga and Tunduru in Ruvuma Region.
1.  Improved provision of health services
• improved maternal and infant mortality, and emergency services by replacing kerosene and candles with electric bulbs for delivering babies
• less reliance on  gasoline or kerosene which is intermittently available due to remoteness
• less risk to vaccine and other cold chain drugs supply due to unavailability of power for refrigeration

The greatest and most lasting impact will be the that of spreading awareness of renewable energy technology. People in the project areas will benefit from professional services from a dealer that is an expert in the technology, rather than only the fly-by-night unscrupulous salesmen that prey on rural villagers.

Through this project local technicians will be trained to provide post installation servicing. So trained technicians will then be able to pursue their own entrepreneurial interests in solar installation and servicing.

This Project has provided critical support to for providing health services to rural Tanzanians, educated the public about the application of renewable solar energy, supported rural local employment through the training of the local technicians, help finance additional community health providers, and the other benefits that inhere from the use of renewable energy.
We are now asking for your help to scale up this successful pilot
We are planning to start installing at more rural dispensaries this fall.
the cost of each rural health facility installation ~$2000
If we reach our goal we will be able to install at an additional 8 health facilities
If we do not reach our Goal...

If we do not surpass or reach our goal the funds will be used to support our existing efforts to electrify rural tanzania and will be applied to the ongoing financial support and maintainence of the existing installations.
$200 contribuiton or over - You will receive a promotional T-Shirt
$400 contribution or over - You will recieve a calendar featuring our installation sites  and a promotional T-Shirt (You'll be the sartorial paragon of your local area, indubitably!)

$1000 contribution or over - Not only will you receive the T-Shirt and calendar but you will also receive a letter from the Ministry of Energy/Health thanking you personally for your contribution to rural health and electrification.
Electrifying rural Tanzania and Sub Saharan Sustainable Development is my life's work and I ain't gonna quit no time soon!
So spread the word about this campaign, and we'll keep you updated on the other projects that my partners and I will be implementing in the near future.
""The great composer does not set to work because he is inspired but becomes inspired because he is working""

Our daughter, Courtney, doesn't remember what it's like to live without pain or fear of pain.  She will be 15-years-old in October and has only had nine pain-free days in the last eight years.  Those nine days came after being in the hospital for four days.  Every day she wondered, ""Will today be the day?""  That's not to say that she let it rule her life, it was just always there, in the back of her mind.  She took full advantage of those nine days, and to see her happy and pain-free was the greatest joy our family had known in quite some time.  That was a year and a half ago.  Almost every day since then, her pain level has increased, and never gone away.  She keeps thinking that she has experienced the worst pain she could ever imagine, only to discover that it can get worse.  I cannot begin to imagine living with the constant pain our beautiful daughter suffers... she desperately wants to know what it is like to live without it.

It all started with four simple words, ""I have a headache.""  Considering that she always said it at the end of the school day, we did what any parent would do~ took her to the eye doctor.  Sure enough, she needed glasses.  Sadly, the headaches just kept coming... every, single day.  Eventually Courtney was diagnosed with migraine headaches.  Blood work, MRI, CT scan, nothing ever showed a cause, there was no explanation.  Being the strong, amazing child she is, she has never let her pain stop her.  It might slow her down, but she picks up speed eventually. A straight A student, lover of nature, writer, future scientist, and so much more, she hopes and dreams big.  She has gone through her days with a smile on her face, always reaching for the stars.

Courtney has been hospitalized four times in less than three years.  It is always a grueling experience and the results always temporary.  Although pain has never affected her performance when it comes to school work, it has greatly affected her ability to attend school.  From fourth through seventh grade, she missed no less than 18 days of school per year.  Her eighth grade year, she became homebound for three months.  Although she managed to finish the last month of the year at school, her summer has been spent able to do little more than lie on the couch, wishing the pain away.  She has had a few good~ although not pain-free~ days, and when she does, she takes full advantage, only to suffer the next several days.  She starts high school in less than three weeks... she desperately wants to finish her freshman year with her friends, pain-free.

Her doctor has done all he can.  Another four day hospital stay, with temporary results and dangerous medicine is not the answer.  We are glad for this.  The Pain Management Center at Children's Medical Center Dallas told us there is nothing they can do... except refer us to the Mayo Clinic for a three week Pain Rehabilitation Program.  The Mayo Clinic is a long way from Dallas, TX, and three weeks is a long time.

We want to be able to take Courtney to The Mayo Clinic... we need your help.  Without your help, there is no way we can afford to get her the treatment she needs. Although we have insurance~ and assuming they will pay for the program~ they do not pay until we have met an out-of-pocket expense of $3,500.  Add this to airfare, lodging, transportation, and food for two, for three weeks... it adds up rather quickly.  As a result of Courtney's many hospitalizations, as well as her dad~ my husband~ having had a heart attack, leading to open heart surgery on July 3 of this year, we have aquired an enormous amount of medical bills.  Being able to pay for the treatment Courtney needs, as well as, the medical bills we have already acquired, would allow us to start saving money so that she can go to college.  As I said, she dreams big, she wants to be a scientist!  .
Because we have been assured that the Pain Rehabilitation Program is quite successful, we have high hopes that, with your help, Courtney will be able to live her life free of constant, severe pain.

iSideWith.com is run by two friends (one techie + one political junkie) with a simple goal - to save users time by providing an unbiased, accurate, and up-to-date breakdown of which Presidential candidates they side with on the issues - not soundbites. We believe this will boost voter interest and turnout this election season. We are self funded on a shoestring budget and are not affiliated with any investors, shareholders, political party, interest group, or advertisers and would love to keep the site ad free.

Almost 3 Million users have taken the presidential election quiz so far and with your help we can afford to add more features, including the addition of the 2012 Senate candidates to the results page.

We have set a goal of $25,000 to support the cost of adding the 2012 Senate candidates. These funds will help us support the development, research (hiring assistants to add and monitor candidates stances), and added hosting/server costs. Any money raised above $25,000 will go towards adding the 2012 congressional house races. The more money raised, the more races we'll be able to add until we can give you a site that shows you which President, Senator(s), House of Representative(s), Governor, Mayor - all the way down to your local city council members - you side with by issue and the strength of their voting records on those issues.
If you are unable to donate but still want to show your support, please encourage your friends and family to try iSideWith and visit our fundraising page.
For more information about us click here: http://www.isidewith.com/about/

For information on the quiz click here: http://www.isidewith.com/faqs/

Hello, my name is Jimmy Burton and i am a close friend and co-worker of Bruce Connors. Bruce has been working with us for over 30 years, and you could say he is the glue that holds this place together. Everyone loves Bruce, and if you could only meet him, you would see why. Not only is he a light that shines at our office, but Bruce's contributions go beyond that. Bruce also cares for his wife and grandchildren through his work. Many family members depend on his income. We are starting this campaign in hopes of helping support Bruce and his family in these tough times. Recently, Bruce has suffered a stroke and has lost all movement in the left side of his body. His spirit is still lively, but his body simply will not cooperate. The much needed monthly income he provided was a life line for his family. Now that he is bed ridden, it is up to us to help him! In these tough economic times, with a family to support, Bruce couldnt afford health insurance, and as you can imagine, the bills are piling up. Please help us help the man who has shown so bright in our lives. Please help us support his family! Lets help him recover by taking the burden of family needs off of his shoulders, a burden he couldnt possibly carry in this moment.

We are asking for a goal of $1500, and if everyone chips in a tiny bit I know we can smash this goal. By donating to this campaign, you will keep the hope of human kindness and love alive. In these dark times, i know that Love still exists and is out there! God is love, and he will provide!
His family will be able to make it through these few tough months!
If you cant donate, please pray. We need as many prayer warriors out there as we can get! We know the spirit is moving in this, prayers are coveted in this place!

column2: >See which fitness and diet plan matches your personality immediately with our personality card.

column1: Take the quiz right now and get your free iFitnessWise match brought to you by Step Research, which also provides psychology software at the NFL draft and for MLB teams: http://app.smarteraboutpeople.com/start.php
Your funding will get you a longer, more detailed fitness and diet plan that matches your personality. See the example coaching report below.

Special Gift Deadline Dates:

During each week of our campaign, we will be giving special rewards to all backers! Backers will receive the Special Reward from the date they backed our campaign and all of the following rewards.

November 8th - Pre-Launch Early Adopter Owl! Back now and receive a special 'Early Adopter Owl!' digital badge to post on your Facebook and Twitter pages or use in your email!   And Early Adopters also get each of the following week gifts!
<h3>iFitnessWise is about matching exercise and diet strategies that are a good fit for your personality
column2: approaches that will feel easy and natural rather than being a struggle every day.

column1: There are no one-size-fits-all answer for fitness.

What works for you is unlikely to work for your friends. That is because you have different personalities. iFitnessWise helps you select and manage a fitness strategy that is natural for your personality.  As a team we have worked with all sides of personality research and sports psychology.  From our experiences in the NFL and MLB, there is no such thing as ""one size fits all"".
Why most programs do not work for you:

So, you might start an exercise program by joining a gym or by following a fitness guru, never quite feeling like the program is right for you. Then after a month or two, you quit going to the gym (even though you paid for a year) or you give up on the guru.

Or you go for a stringent diet style that worked for a friend or celebrity and cut out every food you love just to lose ten pounds, but then you cannot take it anymore and you binge on your favorite foods (and lots of other not-so-favorites). You give up any semblance of trying to eat better and you just decide why bother?

The holidays are especially tricky for most people with their diet and exercise programs. It is understandable that most people make resolutions in the coming January, and many of them are health related, after all, a New Year means a clean slate. The problem is that most people try to accomplish everything at once using a program that is never going to work for them in the long run because it does not match their fitness personality. Do not disregard your resolutions, instead use iFitnessWise to help direct you to a strategy that will finally help you accomplish your 2014 fitness goals!

The all-or-nothing attitude is one of the reasons we are starting iFitnessWise. The overriding idea of iFitnessWise is this - change your fitness program to match your personality, not the other way around.
Two longtime friends, Pam and Sterling, started talking...

Pam has a Master's degree in Exercise Science and knew that the old standards for the type and amount of exercise were more than most people could attain, and therefore very few people were even attempting to exercise at all, let alone getting fit.

Sterling is a founder of Step Research - developers of psychology software, and an expert with personality type. He is on the Board of Directors for the Association of Psychological Type International.
column2: >The software created by Step Research is used by sports professionals in the NFL draft and MLB draft to understand which players are the right fit for a team.
>So, Pam and Sterling had a lot to talk about. And the more they talked together the more they knew that the relationship between their areas of expertise could help others.

>We set out to create an easy and memorable way for people to remember their iFitnesswise match. In almost any exercise program you have to have the right footwear. We chose shoes to represent each personality, and to match them to strategies that fit. The shoe is just a mascot, not a rule.

column1: Here are short descriptions of two of the eight broader fitness personality styles to give you an idea of how iFitnessWise will work for you and your friends.

column2: >Access the beta immediately, take the quiz to get your fitness personality quick card for free! http://app.smarteraboutpeople.com/start.php

column3: >

column1: Here is an example of a detailed report that is customized with more specifics tailored for your unique fitness personality.

People do not gain weight or get into unhealthy habits overnight, yet we expect results after a week, or worse yet, a couple of days. Most people do not realize that small dietary changes or a little extra activity can make a huge difference in the long run.

Can pretty much everyone add some activity into their lives? Probably. Can most people go even further with the “right” exercise program for them? Again, probably. Especially if you get some help from iFitnessWise so that your program matches your fitness personality.
Your pledge will allow us to create and get the detailed Coaching Reports to you for your New Year’s Resolution in January 2014.

We are going to build this application regardless of meeting our funding goals. Without hitting our funding goal then this project will have to be a labor of love and will take as long as necessary with everyone’s busy lives.

By hitting our funding goal we know that not only do other people want it, but that they are willing to pay for it. This means we can begin to build a rich and varied product suite to help people. As a business we can support this product.
Take a look at our planned product development with the stretch goals below.

We would love for iFitnessWise to give you the coaching you need whenever you most need it. It is important to us that iFitnessWise fits into your life seamlessly, while still being a useful tool for you. Once you find out what works for you, we hope that iFitnessWise becomes a tool for people who want to lose weight, be fit, and communicate with others about their experiences.

That is what iFitnessWise is all about...helping you find out what you enjoy doing/eating, etc. (or at least not dreading). And over time, we hope that being a part of the iFitnessWise community makes you “fitness wise”, not only about fitness, but what works specifically for you.

column2: >Help everyone who has struggled to stay fit know that there is a way to get fit and lose weight that matches their personality. If you know someone who supports fitness, or who has struggled with fitness, then help us spread the news about this project! Please help educate people that their fitness personality does affect what programs will work for them.

column1: Pam Canavan: Mother with a Masters in Exercise Science who has a passion for helping people be healthier and happier as themselves.
James Canavan: Actor (he is in the video!) and Radio Show Host, Student, Graphic Designer and someone who desperately needs this software to work.

Sterling Bates: Personality Expert (on the Board of Directors for the Association for Psychological Type International), owner Step Research Corporation and software system architect.  Step Research creates psychological software and works with professional sports teams like the NFL and MLB. (Sterling has also been focused on exercise and health since developing Type 1 diabetes at age 8.)

Gene Bellotti: A partner at Step Research with a Masters in Counseling and Consulting Psychology, and 20 years marketing and advertising with tech startups who found a fitness program that matched his personality.

column4: > The new guy at Step Research. Rodney has a Masters in Video Game Design (Production)
column6: >, and over 13 years experience as a competitive gymnastics coach.

column1: Well, it started out of a meeting between Sterling (our personality type expert), James (our web/art designer), and Pam (the fitness expert). We were discussing the challenges people have with exercise. At one point, James said, “well, you really have to enjoy what you are doing “fitness-wise”. Of course he is right. If you enjoy what you are doing, you are more likely to keep doing it. Now, onto figuring out what works for you!

We have already done the vast bulk of the psychological and fitness research. The software and system have been architected. The core application and psychological assessment have been designed to leverage resources from Step Research which already does psychological software for professional sports like the NFL and MLB.
The beta is available right now for you to test at our software partner!

column2: >

column1: What are we going to do with the money:

What we need now is the final push of money to finish writing and editing the the detailed coaching reports, and pay for the development to make the custom coding adjustments for the coaching reports to make it the perfect fit for iFitnessWise.

$6,000 At this goal we will develop an Email Tips feature into our application that reminds you of the optimal fitness, exercise and diet strategies for you. The emails will include tips that motivate to increase your chance of success. We might charge for this service later, but any backer of $10 or more gets it free for a year!

$10,000 For this goal we create an Athletic Partner Comparison Coaching Report, automatically available to anyone at the $5 level or higher. If you like to work out with other people, this comparison report will show your coaching reports side by side and helps you know if your buddy or buddies are matched with the type of fitness approaches that suits you.

$15,000 At this goal we will build in goal setting and journaling features to the coaching reports to help you stay on track. These goals integrate with the Email Tips from the earlier stretch goal so that you are reminded of your goals, just a like a good coach would do.

$20,000 For this goal we create a special interface and tools for Fitness Professionals, eg. Exercise Coaches, Diet Experts, Personal Trainers, Dieticians, Nurses, Doctors. This is a great tool for anybody who is certified and/or helping others with their fitness. This will include a special forum or discussion area where these professionals can collaborate. We will probably charge for this additional business service, and anybody at the $75 backer level or higher will get free access for 6 months.
$25,000 For this goal we update the Email Tips system to also be a Text Tips system. As with the Email Tips, any backer of $10 or more gets the product free for a year.

$30,000 At this goal we make each detailed coaching report longer, this would add an additional page to each coaching report, adding roughly 10,000 words to the coaching report writing effort. The more we can provide insight into your personality and how it affects your approach to fitness, the greater chance that you will find a way to exercise that will become a lifetime of health and wellness.

$40,000 At this goal we build in a feedback loop. In addition to the quiz, results, quick card and detailed coaching reports we are allowing and creating a space for users to contribute to the iFitnessWise system. Both as “fitness” buddies to help support each other and as people of similar personalities who know best what you are going through. Users can report back on specific programs that have worked for them. This way, iFitnessWise will be a clearinghouse for all sorts of local activities throughout the country that are sorted and filtered to fit your natural preferences. It would be wonderful if it was so easy and convenient for everyone to find an activity or program that matches their fitness personality whenever they need it.

$50,000 For this goal level we will create the ability for you to privately discuss and comment on your coaching report with the people you designate.  Then you can have a coaching dialogue with the people you care about.

$60,000 For this goal level we will find a way to make non-personally identifiable data exports available for free to any professional or academic researcher who is interested in improving health and who could use our data to help create correlations between personality, psychological differences and health approaches and techniques.

$75,000 We would add a child-focused psychological assessment that parents can give to younger children (below age 13) and use to match approaches to their child’s natural style. It can be really hard to help kids exercise and eat right. Stop fighting the child and instead select strategies that stand the best chance of success. Communicate with other parents who have children with similar personality styles about what works.

column3: > We will create an iPhone and Android integrated app that allows you to set, track, and manage your fitness goals, and works alongside your iFitnessWise Coaching Report to increase your chance of success!

column1: Step Research Corporation, the company behind the quiz and the software at SmarterAboutPeople.com, is an experienced psychological software company. We have already built and delivered several products designed for large companies including working with NFL and MLB professional sports teams. This puts us in a good position to take on the risks and challenges that will arise -- and as with any project, experience tells us a few problems likely will.
Here is what we can anticipate as potential problems:

Writing The Coaching Reports: The writing could take longer to execute than we are hoping it will, or could simply manifest in a fashion we find unsatisfactory (requiring a 'do-over'). Writers are people with real lives and those lives come with schedule-complicating problems. If any delay looks like it will be short, we will likely roll with it, and we will let you know what is happening. If it looks like something long, we have an assortment of other writers we have worked with over the years who can step in to help achieve the deadlines.

Hosting and Servers: Our company is very focused on up-time and stability for all our products. We partner with Rackspace as a top provider of hosting and servers to manage this particular area. They have a stellar reputation in the industry and their unparalleled customer service is something we prize in them as a partner.

The Art: The custom art for those reward levels could take longer to execute than we are hoping it will. James might have complications from college or his work as a radio talk host and some other schedule-complicating problems. If any delay looks like it will be short, we will likely roll with it, and we will let you know what is happening. If it looks like something long, we have a number of other artists who can assist.

Software: The software could take longer than expected to customize. Snags could occur in the code that was not anticipated. If any delay looks like it will be short, we will likely roll with it, and we will let you know what is happening. If it looks like something long, we have an assortment of other development teams we have worked with over the years who we know can execute quickly and on-time for a deadline.

Finances: Thanks to the success of our other projects, Step Research Corporation is a solvent software company. We have already spent $10,000 on customization getting the iFitnessWise beta to this point, and now we are asking the Indiegogo community to help us get this launched much faster and to fund the great stretch goals.

If there is any risk or challenge you can think of that we have not mentioned here, please write in and ask. We love to answer questions, and we do our best to provide an unparalleled customer service experience whenever possible.
","See which fitness and diet plan matches your personality immediately with our personality card.

Take the quiz right now and get your free iFitnessWise match brought to you by Step Research, which also provides psychology software at the NFL draft and for MLB teams: http://app.smarteraboutpeople.com/start.php
Your funding will get you a longer, more detailed fitness and diet plan that matches your personality. See the example coaching report below.

Special Gift Deadline Dates:During each week of our campaign, we will be giving special rewards to all backers! Backers will receive the Special Reward from the date they backed our campaign and all of the following rewards.

November 8th - Pre-Launch Early Adopter Owl! Back now and receive a special 'Early Adopter Owl!' digital badge to post on your Facebook and Twitter pages or use in your email!   And Early Adopters also get each of the following week gifts!
iFitnessWise is about matching exercise and diet strategies that are a good fit for your personality
column2: approaches that will feel easy and natural rather than being a struggle every day.

column1: There are no one-size-fits-all answer for fitness.

What works for you is unlikely to work for your friends. That is because you have different personalities. iFitnessWise helps you select and manage a fitness strategy that is natural for your personality.  As a team we have worked with all sides of personality research and sports psychology.  From our experiences in the NFL and MLB, there is no such thing as ""one size fits all"".
Why most programs do not work for you:

So, you might start an exercise program by joining a gym or by following a fitness guru, never quite feeling like the program is right for you. Then after a month or two, you quit going to the gym (even though you paid for a year) or you give up on the guru.

Or you go for a stringent diet style that worked for a friend or celebrity and cut out every food you love just to lose ten pounds, but then you cannot take it anymore and you binge on your favorite foods (and lots of other not-so-favorites). You give up any semblance of trying to eat better and you just decide why bother?

The holidays are especially tricky for most people with their diet and exercise programs. It is understandable that most people make resolutions in the coming January, and many of them are health related, after all, a New Year means a clean slate. The problem is that most people try to accomplish everything at once using a program that is never going to work for them in the long run because it does not match their fitness personality. Do not disregard your resolutions, instead use iFitnessWise to help direct you to a strategy that will finally help you accomplish your 2014 fitness goals!

The all-or-nothing attitude is one of the reasons we are starting iFitnessWise. The overriding idea of iFitnessWise is this - change your fitness program to match your personality, not the other way around.
Two longtime friends, Pam and Sterling, started talking...

Pam has a Master's degree in Exercise Science and knew that the old standards for the type and amount of exercise were more than most people could attain, and therefore very few people were even attempting to exercise at all, let alone getting fit.

Sterling is a founder of Step Research - developers of psychology software, and an expert with personality type. He is on the Board of Directors for the Association of Psychological Type International. The software created by Step Research is used by sports professionals in the NFL draft and MLB draft to understand which players are the right fit for a team.
So, Pam and Sterling had a lot to talk about. And the more they talked together the more they knew that the relationship between their areas of expertise could help others.

When the shoe fits…We set out to create an easy and memorable way for people to remember their iFitnesswise match. In almost any exercise program you have to have the right footwear. We chose shoes to represent each personality, and to match them to strategies that fit. The shoe is just a mascot, not a rule.
Here are short descriptions of two of the eight broader fitness personality styles to give you an idea of how iFitnessWise will work for you and your friends.
Access the beta immediately, take the quiz to get your fitness personality quick card for free! http://app.smarteraboutpeople.com/start.php
Here is an example of a detailed report that is customized with more specifics tailored for your unique fitness personality.

People do not gain weight or get into unhealthy habits overnight, yet we expect results after a week, or worse yet, a couple of days. Most people do not realize that small dietary changes or a little extra activity can make a huge difference in the long run.Can pretty much everyone add some activity into their lives? Probably. Can most people go even further with the “right” exercise program for them? Again, probably. Especially if you get some help from iFitnessWise so that your program matches your fitness personality.
Your pledge will allow us to create and get the detailed Coaching Reports to you for your New Year’s Resolution in January 2014.

We are going to build this application regardless of meeting our funding goals. Without hitting our funding goal then this project will have to be a labor of love and will take as long as necessary with everyone’s busy lives.

By hitting our funding goal we know that not only do other people want it, but that they are willing to pay for it. This means we can begin to build a rich and varied product suite to help people. As a business we can support this product.
Take a look at our planned product development with the stretch goals below.

We would love for iFitnessWise to give you the coaching you need whenever you most need it. It is important to us that iFitnessWise fits into your life seamlessly, while still being a useful tool for you. Once you find out what works for you, we hope that iFitnessWise becomes a tool for people who want to lose weight, be fit, and communicate with others about their experiences.That is what iFitnessWise is all about...helping you find out what you enjoy doing/eating, etc. (or at least not dreading). And over time, we hope that being a part of the iFitnessWise community makes you “fitness wise”, not only about fitness, but what works specifically for you.

Please support us!Help everyone who has struggled to stay fit know that there is a way to get fit and lose weight that matches their personality. If you know someone who supports fitness, or who has struggled with fitness, then help us spread the news about this project! Please help educate people that their fitness personality does affect what programs will work for them.

I work as a Film Producer and Actress but feel very passionate about the topic of Women's Health.

I feel honoured to have this opportunity because it allows me

column1: to follow a passion of mine, which is doing something for charity.

I am aiming to raise as much funds and awareness by the end of March 2014.
I have created this page to help raise funds but I will also be hosting events and other fundraiser activities.

column1: Ovarian cancer is the leading cause of gynecological cancer deaths in Australia. Each year more than 1200 Australian women are diagnosed with 800 women will die

On average 3 Australian women are diagnosed every day. Approximately 75% of women are diagnosed at an advanced stage, where the cancer has spread and is difficult to treat successfully. Currently only 40% of women diagnosed with ovarian can-cer will be alive five years after diagnosis.
If ovarian cancer is diagnosed early, up to 80% of women will be alive and well after five years.
The four most commonly reported symptoms are:
Some women experience additional or different symptoms. You should let your doctor know if you have any other symptoms that are not usual for you these may include:

column2: >The majority of women who experience these early symptoms do not have cancer. However, it is important that you seek medical advice if the symptoms persist. IF YOU HAVE THE ABOVE SYMPTOMS FOR MORE THAN 2 WEEKS YOU SHOULD SEE YOUR GP.

column1: Every woman with ovarian cancer is treated as an individual case, depending on the stage of the disease and other personal factors. It is therefore very difficult to give a general prognosis.If the cancer is diagnosed and treated early, between 80-100% of patients will survive for more than five years. But only approximately 30% of women diagnosed at advanced stages will survive for more than five years. See 'How is Ovarian Cancer Treated?' for further information about survival rates.

column2: >The five year survival rate for Australian women with ovarian cancer is only about 40%
>In comparison, the five year survival rate for breast cancer is about 88%

column1: THERE IS NO SCREENING TEST FOR OVARIAN CANCER. A PAP TEST IS USED TO DETECT CERVICAL CANCER IT DOES NOT DE-TECT OVARIAN CANCER. THIS IS A COMMON MISUNDERSTANDING BY A LOT OF WOMEN AND IT IS IMPORTANT THAT WE EDUCATE WOMEN ABOUT THIS.

Ovarian cancer is the leading cause of gynecological cancer deaths in Australia. Each year more than 1200 Australian women are diagnosed with 800 women will die

On average 3 Australian women are diagnosed every day. Approximately 75% of women are diagnosed at an advanced stage, where the cancer has spread and is difficult to treat successfully. Currently only 40% of women diagnosed with ovarian can-cer will be alive five years after diagnosis.
If ovarian cancer is diagnosed early, up to 80% of women will be alive and well after five years.
The four most commonly reported symptoms are:
Increased abdominal size or persistent bloating
Difficulty eating or feeling full quickly
Needing to urinate often or urgently
Some women experience additional or different symptoms. You should let your doctor know if you have any other symptoms that are not usual for you these may include:

The majority of women who experience these early symptoms do not have cancer. However, it is important that you seek medical advice if the symptoms persist. IF YOU HAVE THE ABOVE SYMPTOMS FOR MORE THAN 2 WEEKS YOU SHOULD SEE YOUR GP.

Every woman with ovarian cancer is treated as an individual case, depending on the stage of the disease and other personal factors. It is therefore very difficult to give a general prognosis.If the cancer is diagnosed and treated early, between 80-100% of patients will survive for more than five years. But only approximately 30% of women diagnosed at advanced stages will survive for more than five years. See 'How is Ovarian Cancer Treated?' for further information about survival rates.
The five year survival rate for Australian women with ovarian cancer is only about 40%
In comparison, the five year survival rate for breast cancer is about 88%

THERE IS NO SCREENING TEST FOR OVARIAN CANCER. A PAP TEST IS USED TO DETECT CERVICAL CANCER IT DOES NOT DE-TECT OVARIAN CANCER. THIS IS A COMMON MISUNDERSTANDING BY A LOT OF WOMEN AND IT IS IMPORTANT THAT WE EDUCATE WOMEN ABOUT THIS.",0.0,2,"7 Campaigns
<label id=""fund-summary-lb"">This is Daria Yudashova's fund, a
little russian girl who has a rare genetic desease CCHS (congenital
My name is Helena and I m the mother of the little girl Daria, now she
is 1 year old.All this year she has been living in the hospital and during 11
months she was alone lying in the intensive unit as the parents are
allowed to see the child only for 2 hours.We live in Russia, in a small
town Kstovo not far from Nizhny Novgorod. Our story began in January
2011, we ve been waiting for our little girl and on the 16th january she
was born. On the second day her breathing stopped and she was switched
on to the ventilator. Next day in a very grave condition she was taken
to the intensive unit care in Nizhny Novgorod's hospital. After the

examination and therapy she could not breathe herself anyway. Every week the doctors switched her off from the ventilator and every time we hoped for a miracle that she can breathe but unfortunately it did not happen. And the doctors did not know what kind of the desease she has. Only some weeks later one of the doctors supposed that she has CCHS (congenital central hypoventilation syndrome) and told us to have a genetic analysis that proved it and it is turned out that she has 20/27 polyanine expansion and since then she is 24 hours ventilator dependent as she can not breathe herself. We went to Moscow to one of the scientific centers, after examination of her medical report they agreed to accept Daria in their center but only if we would have a home ventilator, then they could teach us how to manage her at home and we could take our little girl home afterwards. But actually the norms for caring the children with CCHS are unknown in our country as we have two cases only at the moment. I ve found in the internet that children with the same desease live at home having this home ventilator and later on when the child is 4-5 years old the operation for pacemaker implantation can be made abroad. Due to the enormous help of ordinary people we could buy at last this ventilator from Germany ( here we dont have any insurance covering or help from the government). So at the moment I live with her together in the hospital and I m so happy to see her lovely smile every morning. But Moscow center does not have a bed for us at the moment and we don't know for how long we could wait. In our country there is no specialists in CCHS.One of our friends contacted the clinics in Europe and at last we've got the invitation from a UK clinic in North Staffordshire, they have a big experience in managing children with CCHS . They will do the full examination of Daria's condition and will teach us how to manage her properly when we are back home and one of the most important thing as well that they would help us to treat her neurodevelopmental delay as here she was switched off by the doctors each time her brains suffered a lot and as a result she a hydrocefalia (liquid in brains). Being 1 year olds she still does not hold her head, does not sit. I strongly want  to believe that  we could be able to fundraise  the necessary sum for her coming to UK and treating her and maybe there the miracle will happen and she can breathe herself when awake as most children do having the same 20/27 polyanine expansion. We all know to breathe is to live and I hope my daughter will live a normal life. We began the fundraising in our country with the help of ordinary people in social network but the sum for the treatment is quite big 113,520 pounds for 2 months stay. So if anyone of you could donate to Daria we would be very greatful to you! and we could transport her faster to UK as until now she is not well examined and every day we are afraid for her condition. Thank you all in advance for your kind hearts!

The Impact

Daria is a very positive and smiling girl, she still does not know what is to sit, to stand as she has a neurodevelopmental delay as well, but she wants to LIVE and to BREATHE and she has a CHANCE for this! Any money donated would mean a world for her and our family.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get
To be able to treat our girl we need money, to be able to transport her to UK where there are specialists of CCHS and who may help. Unfortunately we don't have support from our government that is why we search for help from ordinary people all over the world. We can't offer anything big or exciting in return, but we will send you million of thanks if you help us

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let people know about our little girl! And please pray for her if you can, the prayers are strong and helpful too!

>The clinic in UK also is ready to provide parents with the accomodation, they will only need to buy meals for themselves and they can stay with her daughter 24-hours! We made a goal for 98000 USD as it is the cost for 1 month stay in UK, the doctor said the minimum time for Daria stay there is 2 months, but we hope to get the second part of the sum in our country with the help of people too. But any money donated would help us, it is known that the ocean consists of the drops, so we believe that little by little uniting all over the world we could give this chance to this little cutie.

column1:
If you have questions please don't hesitate to contact me taty1302@yandex.ru
You may see as well Daria's website it will be translated into english soon  www.cchs.ru
little russian girl who has a rare genetic desease CCHS (congenital
My name is Helena and I m the mother of the little girl Daria, now she
is 1 year old.All this year she has been living in the hospital and during 11
months she was alone lying in the intensive unit as the parents are
allowed to see the child only for 2 hours.We live in Russia, in a small
town Kstovo not far from Nizhny Novgorod. Our story began in January
2011, we ve been waiting for our little girl and on the 16th january she
was born. On the second day her breathing stopped and she was switched
on to the ventilator. Next day in a very grave condition she was taken
to the intensive unit care in Nizhny Novgorod's hospital. After the

examination and therapy she could not breathe herself anyway. Every week the doctors switched her off from the ventilator and every time we hoped for a miracle that she can breathe but unfortunately it did not happen. And the doctors did not know what kind of the desease she has. Only some weeks later one of the doctors supposed that she has CCHS (congenital central hypoventilation syndrome) and told us to have a genetic analysis that proved it and it is turned out that she has 20/27 polyanine expansion and since then she is 24 hours ventilator dependent as she can not breathe herself. We went to Moscow to one of the scientific centers, after examination of her medical report they agreed to accept Daria in their center but only if we would have a home ventilator, then they could teach us how to manage her at home and we could take our little girl home afterwards. But actually the norms for caring the children with CCHS are unknown in our country as we have two cases only at the moment. I ve found in the internet that children with the same desease live at home having this home ventilator and later on when the child is 4-5 years old the operation for pacemaker implantation can be made abroad. Due to the enormous help of ordinary people we could buy at last this ventilator from Germany ( here we dont have any insurance covering or help from the government). So at the moment I live with her together in the hospital and I m so happy to see her lovely smile every morning. But Moscow center does not have a bed for us at the moment and we don't know for how long we could wait. In our country there is no specialists in CCHS.One of our friends contacted the clinics in Europe and at last we've got the invitation from a UK clinic in North Staffordshire, they have a big experience in managing children with CCHS . They will do the full examination of Daria's condition and will teach us how to manage her properly when we are back home and one of the most important thing as well that they would help us to treat her neurodevelopmental delay as here she was switched off by the doctors each time her brains suffered a lot and as a result she a hydrocefalia (liquid in brains). Being 1 year olds she still does not hold her head, does not sit. I strongly want  to believe that  we could be able to fundraise  the necessary sum for her coming to UK and treating her and maybe there the miracle will happen and she can breathe herself when awake as most children do having the same 20/27 polyanine expansion. We all know to breathe is to live and I hope my daughter will live a normal life. We began the fundraising in our country with the help of ordinary people in social network but the sum for the treatment is quite big 113,520 pounds for 2 months stay. So if anyone of you could donate to Daria we would be very greatful to you! and we could transport her faster to UK as until now she is not well examined and every day we are afraid for her condition. Thank you all in advance for your kind hearts!The ImpactDaria is a very positive and smiling girl, she still does not know what is to sit, to stand as she has a neurodevelopmental delay as well, but she wants to LIVE and to BREATHE and she has a CHANCE for this! Any money donated would mean a world for her and our family.What We Need & What You GetTo be able to treat our girl we need money, to be able to transport her to UK where there are specialists of CCHS and who may help. Unfortunately we don't have support from our government that is why we search for help from ordinary people all over the world. We can't offer anything big or exciting in return, but we will send you million of thanks if you help usOther Ways You Can HelpPlease let people know about our little girl! And please pray for her if you can, the prayers are strong and helpful too!

The clinic in UK also is ready to provide parents with the accomodation, they will only need to buy meals for themselves and they can stay with her daughter 24-hours! We made a goal for 98000 USD as it is the cost for 1 month stay in UK, the doctor said the minimum time for Daria stay there is 2 months, but we hope to get the second part of the sum in our country with the help of people too. But any money donated would help us, it is known that the ocean consists of the drops, so we believe that little by little uniting all over the world we could give this chance to this little cutie.

CANCER HAS TOUCHED ALL OF US IN SOME SHAPE, FORM, OR FASHION THE NUMBER ONE KILLER OF CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 15 IS CANCER

Comedian/actor Alex Thomas has created the Alex Thomas Foundation to raise funds and provide support  to children and families who are fighting this horriable disease. Introduce yourself and your background. Each year I get some of my celebritiy and athlete friends together to raise funds and awareness to pediatric cancer and the organizations that we support.
Join us  Monday July 9th at Mountain Gate Country Club as we kick off Espy Awards week for the 3rd Annual Alex Thomas Celebrity Golf Classic and red carpet party
Your support of this event will allow the foundation to provide support to families who has a child battling cancer.

You contribution will be touching the lives of children and famlies who reach out to us. wether it be to pay for airline tickets and accomadations to a hospital that is not local for them, the payment of a medical bill not covered by insurance, and other things.
DONATE: AND JOIN THE FIGHT WITH US.

If you have ever met Marilyn Giardino Zych, she is most likely the most eccentric, creative, and passionate person you know. She is a film maker, clown, mother, dancer, painter, singer, teacher and she is still growing and gaining knowledge at the age of 65. As Marilyn's daughter, she inspired me continuously showing me that life is what you make it, that no matter how rough or ugly things become, staying positive and believing can truly bring you to the other side of it. She also showed me that the key to life is to continue to learn and do so passionately. She never hesitated to try something new and if I can even be half as ambitious as she is, I know I will be truly happy. One thing in particular she taught me was to give to others. She always gave to others, even when she barely had anything for herself. She always taught me to follow my heart and to treat others with compassion.

Marilyn has been diagnosed with advanced pancreatic cancer. Due to her illness she is unable to continue working and is undergoing treatment and therapy. Our father has had to take time off of work as well. He has been driving her to all of her appointments, staying by her side at the hospital, and waiting on her hand and foot. Any and all donations are greatly appreciated, no matter how small.

UPDATE: During the beginning stages of our campaign, it became clear to Marilyn and her doctors that if additional immediate action was not taken, the outcome of the treatment she had planned would not be as beneficial as we had hoped due to the rate at which complications were arising. About one week into fundraising, Marilyn went to a treatment center that deals with cancer patients on a one on one basis, and provides treatment designed specifically for the individual's type of cancer and stage. Thanks to all of YOU, Marilyn has completed her first week of treatment and says that the pressure in her stomach is already lessened. While we have reached our Indiegogo goal, we hope to continue to raise funds for her. The more money we make, the more time she will be able to stay at the treatment center. We are overwhelmed and so incredibly grateful for all of the generosity and support we have received, we thank you truly from the bottom of our hearts.
Your contribution will add exponentially to Marilyn’s life. This is a part of my sister and I’s secret dream
column2: to come to her in 35 days and show her how many people love and support her, and that there is something that my sister and I can do to make this better. When a family member becomes suddenly and seriously sick it’s easy to imagine how one begins to feel hopeless but this is our way to do something concrete, meaningful, and incredibly beneficial for her.

column1: Even if you can't donate, please keep Marilyn in your prayers. Also please share this site as much as you possibly can. The internet is powerful and so are you!
