column5: >Have you or a loved one been diagnosed with cancer? What’s Next?

>“Kick Cancer in the Can with Diane” is a new Web series that follows a typical working wife and mother as she’s hit with a sudden existential dilemma: a diagnosis of breast cancer. A remarkably upbeat actress and Hollywood dresser to the stars, Diane Weisman bravely shares her hopes, fears and bewilderment about the dizzying array of cancer information now available on the Internet. What's real, what’s a hoax? Must Western medicine and Eastern alternative therapies conflict? Diane, her husband Craig and their two boys learn about water quality, the effect of sugar on tumors, special healthy diets such as macrobiotic eating, yoga and other relaxation techniques, chemotherapy, radiation and surgery — all while maintaining an upbeat attitude and sense of humor.

column12: >Getting a cancer diagnosis makes a huge impact on anyone's life. It’s a tremendous challenge, but Diane Weisman wants others to know they’re not alone. ""Kick Cancer in the Can"" will strive to answer many questions, including:
>- What road do we take after diagnosis?
>- Are there prevention techniques and successful ways of battling cancer not commonly known?
>- What are the differences between traditional Western medicine and Eastern alternatives?
>- What happens if you have an HMO, or a PPO — or no insurance at all?

>Along with celebrity guest stars and cooking segments, “Kick Cancer in the Can with Diane” is compelling, informative and entertaining. Follow Diane in real time as she faces an arduous journey in her quest for answers, addressing not just questions about cancer, but about how to live a life worth living.

>We have moderate budget of approximately $2,500 per webisode. Our goal is to complete 10 webisodes for season one. We have completed a preliminary shooting of five webisodes. These include cooking pieces, exercise demos and celebrity segments. We explore traditional western protocol as well as fun, free and low-cost therapies not known by most cancer patients.

column7: >If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation,
column9: >please donate through ""Fractured Atlas"" by clicking on this link:Fractured Atlas

column12: >Money raised initially will be used to complete three of the five webisodes already taped. This will cover post-production editing, Web site development, and travel for interviews. Any funds raised above initial request will be used to complete additional episodes with syndication potential. Remaining funds will go to support organizations that offer free services for cancer patients.
>Contributions are tax deductible. Incentives will be available, such as ""Kick Cancer"" T-shirts, signed DVD copies, cookbooks, aprons, jewelry, free classes and guest appearances in the series.

>Are you on Facebook or Linked In? Do you Tweet? Please let your friends know about this campaign. If you join a chat group and cancer is discussed, please mention ""Kick Cancer in the Can with Diane."" And if you have an alternative therapy, healthy recipe or a special inspirational story to share, or if you just want to share a picture of a loved one, please send it to us. We are encouraging people to send in aprons and tell us the stories (or recipes) that go along with them.  With your permission, we would love to feature these aprons, stories and pics in the cooking segments throughout the season.

>Share your story: Please send us a recording via You-tube, 60 seconds or shorter, of how you handled your cancer diagnosis. In future webisodes of ""Kick Cancer in the Can with Diane"" we will share your inspirational story with our viewers.

>Do you have a production talent?  We are looking to expand our team with talented like-minded individuals. Our team needs experts at social networking to get the word out. We are interviewing experienced Final Cut Pro Preditors (Producer-Editors) located in the Los Angeles area.

column1: Have you or a loved one been diagnosed with cancer? What’s Next?

“Kick Cancer in the Can with Diane” is a new Web series that follows a typical working wife and mother as she’s hit with a sudden existential dilemma: a diagnosis of breast cancer. A remarkably upbeat actress and Hollywood dresser to the stars, Diane Weisman bravely shares her hopes, fears and bewilderment about the dizzying array of cancer information now available on the Internet. What's real, what’s a hoax? Must Western medicine and Eastern alternative therapies conflict? Diane, her husband Craig and their two boys learn about water quality, the effect of sugar on tumors, special healthy diets such as macrobiotic eating, yoga and other relaxation techniques, chemotherapy, radiation and surgery — all while maintaining an upbeat attitude and sense of humor.

Getting a cancer diagnosis makes a huge impact on anyone's life. It’s a tremendous challenge, but Diane Weisman wants others to know they’re not alone. ""Kick Cancer in the Can"" will strive to answer many questions, including:
- What road do we take after diagnosis?
- Are there prevention techniques and successful ways of battling cancer not commonly known?
- What are the differences between traditional Western medicine and Eastern alternatives?
- What happens if you have an HMO, or a PPO — or no insurance at all?

Along with celebrity guest stars and cooking segments, “Kick Cancer in the Can with Diane” is compelling, informative and entertaining. Follow Diane in real time as she faces an arduous journey in her quest for answers, addressing not just questions about cancer, but about how to live a life worth living.
What We Need & What You Get

We have moderate budget of approximately $2,500 per webisode. Our goal is to complete 10 webisodes for season one. We have completed a preliminary shooting of five webisodes. These include cooking pieces, exercise demos and celebrity segments. We explore traditional western protocol as well as fun, free and low-cost therapies not known by most cancer patients.
If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation, please donate through ""Fractured Atlas"" by clicking on this link:Fractured Atlas

Money raised initially will be used to complete three of the five webisodes already taped. This will cover post-production editing, Web site development, and travel for interviews. Any funds raised above initial request will be used to complete additional episodes with syndication potential. Remaining funds will go to support organizations that offer free services for cancer patients.
Contributions are tax deductible. Incentives will be available, such as ""Kick Cancer"" T-shirts, signed DVD copies, cookbooks, aprons, jewelry, free classes and guest appearances in the series.

Are you on Facebook or Linked In? Do you Tweet? Please let your friends know about this campaign. If you join a chat group and cancer is discussed, please mention ""Kick Cancer in the Can with Diane."" And if you have an alternative therapy, healthy recipe or a special inspirational story to share, or if you just want to share a picture of a loved one, please send it to us. We are encouraging people to send in aprons and tell us the stories (or recipes) that go along with them.  With your permission, we would love to feature these aprons, stories and pics in the cooking segments throughout the season.

Share your story: Please send us a recording via You-tube, 60 seconds or shorter, of how you handled your cancer diagnosis. In future webisodes of ""Kick Cancer in the Can with Diane"" we will share your inspirational story with our viewers.

Do you have a production talent?  We are looking to expand our team with talented like-minded individuals. Our team needs experts at social networking to get the word out. We are interviewing experienced Final Cut Pro Preditors (Producer-Editors) located in the Los Angeles area.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

I am Mamikon and September 14 is my birthday but I don't need gifts. I kindly ask you to help me raise money for 8yo Hrant Grigoryan who has Infantile cerebral palsy. He cannot walk and has health problems. He is beneficiary of Ekho NGO (www.ekho.am) and organizations wants to buy for him important items (Nuga Best NM 2500 mattress and NM 30 pillow) which will improve his metabolism, blood circulation and development of muscles. Those items are really expensive, all together 1400USD.

All I ask you to support me to raise a part of this amount, and even if this campaign gets more money than was mention, each cent will go to Ekho NGO to support of kids as well.

-------------------

Ես Մամիկոնն եմ և սեպտեմբերի 14-ն իմ ծննդյան օրն է, բայց ես նվերներ չեմ ուզում: Խնդրում եմ Ձեզ օգնել ինձ իրականացնել դրամահավաք 8-ամյա Հրանտ Գրիգորյանի համար, ում մոտ ախտորոշված է Ատոնիկ
քայլում և ունի առողջական խնդիրներ: Նա Էխո ՀԿ-ի (www.ekho.am) շահառուն է և կազմակերպությունը ցանկանում է գնել «Նուգաբեստ» NM 2500 ներքնակ և NM 30 բարձ, որոնք կնպաստեն

լավացմանը և մկանների ճիշտ ձևավորմանը: Այս պարագաները միասին արժեն 590.000 ՀՀ դրամ:

Խնդրում եմ աջակցել ինձ հավաքել այս գումարի մի մասը, իսկ եթե հաջողվի ավելին հավաքել քան նշված է, ապա յուրաքանչյուր լումա կփոխանցվի Էխո ՀԿ-ին մյուս երեխաներին ևս օգնելու նպատակով:

Short Summary

I am a mother of three who was lucky enough to have incredible midwifery care throughout all of my pregnancies. I passionately believe that all women should have access to the choice of birth they want yet sadly in the UK most women are denied this. There are shortages in funds for midwives, hospitals are short staffed and still many women aren't having their choices for labour and birth facilitated. We know using water in birth means less painful contractions, less need for pharmacalogical analgesia, shorter labour and less need for augmentation and is therefore better for women.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

I am looking to raise £6,000 to pay for five birthing pools for midwives to support women birthing at homes and a telemetry machine to support women with risk factors to give birth with water on labour ward.

column1:
The Impact

9,000 women come through Imperial every year  (via its two hospitals St Mary's and Queen Charlotte's), 4,500 using the antenatal clinic and the

other half using the full community services of antenatal, during birth and postnatal care. £6000 will allow us to impact over 300 women, nearly one a day, over the course of a year, with the choice of birth they want and deserve.

Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't donate I would love to hear from you with ideas about raising money and please do share this campaign with anyone who may be interesting in supporting.

Those who frequented The Constant Service pub in Hanover, Brighton a few years back will know our darling friend and former bar gal extraordinaire, Charlie - she lit up every room with her warmth, kindness and love of life. She left us a couple of years ago for new adventures abroad and has been living, loving and being her wonderful self in Hong Kong.

We were devastated to learn that Charlie has recently had an accident, requiring major back surgery, but she is safe in hospital in Hong Kong and is receiving excellent medical care. It's too early for the medical team to offer a prognosis regarding her recovery, but whatever that may be, it's going to involve a very long and difficult road ahead for Charlie.

We want to do everything we can to help and support her, so are aiming to raise as much money as possible. The money will be used as required, for example: covering her rent, flying a loved one out to be with her, day-to-day expenses while she's in hospital, flying Charlie back to the UK when she is able and allowed to travel, living expenses once back in the UK, the list goes on…

The Constant Service will be holding various events, raffles, meals etc to raise money, so please feel free to get involved as much as possible. There will also be a donations box on the bar and all contributions, large or small, will be enormously appreciated.

As you can imagine, Charlie is feeling scared, in enormous pain and needs to rest as much as possible. During this difficult time, it’s asked that you please respect her privacy and need for rest by not overwhelming her with lengthy correspondence. It will be made clear to everyone via this page when she is ready to receive direct communication, but in the meantime emails should please be sent via her close friend, Vanessa (Ness) Tretton, who is speaking to Charlie daily and will pass them on to her as appropriate: vtretton@gmail.com

Short, uplifting messages or Facebook posts of love and support will be gratefully received - these enable Charlie to feel connected and supported - but please understand that she may not be able to respond.

Updates regarding Charlie's progress will be posted on his page, as and when there is anything to share.

Charlie says she loves you all and is so appreciative of everyone's love and support.

With love and thanks,

Team Charlie

column1: App to provide holistic 360 Degree Health care right from critical care to
About 360 Medical Emergency App  and Funding Goals

Crowd Funding pitch to attract interest and generate funds to take the vision/idea of creating a 360 degree integrated Health Care Android / iOS App to cater to patients who require critical care and emergency care with Technology aid.

This App is a single integrated suite of modules which will have SOS Feature, Hospital Management (Minimal features) and a fully integrated EHS, Hospital Management (Minimal) , Diet and Wellness Modules for overall well being of  EH care patients.

Mobile App will have minimal light features and will contain secure data on hospitalization, patient record right from illness to wellness for patient record archives and for regular  checkups and also for progress from illness to wellness.

Mobile App will deliver stand alone as well as combined and interlinked features to present to Doctors and Health Care Experts on a 360 view and can deliver Analytics and Medical reports at the press of Button.

The 1st phase of this App would feature a  way to invoke SOS from Home to a 24 /7 Call Center to provide basic ambulance and  critical care for emergencies with full fledged integration via GPS and  Contact data.
Hospital and Ambulance will have devices to Sync and make sure that Patient life is saved with no delay

The 2nd Phase of this App would provide a way to keep  track of the emergency treatment and clinical data right from the day when patient checks into Hospital and till his  discharge and also post operative care .
Tracking of  diagnosis and also preliminary and post operative care as well as wellness inside and outside the Hospital is the key feature of this Application.

Application will work and will be designed  for three type of Users specifically people who can use this App  are individuals, Doctors , Call Center  SOS and Ambulance personnel as the App will be integrated and will touch each of their work and business process.

Data Visibility and Data access controls will conform to IMA , Mobile Health Care App standards and FDA standards will be addressed when we work on Health Data of a Patient and also to protect Hospital data from hackers.

Integration of  Data to Devices, which will provide  clinical / patient diagnosis data from third party devices  and  healthcare analytic tools to measure Return on Investment ,patient progress and  treatment effectiveness.
App will also aid in speedy recovery of the patient and provide Health and Diet tips based on the condition of the patient and  to support to his recovery

Provide holistic 360 view of  patient history right from his stay in hospital till discharge will be key success factor for this Application as it would aid in maintaining a proper  data / record of Patient history during his life cycle of illness to Wellness.
Patients  time to wellness from an illness will be monitored and reports will be sent to expert doctors assigned to a patient to keep a track during his recovery and wellness process.
Partner Application  Development Vendor below (Griffin Infosystems ) who
will partner with us to develop this Android / iOS Application .

Help us make the world's first plug-and-play device for testing water quality from your phone!

SeaStat is a water monitoring instrument designed to use multi-use optical sensors to test alkalinity, temperature, and turbidity. Think of it as a tiny--but smart--robot that wants to show you the general quality of your drinking water in your apartment, the creek next to your campsite, or even the questionable glass of water provided at your next business meeting. Now we need your help to get this into production.

We believe everyone should know the general quality of their water, regardless of expertise or budget. Wherever we go--to the beach, to another country, to a hotel--we rarely know how clean our drinking water is. Our only sense is what we can directly observe. That is only part of the problem.

The other part is that nearly all water quality instruments on the market are either expensive, overly complex machines that are used primarily by field scientists or  ""consumer-friendly"" kits that give you a bunch of test strips. Neither option is low-cost (test strips get expensive in the long run), effective for the average consumer, convenient, easy-to-use, or accessible.

We decided to get rid of all the unnecessary components and build a new model by scratch. All our parts are durable, low-cost, and energy efficient. The cool factor is that you'll be able to control it from your cell phone! It gives the readings in an easy-to-view format and in understandable language. This is really the first testing device meant for the average consumer.

SeaStat is incredibly easy to use. Pop out the glass vial located at the top by pressing down on an adjacent button. Fill it with water (as much as possible) and slide it back in. Next, connect SeaStat to your phone via the headphone jack, press the On/Off button, and that's it! You can choose which test you want to run by either pressing the Function button on the SeaStat or selecting the test on the phone application.

SeaStat runs three tests: pH (or alkalinity), turbidity, and temperature. Why these three? These are the most powerful and indicative tests without requiring complicated laboratory equipment. All three help indicate pollution, survivability of bacteria, and suitability for drinking. Temperature is important for swimmers and fishermen because it affects how much oxygen is in the water and how well pollutants can last. The pH, which measures the acidity of water, reveals if the water is changing chemically. Turbidity is the amount of suspended particles that scatter light in a solution. Testing for turbidity can reveal the presence of microscopic organisms and inorganic human-generated matter.

This project is on KickStarter for a few reasons. First, we need $2,400 to finish building our prototypes. While we have made parts of SeaStat, we have not had the financing to construct a full working model. Right now, we are refining the circuit design in order to better integrate the pH electrodes without expanding the physical space. Second, we need about $8,000 to manufacture the first 50 models. We are working with a manufacturer right now to bring down assembly costs and provide a guaranteed delivery date. Lastly, we want to know this has some market appeal before we harass family and friends for donations. This way, this page acts tests the concept of SeaStat.
Anywhere! The beach, your hotel, on a boat. Maybe you're traveling overseas and want to test the drinking supply. All you need is some physical water to test.
From your phone. Just press the ""on"" button and away you go. Right now, the iPhone applications are in development but should be done by June. An Android version will come out the same time.
It will work with the iPhone 4, 4s, and 5. We apologize that we will not be able to support an earlier model.
Awesome! We love to get feedback. Just send us a message and if we incorporate your recommendation, you'll be credited on our website as a KickStarter developer!

column4: > Hi, I'm Brook Dillon.  I work, I write, I play music and I'm healthy.  But, this is not about me.  It's about Tristan Myra Mejia.  She is the mother of my child, a respected make-up artist, and my ex.  (She prefers Tristan but, also goes by  Myra)

> I didn't find out about Tristan's stroke until about 2 weeks later.  Why?  Because, she didn't want me to worry.  This is what she told my son.  Obviously, I found out and was immedeately floored, upset and speechless.  After seeing her at the rehab center I realized that her recovery will probably take longer than just a month.  She can remember some of our names but, not all of us.  She knows what she wants to say but, can't get it out.  She can lift up her right arm but, movement and single finger movement is limited.  She can't walk without a walker and not without help (see video).  I can't explain the pain I feel for her because this is an injury she had no control over and to see her struggle with normal everyday things gives me such a knot in my stomach.

column1: •  I want to raise enough money to pay for at least two months rent and hopefully 3 so, Tristan can concentrate on rehab to get back to 100 percent (hence the link name)
•  Tristan doesn't have insurance (as so many people don't, except through medi-cal for this incident).

•  Your contribution will allow her to get her health back sooner and continue a normal life.  Rehabilitation is so important when you have a stroke.  It is imperative that you have continual physical and mental therapy as well as mental stimulation (95% of your functions return within the first 2-3 months).  Her profession requires a lot of use of her right hand (which she doesn't have much of at this time) and a lot of socializing as well. She has to work on both these things and get them back to 100% to be able to function well within her occupation.
•  She is making good progress but, it needs to continue.  She will be released from the rehab center this friday.  Her not worrying about rent will in turn allow her to have a succesful rehab.
Perks aren't the main focus but, Try I will!

• All of the money that is raised from this campaign will be directly paid to Myra's landlord for rent.  If an excess amount of money is raised it will be applied for up to 4 months of rent ($8000.00) and the rest will be applied to a charity towards stroke research.

• I made a CD, ""Pick n' choose"", back in 2004.  My son is going to try and come up with some pieces of art that we can give as perks as well.  I will apply one of these for any donation over $15.00 at this point.  If I find it's cheaper to ship them, then I will lower the amount required for a perk.  My main concern is to hurry and get this campaign started.
• I will also send each and every donater a free digi upload of my next CD that I put out.  It will be called Catastrophe carnage.  I'm hoping for it to be released within 6-8 months.

If you can't donate, please feel free to give me information on good rehab facilities for home, good rehab/trainers.  If you are a qualified rehab person who wants to donate your services, that would be considered as well.

If you are someone who can help through goods donation, that would be great as well.  Natural remedies, vitamins, etc. and or ""brain"" food would be great!  I hope to get Myra on a strong natural diet that will help keep her blood thn so any goods or helpful information will be greatly appreciated!
Whether you apply money, goods, or information towards my campaign, it will all be going not only towards Tristan's cause but, the cause of better education towards all who involve themselves!

Hi, I'm Brook Dillon.  I work, I write, I play music and I'm healthy.  But, this is not about me.  It's about Tristan Myra Mejia.  She is the mother of my child, a respected make-up artist, and my ex.  (She prefers Tristan but, also goes by  Myra)

I didn't find out about Tristan's stroke until about 2 weeks later.  Why?  Because, she didn't want me to worry.  This is what she told my son.  Obviously, I found out and was immedeately floored, upset and speechless.  After seeing her at the rehab center I realized that her recovery will probably take longer than just a month.  She can remember some of our names but, not all of us.  She knows what she wants to say but, can't get it out.  She can lift up her right arm but, movement and single finger movement is limited.  She can't walk without a walker and not without help (see video).  I can't explain the pain I feel for her because this is an injury she had no control over and to see her struggle with normal everyday things gives me such a knot in my stomach.
I want to raise enough money to pay for at least two months rent and hopefully 3 so, Tristan can concentrate on rehab to get back to 100 percent (hence the link name)
Tristan doesn't have insurance (as so many people don't, except through medi-cal for this incident).

Your contribution will allow her to get her health back sooner and continue a normal life.  Rehabilitation is so important when you have a stroke.  It is imperative that you have continual physical and mental therapy as well as mental stimulation (95% of your functions return within the first 2-3 months).  Her profession requires a lot of use of her right hand (which she doesn't have much of at this time) and a lot of socializing as well. She has to work on both these things and get them back to 100% to be able to function well within her occupation.

Perks aren't the main focus but, Try I will!

column9: >fter spending an inordinate amount of time in a hammock I realized that the standard golf club configuration makes no sense at all. Originally
column14: >made this way because of the limited technology to fasten the head to the shaft. However there is no longer any reason to have the head offset from the shaft. Golf is a game of minute precision, yet the conventional club configuration introduces uncontrolable variances in every swing due to the torsion induced from hitting the ball. Additionally the inherate aerodynamic instability of the current design prevents a truly consistant swing.

column6: >This is no gadget, this is phys
column11: >ics. The principle is applicable to the whole range of clubs. This should change how golf clubs are made. Be part of this defining moment in sport history!

column1: After spending an inordinate amount of time in a hammock I realized that the standard golf club configuration makes no sense at all. Originally made this way because of the limited technology to fasten the head to the shaft. However there is no longer any reason to have the head offset from the shaft. Golf is a game of minute precision, yet the conventional club configuration introduces uncontrolable variances in every swing due to the torsion induced from hitting the ball. Additionally the inherate aerodynamic instability of the current design prevents a truly consistant swing.

This is no gadget, this is physics. The principle is applicable to the whole range of clubs. This should change how golf clubs are made. Be part of this defining moment in sport history!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"

Effective Nanos, Not Patent - Friendly Medication

Medications and solutions for dangerous drug-resistant superbugs, crippling  viruses like HIV and deadly cancers are within our grasp but these medications, we fear are going to be slow in coming or swallowed up altogether by market pressures within our patent-driven medical system. These medications are nano-medicines, medications utilizing nano-particles or, as we like to call them "" Nanos "".

My name is Miguel Vidal, as a registered nurse I have witnessed, along with many other conscientious healthcare professionals, how the patent instigated system has corrupted and destroyed the worthwhile goals and ethics of many within the worldwide healthcare system. The search for a cure - long ago -  was crushed by the race for the patent and profits. Simple effective treatments with zero or minimal side effects have been abandoned for the sake of complicated patent-friendly medications with endless and many times devastating side effects.

The multi-billion dollar pharmaceutical industry funnels hundreds of millions of dollars into research, dominating the course and outcome of much of the clinical research being done worldwide. These funds are distributed to universities, medical centers and physicians in various ways. These institutions and individuals in turn are subverted to a primary goal of creating patent - friendly and financially - friendly drugs. Most of this research and the medications they produce are geared toward the control of symptoms, the apparent "" quick-fix "" that will bring money rolling in and keep it rolling in, with little regard for long term solutions.

This system is poised to engulf this promising new class of medications - Nanos ( nano-medicines ). Threatening to make incredibly powerful and safe nano-medicines expensive and inaccessible through patent manipulations and creations. Throughout Asia, Europe, and the Americas research is being done on medications derived from nano-particle substances - substances, usually metals - produced in the nanometer or micrometer size range. These nano-medicines in amazingly tiny doses have a profound effect on viruses, bacteria, fungi, inflammation and cancers in and on our bodies. Nano-particle substances are being studied utilizing the oral. intravenous, transdermal, and inhalation routes with powerfully positive results. Unfortunately, despite amazing results, research has developed slowly, in most cases and in most places. Nanomedications are developing and can continue to develop as fundamentally single element molecules and particles. But, efforts are being made to mix these nano-particles with other ineffective medications or unnecessary additional nano-particle substances. This may seem illogical till one looks at the issue from a patent and profit driven perspective. Single element nano-particles are much less likely to receive patent assignment than complicated hybrid substances. From a profit angle it is also much cheaper to mix an effective nano-particle with an ineffective medicine and receive patent rights for a "" new "" very effective medication.

Our team wants to lead in the growth and inexpensive distribution of these new medicines while eliminating the possibility of nano-particle medicines or, their derivatives being pulled into the cycle of stifling patent - driven manipulations. Global NanoMedicine will never patent a medication. Our company will be built on people advocacy, health advocacy and branding, not stagnating and unethical patent-focused market control.

With your support we can substantially improve the health of humanity. We can bring the wonderful power and amazing possibilities of low-cost nano-medicines to people worldwide. We will be able to save tens of thousands by combating resistant bacteria with nano-particle medications. We will be able to shield hundreds of thousands against a multitude of viruses.We will be able to vastly improve the health of millions who have contracted viruses like HIV and Hepatitis. Your help will bring about a future with inexpensive, zero or low side-effect nano-particle medications capable of suppressing viruses much more effectively than present antiviral and antiretroviral drugs
column2:
drugs which have devastating side effects on the brain, heart, kidneys and liver. The support and funding you give to our team will create significant changes in the treatment of Reactive Airway Disease and Influenza, helping to prevent both before they develop. In time, nano-particle medications will become a significant and benevolent force against the ravages of cancer. Please support us and spread the word.   



Information offered on our campaign page

Though there are thousands of studies on nano-particles and their biomedical and antimicrobial uses worldwide, for the sake of clarity all the material presented on this page as well as Global NanoMedicine's Facebook page is based on information from the US Centers for Disease Control or publications from the National Libraries of Medicine of the United States. Below we will present selected links from broad categories
column3:
we invite everyone to access these links and learn more about the future of medicine. Our gallery area also has quick-read pictorial presentations for those seeking more information. 



Nanos, antibiotics and the future

Broad consensus exists in the scientific community on certain subjects related to antimicrobial treatment in the future. One of those subjects is the state of antibiotics. Antibiotics are losing effectiveness and creating health problems. We've known for some time that there are correlations between antibiotic use and many disease states. There is broad consensus calling for new types of antimicrobials. The CDC has said we must all consider "" a post antibiotic era "" an approaching  reality. Nano-particle based medicines can and will fill the requirement for new antimicrobials
column4:
they are ideally suited for this task. Most experts believe bacteria will never be able to build resistance against nano-particles. All the evidence points to nano-medicines having zero or very mild side-effects. The price of nano-medicines can be very low if needless profiteering is avoided.  


Multi-drug Resistant Bacteria 

The Centers for Disease Control's self-named 2013  "" landmark report "" on Antibiotic Resistance Threats clearly outlined the most dangerous pathogens and their threat level. Nearly all these resistant organisms are susceptible to nano-particle based medicines.

Learn more,( these are a tiny sample you'll find more in our pages. Even more upon request at Globalnanomedicine@gmail.com. )

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24403664

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24627178

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24762541


The HIV Challenge and Where We Stand

HIV transmission continues to be a sad situation and a daunting problem. The World Health Organization recently proposed prophylactic antiviral use for all men who have sex with men. The side-effect morbidity which would be caused by such action would be staggering considering antiviral damage to brain, kidney, lung and heart tissue. These and other proposals hint at desperation and frustration. Many studies have been completed utilizing intra-vaginal antiviral cocktails
column5:
none offer much promise for successful effectiveness and would come with an equally burdensome side-effect profile. On the other hand, gold and silver nano-particles offer great promise and in the case of the more investigated silver nano-particles zero or low side-effects.   

Learn more,

column4:
>Once upon a time there was a tree hugger and a grazier....

Hi! I'm Lindsey Jakubowski, General Manager of Kriemhild Dairy Farms. I have the absolute pleasure of working with Bruce &
column5:
Nancy Rivington, owners of EFS LLC grass based dairy farm and Founders of Kriemhild Dairy Farms. Together we're working toward building a sustainable local food economy. What exactly does that mean? Well, we're focused on paying grass based dairy farmers a premium for their quality milk and turning that delicious milk into simple, wholesome and healthy grass based cultured dairy products. 

We've been using a co-packer thus far to make our European-style pastured Meadow Butter. They're taking in grass fed milk from EFS Farm (Bruce &
column6:
Nancy's), separating the cream from the skim, and churning that sweet cream into pastured Meadow Butter. We are there doing all the packaging. After two years of production and establishing diverse regional distribution channels, we're ready to invest in our own creamery and expand our product line!

Besides helping us purchase equipment (a butter boat!) you're contributing to our triple bottom line success--environment, community and economy. Not only is milk from grass fed cows better tasting and healthier, the methods of producing that milk are beneficial in improving soil nutrients and soil depth, reducing water run-off, preserving wildlife habitat, and of course, utilizing energy from the sun to produce food. Within three years, we'll be able to hire at least 15 full time employees in jobs ranging from administrative, maintenance, laboratory analysis, packaging, sales, etc. Providing educational tours to all age groups is a priority for us. We also make it a priority to utilize other local businesses for our various needs. It's the multiplier effect, one good act resulting in many others!

What We Need &

column2: >We need your help raising money for a butter boat! The equipment is $25
column3: >,500. We found an 800lb batch barrel churn for a great price, but it's a little smaller than we were looking for. Having the butter boat will help keep our operation efficient by allowing us to make two batches in one day. The idea, you drop the butter out of the churn into the boat, then move the boat over to the filling line and start churning another batch of butter while we're packing the first.

column1: We've put together some darn good rewards for your donation
column2: a custom made butter keeper, gift certificate from you local butcher, our favorite cookbooks, and <span style=""background-color: initial

column1: We're asking for help with this specific piece of equipment as it will help us get going in our own creamery faster. At the same time, we are applying for financing through traditional lenders as well as local and regional development agencies. The overall farmstead creamery project will require $900K in loans. This includes infrastructure upgrades to our existing building, equipment, and working capital. We were recently awarded $49,998 from a USDA Value Added Producer Grant, and this will go toward packaging for cultured butter, authentic buttermilk, sour cream and creme fraiche. We've already put in over $100,000 to get the business up and running. Your contribution will not be wasted
column2:
if we do not reach our goal the money we do raise will go toward the butter boat still, but we'll have to increase our loan amount. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, we understand. But please, if you can, help spread the word!

Big News:

Honest Gil is running for president. Click here to learn more!


Our
column6:
> NEW, $100,000  campaign goal:

Shepard Fairey (the artist who created the iconic Obama HOPE poster) donated these incredible new perks to help us reach our new goal and send Honest Gil to New Hampshire:

column1: Scroll down to learn more about these new perks.

America's biggest problems are going unsolved because our government is overrun by Big Money special interests and lobbyists. The amount of money corrupting our political system is at an all time high, so we're setting out to make ""fixing the corruption"" the #1 issue in America.
column4: > Enter, Gil Fulbright.
column6: >Gil is a satirical Senate candidate — an ""honest politician"" who will openly take any position on any issue... for the right price. We're running Gil for Senate in Kentucky during the most expensive Senate Race in American history between Senator Mitch McConnell and challenger Alison Lundergan Grimes.
column13:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

As seen on...

Why Kentucky?

(Note: We're sending Honest Gil to New Hampshire to help take down a sold-out candidate, but Gil is still running in Kentucky and will continue his campaign there through November.


In NH, we're partnering with Lawrence Lessig's crowdfunded Mayday PAC to help them achieve their mission of a Congress committed to fundamental election reforms in 2016. They've carefully selected a handful of races for 2014, and invited us to help tip the scales in a New Hampshire primary where one candidate is committed to fixing our corrupt political system, and the other is a notorious Big Money sellout.


We set out to get people in Kentucky, and across the nation, talking about fixing our corrupt political system. Because of the overwhelming success of our campaign to date, we've decided to go even further.)


The race between McConnell and Grimes is on pace to cost an unprecedented $100 million. Over three quarters of both candidate’s money is coming from outside of Kentucky, including a who's who of big money special interests. When it costs that much to win an election, the candidates become dependent on their funders, not on the people they're supposed to represent. As a result, the issues that matter to the people go unsolved.

Because control of the Senate could come down to the Kentucky race, the national news media will be watching
column14:
it's the perfect opportunity to steer the conversation away from the usual partisan grandstanding, and change the conversation to money's stranglehold on American governance — and how to fix it.


Kentucky isn’t an isolated case. The cost of running for office has exploded in recent years, pushing politicians in both parties to spend more time raising money from special interests and lobbyists, and less time working for the people they’re supposed to represent.


The plan

We're going to use Gil's presence in the Kentucky race as a launchpad into a major national campaign. He'll crash campaign events, run “honest political ads” on TV and the radio, and do whatever it takes to get the whole country talking about money in politics corruption. We’re renting a campaign bus, slapping Gil’s beautiful face on it, and hitting the campaign trail to bring some much-needed honesty to one of the most expensive Senate campaigns in American history. 


What will this actually accomplish?
column15:
/>

It's time to stop doing business as usual, change the national conversation and start demanding new laws to defend the people's government from Big Money corruption.
column17:
>Americans pay the price for our corrupt political system every day. From the economy to the environment, taxes to government waste, it's the root cause of nearly every major problem we face. Yet the press continues to treat the problem as a fringe, “wonky” issue. Gil's campaign is designed to help change that.

Satire has worked before, and it can work again. A recent study found that Comedy Central’s Colbert Report has done more to raise the profile of money’s corrupting influence than any other ""news"" source. A well-executed satirical campaign can generate unprecedented national attention for one of the most important issues of our time, and educate millions of Americans about the corruption that’s paralyzing our political system.

We will also drive hundreds of thousands to join the growing movement to pass tough new anti-corruption laws and get our country back on track. Our non-partisan, non-profit campaign, Represent.Us, is already more than 450,000 people strong and has reached over 6 million Americans.

column1:
We're funded, but we're not finished yet. Here's what we've got in store:

We met our original goal of $20,000 so Gil is headed to Kentucky to...
• Rent a campaign bus - With Gil's face on it, of course. The bus will serve as headquarters for Gil and our volunteers and help them tail the McConnell and Grimes campaigns.
• Launch Gil's campaign - Fund Gil's campaign launch at one of Kentucky's most well-known political events.
• Put ""Honest Political Ads"" on the air - We'll support Gil's campaign with a modest TV, Radio and Internet ad-buy. The more money we raise, the more attention we can draw to this issue.

column3:
>

  • Run a billboard campaign- Launch a series of honest political ad billboards in key media markets to drum up public and media awareness of Gil’s campaign, and pressure the other candidates to respond.
column6:
>

  • Bring in Kentucky's best PR firms - To make sure Gil gets front-page news, TV and radio interviews, and a shot at landing our story on the Daily Show, Colbert Report, or Last Week Tonight.
column9:
>

  • Launch a full-on ad blitz - Run honest politics ads in print, on the radio, and on air. The more money we raise, the more public and media attention we can draw. 

    • We raised $75,000 to…

    • Hit the internet, hard - Run Gil's Honest issue ads on the YouTube, directly targeted at political campaigns nationwide. People looking searching for actual political ads will unwittingly be exposed to Gil's Honest — we hope it'll be a breath of fresh air!

    If we raise $100,000 or more, we can...
column10:
>Help take down a sold-out politician - Larry Lessig's Mayday PAC is a crowdfunded ""Super PAC to end all Super PACs."" They're only supporting candidates who pledge ""fundamental reform"" of how our elections are funded. In Kentucky, Honest Gil Fulbright got the whole nation talking about how crazy a $100million election is. In New Hampshire, he'll show America that politicians who support a corrupt system are even crazier — and he'll do whatever it takes to make sure they don't vote for 'em.

New perks donated by Shepard Fairey
column12:
/>


Here's what Shepard Fairey had to say about it:

“I am supporting the Gil Fulbright campaign to help shine a light on the big lie that we're constantly being fed…that deregulating and giving tax breaks and wasteful subsidies to cronies and special interests is good for everyday Americans. These powerful special interests finance campaigns and ads in the shadows...so we’re setting out to make ‘fixing the corruption’ the #1 issue in America.”

FAQs

""Who are you people?""

We’re Represent.Us — a non-partisan, nonprofit, grassroots campaign working to end the culture of legalized corruption that has come to define modern politics. 

We use local politics, viral media and grassroots organizing to push for an overhaul of campaign finance, strict lobbying and conflict of interest laws, and an end to secret political money. You can learn more about who we are and what we do at http://represent.us, and read up on the policy changes we support at http://anticorruptionact.org.

column3:
/>


""Will Gil take votes from Grimes or McConnell?""
Nope! Gil Fulbright is a purely satirical candidate. ""Gil Fulbright"" isn't a real person, and his name will not appear on the ballot. 


""Is this a Republican thing or a Democrat thing?""
It's neither. We are a strictly non-partisan movement, and our membership consists of everyone from progressives to Tea Party conservatives. Confronting the kind of systemic corruption that’s paralyzing our government will require a massive movement — That means putting partisan differences aside and focusing on where we agree.

They're only supporting candidates who pledge ""fundamental reform"" of how our elections are funded. In Kentucky, Honest Gil Fulbright got the whole nation talking about how crazy a $100million election is. In New Hampshire, he'll show America that politicians who support a corrupt system are even crazier — and he'll do whatever it takes to make sure they don't vote for 'em.New perks donated by Shepard FaireyHere's what Shepard Fairey had to say about it:“I am supporting the Gil Fulbright campaign to help shine a light on the big lie that we're constantly being fed…that deregulating and giving tax breaks and wasteful subsidies to cronies and special interests is good for everyday Americans. These powerful special interests finance campaigns and ads in the shadows...so we’re setting out to make ‘fixing the corruption’ the #1 issue in America.”FAQs""Who are you people?""We’re Represent.Us — a non-partisan, nonprofit, grassroots campaign working to end the culture of legalized corruption that has come to define modern politics. We use local politics, viral media and grassroots organizing to push for an overhaul of campaign finance, strict lobbying and conflict of interest laws, and an end to secret political money. You can learn more about who we are and what we do at http://represent.us, and read up on the policy changes we support at http://anticorruptionact.org.

""Will Gil take votes from Grimes or McConnell?""Nope! Gil Fulbright is a purely satirical candidate. ""Gil Fulbright"" isn't a real person, and his name will not appear on the ballot. ""Is this a Republican thing or a Democrat thing?""It's neither. We are a strictly non-partisan movement, and our membership consists of everyone from progressives to Tea Party conservatives. Confronting the kind of systemic corruption that’s paralyzing our government will require a massive movement — That means putting partisan differences aside and focusing on where we agree.

Americans as a beloved national pastime, but many don't realize that Nicaragua
shares this passion equally. Unlike most
American children, Nicaraguan youths have significantly less access to baseball
equipment, especially gloves, and often play barehanded or use shared, ""community"" gloves. A baseball glove can be a real luxury in a rural
brought a modest number of used baseball gloves to San Juan del Sur, a small city in
southwest Nicaragua. They were warmly accepted and
appreciated in a way that we cannot readily appreciate. A glove that might be
considered old and worn here would be seen as a welcomed gift in

Nicaragua! 

Gloves Go Far founder, Bill Trabilcy, is joining forces with local initiatives to help Nicaraguan youths enjoy our shared national pastime by annually collecting and distributing as many gloves as possible.
column2: >The Newton-San Juan del Sur Sister City project, http://sanjuandelsursistercityproject.wordpress... , is the collaborative team that helps us ensure that the gloves you donate end up in the right hands. They have been doing superb work in Nicaragua since 1994, including the introduction of low tech household water filters, low smoke home cook-stoves, and most of all, the creation of an unprecedented adult school for high school drop outs.
column4: >strong connections with the local community in San Juan del Sur, you can be certain your donations are going directly to the children in need, and the best news?  Bill goes to Nicaragua himself to see the project through to the end.  You can check out Bill's unique story, and his past travels to Nicaragua, at our blog:

column1: Gloves Go Far would like to ask YOU to donate to our cause.  Since many folks don't have a glove, but they want to help, we are inviting you to donate to our cause here.  ALL proceeds will go to purchasing used gloves, or be put toward luggage and shipping costs. (New gloves unfortunately would make GGF an importer or merchant, and can complicate things).  Donate what you can - every little bit helps.  And THANK YOU from Gloves Go Far.

column2: >A lot of 4-8 baseball gloves on eBay can run around $50.00.  This roughly  works out to costing GGF around $10.00 per glove.  This method is significantly cheaper than purchasing new, and the gloves are still in very good condition.  Especially to a child that typically plays bare-handed.

column1: Americans and Nicaraguans share this national pastime!  In this small way, we can come together.  Many Nicaraguans in rural areas have poor living conditions with limited healthcare and educational opportunities, and working with the Sister City Projects has made a big difference there.  But Gloves Go Far believes that children still deserve a chance to just play.  What is a small expense for us would mean the world to them - or, at least a day of being a World Series Champion!

If you are unable to donate money - that's okay!  Gloves Go Far actually wants people to SEND us their used gloves.  The address is on our Facebook page.  You can also help by ""liking"" our Facebook, following our blog, pledging to our Facebook Cause, and sharing this with your friends.  That's not enough?  You can start your own ""GGF Glove Drive"" in your community.  Simply collect as many new and used gloves as you can and send them to GGF.  We will even help with the shipping if necessary.
Americans as a beloved national pastime, but many don't realize that Nicaragua
shares this passion equally. Unlike most
American children, Nicaraguan youths have significantly less access to baseball
equipment, especially gloves, and often play barehanded or use shared, ""community"" gloves. A baseball glove can be a real luxury in a rural
brought a modest number of used baseball gloves to San Juan del Sur, a small city in
southwest Nicaragua. They were warmly accepted and
appreciated in a way that we cannot readily appreciate. A glove that might be
considered old and worn here would be seen as a welcomed gift in

Nicaragua! Gloves Go Far founder, Bill Trabilcy, is joining forces with local initiatives to help Nicaraguan youths enjoy our shared national pastime by annually collecting and distributing as many gloves as possible. The Newton-San Juan del Sur Sister City project, http://sanjuandelsursistercityproject.wordpress... , is the collaborative team that helps us ensure that the gloves you donate end up in the right hands. They have been doing superb work in Nicaragua since 1994, including the introduction of low tech household water filters, low smoke home cook-stoves, and most of all, the creation of an unprecedented adult school for high school drop outs.  With such strong connections with the local community in San Juan del Sur, you can be certain your donations are going directly to the children in need, and the best news?  Bill goes to Nicaragua himself to see the project through to the end.  You can check out Bill's unique story, and his past travels to Nicaragua, at our blog: http://glovesgofar.blogspot.com

Gloves Go Far would like to ask YOU to donate to our cause.  Since many folks don't have a glove, but they want to help, we are inviting you to donate to our cause here.  ALL proceeds will go to purchasing used gloves, or be put toward luggage and shipping costs. (New gloves unfortunately would make GGF an importer or merchant, and can complicate things).  Donate what you can - every little bit helps.  And THANK YOU from Gloves Go Far.

A lot of 4-8 baseball gloves on eBay can run around $50.00.  This roughly  works out to costing GGF around $10.00 per glove.  This method is significantly cheaper than purchasing new, and the gloves are still in very good condition.  Especially to a child that typically plays bare-handed.

Americans and Nicaraguans share this national pastime!  In this small way, we can come together.  Many Nicaraguans in rural areas have poor living conditions with limited healthcare and educational opportunities, and working with the Sister City Projects has made a big difference there.  But Gloves Go Far believes that children still deserve a chance to just play.  What is a small expense for us would mean the world to them - or, at least a day of being a World Series Champion!

If you are unable to donate money - that's okay!  Gloves Go Far actually wants people to SEND us their used gloves.  The address is on our Facebook page.  You can also help by ""liking"" our Facebook, following our blog, pledging to our Facebook Cause, and sharing this with your friends.  That's not enough?  You can start your own ""GGF Glove Drive"" in your community.  Simply collect as many new and used gloves as you can and send them to GGF.  We will even help with the shipping if necessary.

>WE WANT TO HELP YOU, BY GIVING YOU THE TOOLS AND SUPPORT TO MAKE SURE YOUR VOICE IS HEARD AND UNDERSTOOD FOR GENERATIONS. 

Vimty believes that one of the most important things you can give your loved ones is a plan.  That every citizen should have an electronic form of an Advance Directive. Our national campaign is to empower every individual to take control of their choices. The Vimty team is determined to inform and encourage all citizens from all ages, races, gender, political  stance and economical status. 


OUR HOW

column1: Building easy to use software leveraging video where appropriate, supported by engaging software, thoughtful questions and a marketplace of facilitators to help you understand the decisions that are most meaningful to you and your loved ones.

Our team is highly skilled in medicine, law, bioethics, healthcare technology, and healthcare policy. Each member of our team has had experience with assisting either a patient and/or a loved one in the process of end of life care.

Vimty believes that ""One of the most important things you can give your loved ones, is a Plan.""

column1: 60% of Americans want to make sure their family member are not burdened by making tough decisions for them.
Sadly 56% of Americans have not made their wishes known.
If given a choice 70% of Americans wish to be at home in their last days.
Ironically, 70% of Americans end up in a hospital during their last several weeks instead.
Curiously, 80% of American want to discuss end of life decisions with their doctor.
column4: >Yet just 7% of Americans have reported doing so.
>Surprisingly, 82% of Americans believe it is important to write all of their medical wishes down to paper.

The future of Vimty is transforming the way we complete and think about Advance Care Planning. Vimty will offer a spectrum of tools and information to complete a thoughtful and compassionate end of life plan. We believe that every citizen should possess an advance directive regardless of age, creed, or religion.

Vimty provides a spectrum of services that address the needs of patients throughout life. This includes a quick and simple option for younger individuals as well as a more thoughtful exploration using professionally facilitated recorded video conference calls for those with advanced age and/or illness. All of this information is stored electronically where families, physicians, EMTs, can retrieve these digital assets when difficult decisions arise.The importance of Empowering every Citizen with an Advance Care PlanVimty believes that ""One of the most important things you can give your loved ones, is a Plan."" when:

column1: 60% of Americans want to make sure their family member are not burdened by making tough decisions for them.
Sadly 56% of Americans have not made their wishes known.
If given a choice 70% of Americans wish to be at home in their last days.
Ironically, 70% of Americans end up in a hospital during their last several weeks instead.
Curiously, 80% of American want to discuss end of life decisions with their doctor. Yet just 7% of Americans have reported doing so.
Surprisingly, 82% of Americans believe it is important to write all of their medical wishes down to paper.
Thats why we created Vimty! Vimty is providing a revolutionary way to think about and perform Advanced Care Planning.
We created a platform for users of all ages to express their medical wishes.

The future of Vimty is transforming the way we complete and think about Advance Care Planning. Vimty will offer a spectrum of tools and information to complete a thoughtful and compassionate end of life plan. We believe that every citizen should possess an advance directive regardless of age, creed, or religion. As a way to reach as many people as possible we are beginning our campaign with our younger and healthier citizens by using a Facebook app and mobile app to be available by the end of June in Beta. Vimty is moving the focus of Advance Care Planning away from documents created by lawyers who may or may not have medical expertise. Toward Video assets created by You using our software, allowing collaboration with your healthcare providers, and loved ones, often facilitated by our professionals and extremely valuable family heirlooms that Give You a Voice!THE PERKS:  YOUR WALLET CARD

“Physicians advocating to eliminate the damaging health consequences that can result from negative interactions with the criminal justice system”

Thank you for your interest! We are raising money to create a professional, permanent internet home for our new organization: Physicians for Criminal Justice Reform. These funds will also help us to establish PfCJR as a 501c3 non-profit organization. Whatever you can give would be greatly appreciated!

ABOUT US

Physicians for Criminal Justice Reform (PfCJR) was founded by a group of physicians who were struck by the myriad of ways that negative encounters with the criminal justice system lead to detrimental health consequences. We firmly believe that changing the interaction between the criminal justice system and individuals of targeted populations will ultimately lead to improved health of targeted communities.  As such, our members have made the commitment to be leaders of criminal justice reform by using our medical expertise to:
• Increase awareness and knowledge of the bidirectional relationship between health and the criminal justice system
• Serve as a fund of knowledge, education and training for local, state and national health and justice systems
• Lobby for criminal justice reform surrounding our core issues

CORE ISSUES

Physicians for Criminal Justice Reform seeks to support the creation of a humane, egalitarian justice system by advocating for the following reforms.


Decriminalization of mental health and addictive disorders

• Across the nation, individuals with severe mental illness are three times more likely to be in a jail or prison than in a mental health facility and 40 percent of individuals with a severe mental illness will have spent some time in their lives in either jail, prison, or community corrections.

• It has been shown that about 20 percent of prison inmates have a serious mental illness, 30 to 60 percent have substance abuse problems and, when including broad-based mental illnesses, the percentages increase significantly.

• An estimated 50 percent of males and 75 percent of female inmates in state prisons, and 75 percent of females and 63 percent of male inmates in jails, will experience a mental health problem requiring mental health services in any given year.
• Despite 45 million drug related arrests in the U.S., rates of addiction remain unchanged and overdose deaths are at an all-time high.
Reform of the juvenile justice system to identify and divert at risk adolescents.
• On any given night in America, 10,000 children are held in adult jails and prisons.
• As many as 70 percent of youth in the juvenile justice system have a diagnosable mental health disorder.
• Youth housed in adult jails are 36 times more likely to commit suicide than are youth housed in juvenile detention facilities.

• According to research by the Bureau of Justice Statistics, youth under the age of 18 represented 21 percent of all substantiated victims of inmate-on-inmate sexual violence in jails in 2005, and 13 percent in 2006 – surprisingly high since only one percent of jail inmates are juveniles.
Provision of adequate access to physical and psychiatric health care for current inmates.

• Medical experts say inmates typically experience the effects of age sooner than do people outside prison because of issues such as substance use disorders, inadequate preventive and primary care before incarceration, and stress linked to the isolation and sometimes-violent environment of prison.
• Prison inmates have a higher incidence of chronic and infectious diseases, such as AIDS and hepatitis C, and mental illness than that of the general population.
• The United States continues to have one of the highest incarceration rates in the world, with 5 percent of the world population, but nearly 25 percent of the world’s prisoners.

• By ending mass incarceration, correctional physician resources will be better matched to demand and fewer individuals with be exposed to the stressors of incarceration that lead to higher rates of chronic illness
• About 66% of prisoners and 40% of jail inmates with a chronic condition at the time of interview reported taking prescription medication.

STRATEGIES

Physicians for Criminal Justice Reform seeks to support the creation of a humane, egalitarian justice system by using the following strategies.


Research Promotion

• PfCJR will increase awareness of the bidirectional relationship between health and the criminal justice system for targeted populations by centralizing health-related criminal justice data from various private, public, governmental and non-governmental organizations.

• PfCJR will serve as a fund of knowledge, education and training for local, state and national health and justice systems by providing white papers, webinars, keynote speakers, panelists and consulting services to individuals and organizations who have the capacity to drive criminal justice reform.

• PfCJR will maintain a social media and internet presence to increase awareness and knowledge of the bidirectional relationship between health and the criminal justice system using our own original content and content from key partners.
• PfCJR will circulate petitions to our members and issue press releases to major news outlets to familiarize the public with our core issues.

• PfCJR member physicians will be made available to media outlets to discuss the medical impact of the criminal justice system on targeted communities when key events are being discussed in the media.

• PfCJR will lobby for criminal justice reform surrounding our core issues by partnering with existing lobbying organizations to ensure the health-related consequences of our current criminal justice system remains a primary motivator for reform.
• PfCJR will create opportunities for collaborative problem-solving by providing current data directly to local, state and federal legislators.
• PfCJR will partner with like-minded organizations to leverage multidisciplinary expertise in an effort to drive coordinated, cross-systemic change.
• American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatrists
• American Academy of Psychiatry and the Law
• Juvenile Justice Geography, Policy, Practice and Statistics

STRATEGIESPhysicians for Criminal Justice Reform seeks to support the creation of a humane, egalitarian justice system by using the following strategies.Research Promotion

PfCJR will increase awareness of the bidirectional relationship between health and the criminal justice system for targeted populations by centralizing health-related criminal justice data from various private, public, governmental and non-governmental organizations.

PfCJR will serve as a fund of knowledge, education and training for local, state and national health and justice systems by providing white papers, webinars, keynote speakers, panelists and consulting services to individuals and organizations who have the capacity to drive criminal justice reform.

PfCJR will maintain a social media and internet presence to increase awareness and knowledge of the bidirectional relationship between health and the criminal justice system using our own original content and content from key partners.
PfCJR will circulate petitions to our members and issue press releases to major news outlets to familiarize the public with our core issues.
PfCJR member physicians will be made available to media outlets to discuss the medical impact of the criminal justice system on targeted communities when key events are being discussed in the media.

PfCJR will lobby for criminal justice reform surrounding our core issues by partnering with existing lobbying organizations to ensure the health-related consequences of our current criminal justice system remains a primary motivator for reform.
PfCJR will create opportunities for collaborative problem-solving by providing current data directly to local, state and federal legislators.
PfCJR will partner with like-minded organizations to leverage multidisciplinary expertise in an effort to drive coordinated, cross-systemic change.
American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatrists
American Academy of Psychiatry and the Law
Juvenile Justice Geography, Policy, Practice and Statistics

>HEKATEC is a Korean company specialized in manufacturing EMS training equipment. Since the introduction of wireless EMS in Korea for the first time in 2014, we have researched, tested, applied, and modified EMS equipment and training methods. Our main focal point was to make improvements to EMS. As research progressed for seven years, we manufacture and produce wireless EMS training equipment and supply products to fitness centers, yoga centers, Pilates, and rehabilitation centers of large companies. Also, the company has received 2 patents for EMS manufacturing technology, 6 design registrations, and 2 KC certifications. We, HEKATEC, are happy to release an all-in-one EMS legging that combines convenience, durability, and cost-effectiveness.
