Want to help but cannot afford it at the present time?
Well you can still help us by sending this link to your friends and family, place the link onto your social media sites and use the Indiegogo share tools to help us get the word out!
Plus we have hundreds of vacancies in all countries for GroundAngels to support our fundraising efforts, part-time or full-time. Email with your CV too:-
A new fundraising programme to enable SkyAngels to fly worldwide helping others when no one else will or can.

Free from political, religious and most importantly commercial considerations we wish to operate an international air ambulance & rescue foundation with our own fleet of aircraft and helicopters. Help us to save money on our aircraft charter costs and give us the freedom to make instant life saving decisions.

We prefer to fly for free if possible or if we have too we only charge the direct operating costs.....no mark-up or profit is added. We believe every person should have the chance of a life saving flight or even a last flight home to be with their families when all else fails and they need to be with their family in their last hours.

On Indiegogo every week you will see people trying to raise money for life-saving or life-enhancing flights. SkyAngels will offer these people and others worldwide a free or non-profit emergency flight on a dedicated air ambulance jet. We also offer highly qualified medical crews for escort missions on airlines for those patients that do not require a dedicated air ambulance jet. We have operational contacts with over 90% of the worlds airlines and airports.

When an aeromedical flight request is received by our emergency operations room we ask for all the medical facts, contact the patients doctors, contact the receiving hospital and with due diligence cover all aspects of the flight request. SkyAngels offer a full international bed-bed service. Please see our list of missions we have been asked to complete in the last few weeks!FacesforAngels:
Become a Faces4Angels Patron today and have a photo of your face on our jet!
This photo could be of either you, a family member or a lost loved one, flying with us every day. Your face on our jet, helping others. We hope you like the idea and become one of our Faces4Angels.
We estimate that we could have 60,000 Faces4Angels photos on each Jet and we need more than one aircraft to complete the missions we are being asked to do every week.

Your photo will also be on our website and show that you are a Faces4Angels Patron or even a Patron Jet Shareholder. You will be able to write a short message to go with your photo on our website making it even more personal. Plus we can link this to your website, Facebook, Twitter and other social media sites.
Your Faces4Angels photo will enable us too..

Purchase outright a jet that will be a pre-owned example that can easily be converted into a air ambulance jet. The Gulfstream G111 could carry up to four stretcher's, infant incubators and a full emergency equipment fit, which would make these Flying Hospitals very very rare. We also like to fly with some family members on board if mission fit allows.

We require 3 aircraft immediately subject to funding. Estimate required for all 3 jets is in the region of $3M+. This campaign is for the first jet but if you like it we will carry on to purchase the 3 aircraft we require. Estimated operating costs of 3 jets worldwide is $6M. Willie Wilson, a 43 year old man, married for 21 years with 3 children was diagnosed with smoldering multiple myeloma, (a blood cancer that develops in the bone marrow) in October 2010 after several tests and a bone marrow biopsy showed 30% plasma cells. At that time his oncologist stated that he ""just needed monitoring"" as multiple myeloma is a very slow progressing disease. In November 2011 after increased fatigue, pain and difficulty walking, Willie was diagnosed with Stage 3 Multiple Myeloma. Skeletal surveys and CT scans revealed a large mass commonly called a plasmacytoma in the right hip bone, several small masses in the sacral bones and lower lumbar spine and several tiny lesions in the skull. Bone Marrow Biopsy results showed 90% malignant plasma cells. He has undergone multimodal neoplastic (radiation and chemotherapy) therapy but due to severe peripheral neuropathy and pulmonary emboli (lung blood clots) his chemotherapy was discontinued. The decision was made to proceed with an autologous stem cell transplant. He was referred to the Loyola Medical Cancer Center in Maywood IL. and is currently undergoing the stem cell transplant that began on July 2, 2012.

Willie is a devoted husband of 21 years and father of three with two of his children currently in college. He worked at ADM for the past 13 years until he became unable to continue his employment due to his disability.

We are asking your help to cover medical expenses, medications not covered by insurance, hotel and travel expenses related to the family being away from home for an extended period of time while Willie receives treatement. Any and all donations will be greatly appreciated. Please pass this information on to help us spread the word.
Thank you for your help, let's help Willie.

Bumper plates are extremely useful when performing heavy lifts.  They are designed to be the same height allowing you to drop them at any point while minimizing noise and damage to the floor.  Unfortunately, this same principle makes adding or removing the plates very difficult. Traditionally,there have only been a handful of solutions

None of these options are convenient.  People don't always have a lifting partner to help, you likely don't want to tire yourself out attempting to re rack the weight, and most gyms don't have a barbell jack.

The Bumper Block!  We designed this tool to be so small it can fit on your key chain, yet effective enough to accomplish everything the above methods do.  Simply set the Bumper Block on the floor, roll the first weight onto the block, then freely load or unload the bar with ease.  Whether you go to a fitness center or have your own home gym, the Bumper Block is the ultimate lifting partner!

The Bumper Block was designed to be EFFECTIVE and CONVENIENT.  The effectiveness is worthless if it is not something that is easy to carry around with you.  It is for that reason we incorporated the following design aspects:
Financial support.  Your financial support will help make this product a reality!  We want to offer you some special ""perks"" to thank you for supporting us. Perks:

• If this product is NOT something you would be personally interested in, feel free to select the ""BACK IT"" option at the top of the page.  This allows you to give ANY amount of funds to support us without receiving an actual product.  Whether you give $5 or $50, we REALLY appreciate your support!
Word of mouth.  If you know someone who loves to lift weights, we encourage you to share this web page with them!  A great way to do this is through social media.

Feedback.  Is this a product you might be interested in?  We want to hear what you think about the Bumper Block!  What do you love and what would you change? We would also love to hear an honest review once you receive your Bumper Block!  (Feel free to email us at info@thebumperblock.com)

The Bumper Block is founded by Jordan Flom and Michael Inouye, who have been friends since they were 3 years old!  Jordan is a serial entrepreneur and Michael is a design engineer.  Most importantly, both are lovers of fitness.  Together they make the perfect team for the creation of the Bumper Block!

A provisional patent for the Bumper Block has already been filed.  Application includes details about the shape, use of the product, key chain functionality, and magnet placement.

column2: >Say goodbye to your old, bulky and bacteria-filled toothbrush holder.
>What makes the Cubecoid different from every other toothbrush holder in the market right now?

column1: If you hate putting your toothbrush in a ziplock bag or on the sink counter-top while travelling, the Cubecoid is perfect for you. The Cubecoid is both portable and functional.

Most families store their toothbrushes in a single toothbrush holder or on a counter-top. According to an article on Huffington Post, bacteria can spread from one to the other if the heads are touching. This bacteria that can cause oral infections such as gingivitis as well as serious gum diseases.
The bottom of a traditional toothbrush holder is a playground for bacteria growth and nasty water buildup which is unattractive and unhygienic.

According to BreathMD, a good toothbrush holder is one that holds the toothbrush upright, has good ventilation, and is made so other toothbrushes do not touch each other as to prevent cross contamination.
The Cubecoid sticks to most flat and smooth non-porous surfaces such as mirrors, dry wall, tiles etc. and can be re-used over and over again without losing its grip!

Cleaning is super easy.

 
The Cubecoid can be used over and over again. Simply use some tape or water to clean the Nano-Suction strip and it will work like new!
 
 

Will it fit?

The Cubecoid has a large enough opening to fit most large razors and toothbrushes. The opening is approximately 0.9 inches in length and width.

 

Rewards

Stretch Goals

Stretch goals are unlocked at $6,000!

Media Kit

 Please click on the following link to access our Media Kit: http://bit.ly/2aw1f3p

Contact Info

 Feel free to get in contact with us: info@cubecoid.com

FAQs

Why is funding in USD?

Given the current situation of the exchange rate, we are choosing to raise funds in USD mainly because our manufacturers invoice us in USD. 

Why isn't Canadian Shipping Free?

Those living in Canada know how expensive shipping is within Canada. Shipping in Canada can be almost three times as expensive as shipping to United States and Internationally and that is why we have to charge shipping within Canada.

column2: >A story of breakdown and recovery, a pack of practices – and a bold new way of talking about mental illness
column3:
> 

Torchlight is a beautiful print publication candidly documenting one man’s journey from breakdown to recovery. It comes with a pack of “Practice Cards”, which show 55 daily ideas and actions for dealing with anxiety and depression or living in recovery. Shuffle the pack, pick two cards, and build positive habits every day – Practice Cards are a way to make a game out of getting better.  

More and more people are opening up about their struggles and searching for new ways to live with and talk about issues such as depression and anxiety. Torchlight &
column4: Practice Cards offer exactly that – and this campaign aims to bring them back into print and to reach a much broader audience.
column5: >About Torchlight and the Practice Cards
column6:
> 

An experienced writer and editor, Kevin Braddock made Torchlight and the Practice Cards after suffering a major depressive episode in 2014. At the brink of suicide one day he asked for help, help came and he began slowly to recover. Guessing that speaking openly about breakdown, recovery, depression, and anxiety might help others deal with these problems, he decided to publish about his experiences and share the practices he learned.

After Kevin’s story was picked up by Observer magazine, the first edition of Torchlight &
column7:
the Practice Cards (designed by Enver Hadzijaj) sold out within a week. Most recently Laura Davis joined the team as business strategist, and along with our network of collaborators we share a vision of using these products as new ways of people to ask for help, tell stories and share their recovery practices.

The response to the Torchlight project so far has been phenomenally positive. Kevin’s story for the Observer was shared 10,000 times, and further testimonials to the project include:
column8: >“I cannot recommend Practice Cards more highly. Their simplicity is deceptive – they perfectly encapsulate how small daily steps, self compassion and connecting with others are absolutely invaluable in getting well and staying well. They’re more accessible than an app, they look nice, feel nice, they’re imaginative and what’s more, they will add some joy to your day” – Dr Jane McNeill, psychologist specialising in anxiety disorders and trauma
column9: >“I've been using the Practice Cards now for six months and they have made a huge difference to my life. It's so straightforward: shuffle the pack, deal yourself a couple of cards and you have two wonderfully engaging prompts to take you through the day” – David Baker, writer &
column11: >“I just wanted to email to say how amazing Torchlight is. I’ve read every word. So bold and candid and honest and raw AND compelling. It’s about so much more than depression. There’s so much everyone can relate to whatever their state of mind right now”  – Andrew Diprose, Creative Director, Wired UK
column12: >“Anyone interested in magazines, storytelling and mental health should have a look at this. It's really, really good, and completely original”– Richard Benson, former Editor, The Face magazine, author of The Farm and The Valley
column13: >“Practice Cards are a readily accessible tool for anyone who wants to carve out a bit of the day to look after their mental health. They don't demand continued devotion as a meditation app might – pick them up and use them as and when you really need to"" – Charlotte Hillenbrand, Director of People, Made by Many
column14: >“Torchlight System offers fantastically useful tools. Students find it difficult to be open about their mental health and sensitive issues, especially with the pressures they are under today, but Kevin’s project has the ability to give students a cool and fun forum where they can speak freely, and break down barriers and stigma” – Derek Moir, Head of Humanities, The Brit School, London
column17: >Read about Torchlight on AIGA, telegraph.co.uk, Magculture, Positive.News and Hole &
column20: >People are talking openly about mental illness today. These products stimulate the conversation
column22:
> 

But there's more to do: mental illness is on the rise in the United Kingdom, and suicide is now the leading killer of men under 45 in the UK today. Young people in particular are suffering in greater numbers than ever: the Guardian reports that number of students who disclosed a mental health problem in their first year rose fivefold to reach 15,395 in a decade. We believe more can be done to assist people asking for help, addressing their challenges, and living with these conditions.

Storytelling alone cannot solve problems or guarantee recovery, but we believe tools such as Torchlight and the Practice Card can help anyone talk about, recover from, and understand problems such as anxiety and depression. We also believe that one day these should be available in every school, business, recovery centre, clinic, and community group. We would love the Torchlight System to inspire more people to #AskForHelp and encourage a new, collaborative and enriching way to recover.

We have a big vision, but we also know that what’s currently achievable by our small team is limited. Your backing will help us reach a second stage of distribution and awareness – at least double what has already been achieved – with perks offering the chance to nominate copies for people who might need it, and multiple-order packages suited to organisations and groups.

In their own right Torchlight and the Practice Cards are beautiful, original and innovative objects with genuine purpose and utility. These attractive items would look great on any collector’s shelf.
column24:
> 

We are aiming to raise £7,500 to produce:

• 1,000 copies of Torchlight

• 1,000 copies of the Practice Cards

• 1,000 “Ask For Help” pin badges

• 1,000 sticker packs, including the original “Love”, “Practice”, “Honesty” and “Ask For Help” design, plus three new designs.

Print is an expensive medium, but we know these objects have a tactility and pass-on-ability that cannot be matched by digital tools alone.
column25:
>Perks

We’re offering publications, Practice Cards, sticker packs and pin badges that carry the #AskFor Help message. These are available in single units as well as combinations, and we are offering special “Firegazing” packages offers for organisations in which Kevin will facilitate a storytelling meeting to share practices and stories, and invite others to share theirs.

You can also nominate these items: Torchlight and Practice Cards are popular products for people to give to loved ones who may need help. That’s why we are offering three-for-two “Nomination Packs” to enable buyers to get two bundles and gift a third free of charge to a person or institution who may benefit from it.

We also have special perks for organisations who may wish to support mental health awareness  and become official patrons of the Torchlight project.

Our £7,500 target is the minimum we would need to print 1,000 of each of the products. However, if we don’t reach that target, we will still be able to produce a smaller print run and deliver perks to our backers.
column26: >The impact: assisting people in asking for help and telling their stories
column27:
> 

The response to the Torchlight project from friends, buyers, professionals, clinicians and educators so far has been overwhelmingly positive: as Kevin’s own story suggests, being able to ask for help and talk about issues such as depression and anxiety honestly is crucial in recovery. But there is only so far we can take this on our own. With your help we can reach many more people who are suffering with anxiety and depression.

We aim to spread the message that it’s okay to #AskForHelp and that there are ways to talk about and recover from mental illness. We also strongly believe that creative uses of storytelling and publishing in this project will offer more people the chance to ask for help, and inspire others to tell their stories.

In the future, we are aiming to produce further collaborative volumes of stories and Practice Cards and take them into digital media to reach an even broader audience.

We also believe in giving back and reaching people from disadvantaged backgrounds. So we have made the commitment that for every 10 products that we sell, we will donate 1 to a person or organisation in need.
column30:
> 

We are a committed and experienced team combining skills in editing, writing, publishing, design, business strategy, running campaigns, building communities, public relations and more, and between us we had brought many print and digital products successfully to life. We are confident that we can deliver these products, and while printing and publishing aren’t without risks and the possibility of delays, we will be as transparent as possible with backers in the event of any delays or problems.
column31: >Other Ways You Can Help
column32:
> 

Please help us to  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to easily spread the word!
column34:
> 

Kevin Braddock, Founder

Kevin Braddock is founder of Torchlight System. He has over 20 years experience in print media as writer and editor, and has worked for GQ, Esquire, The Face and The Guardian in addition to editing, founding and publishing print magazines, including Winter (with Kati Krause and Ana Lessing) and the widely acclaimed Manzine. Most recently he was Embedded Storyteller at  digital product consultancy Made By Many. Find out more about Kevin at www.permitfullexpression.com

Enver Hadzijaj, Designer

Enver is a Berlin-based designer, artist and educator, and is design director for the Torchlight project. Collaborating over two years, he and Kevin conceived the Torchlight project and brought it to life between Berlin and London. www.enverhadzijaj.de

Laura Davis, Business Strategy

Laura Davis is a business strategist with over 10 years experience planning, designing and implementing changes in large corporations and small businesses. She has worked in a range of disciplines including management consultancy, retail banking, international development and digital innovation. She has successfully launched new products and services, built online and offline communities and run marketing campaigns. She now runs her own business mentoring company: www.laurahmdavis.com

 

","A story of breakdown and recovery, a pack of practices – and a bold new way of talking about mental illness Torchlight is a beautiful print publication candidly documenting one man’s journey from breakdown to recovery. It comes with a pack of “Practice Cards”, which show 55 daily ideas and actions for dealing with anxiety and depression or living in recovery. Shuffle the pack, pick two cards, and build positive habits every day – Practice Cards are a way to make a game out of getting better.  More and more people are opening up about their struggles and searching for new ways to live with and talk about issues such as depression and anxiety. Torchlight & Practice Cards offer exactly that – and this campaign aims to bring them back into print and to reach a much broader audience. About Torchlight and the Practice Cards An experienced writer and editor, Kevin Braddock made Torchlight and the Practice Cards after suffering a major depressive episode in 2014. At the brink of suicide one day he asked for help, help came and he began slowly to recover. Guessing that speaking openly about breakdown, recovery, depression, and anxiety might help others deal with these problems, he decided to publish about his experiences and share the practices he learned.After Kevin’s story was picked up by Observer magazine, the first edition of Torchlight & the Practice Cards (designed by Enver Hadzijaj) sold out within a week. Most recently Laura Davis joined the team as business strategist, and along with our network of collaborators we share a vision of using these products as new ways of people to ask for help, tell stories and share their recovery practices.The response to the Torchlight project so far has been phenomenally positive. Kevin’s story for the Observer was shared 10,000 times, and further testimonials to the project include: “I cannot recommend Practice Cards more highly. Their simplicity is deceptive – they perfectly encapsulate how small daily steps, self compassion and connecting with others are absolutely invaluable in getting well and staying well. They’re more accessible than an app, they look nice, feel nice, they’re imaginative and what’s more, they will add some joy to your day” – Dr Jane McNeill, psychologist specialising in anxiety disorders and trauma  “I've been using the Practice Cards now for six months and they have made a huge difference to my life. It's so straightforward: shuffle the pack, deal yourself a couple of cards and you have two wonderfully engaging prompts to take you through the day” – David Baker, writer & broadcaster“I just wanted to email to say how amazing Torchlight is. I’ve read every word. So bold and candid and honest and raw AND compelling. It’s about so much more than depression. There’s so much everyone can relate to whatever their state of mind right now”  – Andrew Diprose, Creative Director, Wired UK“Anyone interested in magazines, storytelling and mental health should have a look at this. It's really, really good, and completely original”– Richard Benson, former Editor, The Face magazine, author of The Farm and The Valley“Practice Cards are a readily accessible tool for anyone who wants to carve out a bit of the day to look after their mental health. They don't demand continued devotion as a meditation app might – pick them up and use them as and when you really need to"" – Charlotte Hillenbrand, Director of People, Made by Many“Torchlight System offers fantastically useful tools. Students find it difficult to be open about their mental health and sensitive issues, especially with the pressures they are under today, but Kevin’s project has the ability to give students a cool and fun forum where they can speak freely, and break down barriers and stigma” – Derek Moir, Head of Humanities, The Brit School, London CoverageRead about Torchlight on AIGA, telegraph.co.uk, Magculture, Positive.News and Hole & CornerPeople are talking openly about mental illness today. These products stimulate the conversation  But there's more to do: mental illness is on the rise in the United Kingdom, and suicide is now the leading killer of men under 45 in the UK today. Young people in particular are suffering in greater numbers than ever: the Guardian reports that number of students who disclosed a mental health problem in their first year rose fivefold to reach 15,395 in a decade. We believe more can be done to assist people asking for help, addressing their challenges, and living with these conditions.Storytelling alone cannot solve problems or guarantee recovery, but we believe tools such as Torchlight and the Practice Card can help anyone talk about, recover from, and understand problems such as anxiety and depression. We also believe that one day these should be available in every school, business, recovery centre, clinic, and community group. We would love the Torchlight System to inspire more people to #AskForHelp and encourage a new, collaborative and enriching way to recover.We have a big vision, but we also know that what’s currently achievable by our small team is limited. Your backing will help us reach a second stage of distribution and awareness – at least double what has already been achieved – with perks offering the chance to nominate copies for people who might need it, and multiple-order packages suited to organisations and groups.In their own right Torchlight and the Practice Cards are beautiful, original and innovative objects with genuine purpose and utility. These attractive items would look great on any collector’s shelf. How you can help We are aiming to raise £7,500 to produce:• 1,000 copies of Torchlight• 1,000 copies of the Practice Cards• 1,000 “Ask For Help” pin badges• 1,000 sticker packs, including the original “Love”, “Practice”, “Honesty” and “Ask For Help” design, plus three new designs.Print is an expensive medium, but we know these objects have a tactility and pass-on-ability that cannot be matched by digital tools alone.PerksWe’re offering publications, Practice Cards, sticker packs and pin badges that carry the #AskFor Help message. These are available in single units as well as combinations, and we are offering special “Firegazing” packages offers for organisations in which Kevin will facilitate a storytelling meeting to share practices and stories, and invite others to share theirs.You can also nominate these items: Torchlight and Practice Cards are popular products for people to give to loved ones who may need help. That’s why we are offering three-for-two “Nomination Packs” to enable buyers to get two bundles and gift a third free of charge to a person or institution who may benefit from it.We also have special perks for organisations who may wish to support mental health awareness  and become official patrons of the Torchlight project.Our £7,500 target is the minimum we would need to print 1,000 of each of the products. However, if we don’t reach that target, we will still be able to produce a smaller print run and deliver perks to our backers. The impact: assisting people in asking for help and telling their stories The response to the Torchlight project from friends, buyers, professionals, clinicians and educators so far has been overwhelmingly positive: as Kevin’s own story suggests, being able to ask for help and talk about issues such as depression and anxiety honestly is crucial in recovery. But there is only so far we can take this on our own. With your help we can reach many more people who are suffering with anxiety and depression.We aim to spread the message that it’s okay to #AskForHelp and that there are ways to talk about and recover from mental illness. We also strongly believe that creative uses of storytelling and publishing in this project will offer more people the chance to ask for help, and inspire others to tell their stories.In the future, we are aiming to produce further collaborative volumes of stories and Practice Cards and take them into digital media to reach an even broader audience.We also believe in giving back and reaching people from disadvantaged backgrounds. So we have made the commitment that for every 10 products that we sell, we will donate 1 to a person or organisation in need. Risks & Challenges We are a committed and experienced team combining skills in editing, writing, publishing, design, business strategy, running campaigns, building communities, public relations and more, and between us we had brought many print and digital products successfully to life. We are confident that we can deliver these products, and while printing and publishing aren’t without risks and the possibility of delays, we will be as transparent as possible with backers in the event of any delays or problems. Other Ways You Can Help Please help us to  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues.Use the Indiegogo share tools to easily spread the word! Our Team Kevin Braddock, FounderKevin Braddock is founder of Torchlight System. He has over 20 years experience in print media as writer and editor, and has worked for GQ, Esquire, The Face and The Guardian in addition to editing, founding and publishing print magazines, including Winter (with Kati Krause and Ana Lessing) and the widely acclaimed Manzine. Most recently he was Embedded Storyteller at  digital product consultancy Made By Many. Find out more about Kevin at www.permitfullexpression.comEnver Hadzijaj, DesignerEnver is a Berlin-based designer, artist and educator, and is design director for the Torchlight project. She has worked in a range of disciplines including management consultancy, retail banking, international development and digital innovation. She has successfully launched new products and services, built online and offline communities and run marketing campaigns. Who are we?

We are 8 students from the Royal Central School of Speech and Drama, 4 from BA Drama, Applied Theatre and Education and 4 from the Performance Making Diploma for Learning Disabled adults.
column2:
>We are making a show around the ideas of difference and inclusion, and touring it to post-16 colleges around London to disabled and non-disabled audiences.

Where's your money going?

We've received a small amount of funding from Fondation Bay to help us cover some of the cost of our travel to our venues, but at the moment, we're still desperate for cash or materials to help us cover:

- Costume - Set - Props - Travel - 

We know its unlikely that we'll reach £500 but every little helps, so any small contributions will be received with wholehearted gratitude, and currently, we're funding anything we do need from our own pockets so please help a few poor students out.

But why is this important?

Currently throughout the UK, adults with Learning Disabilities, in education particularly, are largely segregated despite 'inclusive' policies within colleges and other institutes. 

This project highlights that it IS possible for adults with similar interests and skills to work together collaboratively and create a professional performance. 

By touring our show to post-16 colleges of mixed ability audiences, we hope to show the students that it is possible and rewarding  to work in a truly inclusive environment.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that some people may not be able to contribute for whatever reason, but we'd love it if you could share our page!

We are doing a diary lottery with a chance to win up a £150 CASH PRIZE! Get in touch with any member of our team to find out more!
column5:
>Much Love,

Very Interesting Productions!

What is Anteater Quidditch?

We are Anteater Quidditch, a newly official quidditch team under United States Quidditch (USQ), and we are currently having a rough time getting our brooms off of the ground.
Between the fees for becoming official through USQ, becoming official through the University of California, Irvine, AND the costs of maintaining our equipment, we're, well- flat broke.

Our team is having difficulty saving money for one thing in particular: Western Regionals. Everyone has already contributed so much for our membership and equipment costs, and we don't want the life of our incredible sport to be sucked away by unrelenting expenses.

On what we feel is a more serious note, we don't want anyone on our team to feel left out due to the financial burden. Quidditch is based on inclusion and mutual support, and we want to make sure everyone who wants to play is able to.

We're asking for some help so that doesn't happen. Any funds raised that are not spent towards getting everybody to regionals will be used to cover much-needed equipment costs and future fundraising attempts.

Why Regionals?

Western Regionals is a tournament in Placer Valley, California on February 14-15th that all teams must attend if they want to be considered for the World Cup this season.

column5: >The money we raise will go to:

column1: $1,650 Hotels: USQ requires all attending teams to stay at a hotel in the region for a minimum of two nights. This is what it would cost to house all 20 of our players for the weekend of the tournament.
$356 Gas: Placer Valley is over 400 miles away from us. Driving is the cheapest option- this number is based on the average gas mileage of our team's available drivers and current gas prices.
• If we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will still apply the money to the tournament.
• If we exceed our fundraising goal, then we might be able to pay off the tournament in full, which our players would certainly appreciate!
<div>We will work hard to win and we will work hard to raise up our own team and its supporters. <b style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Our team is a family and we welcome any of our supporters into that family as well.
column3: > Know that if you do support us (in whatever way you can), you are a part of that family and we will look out for you in the future just as you have looked out for us now.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

    Can't donate but want to? Please share our link! Any and all publicity is much appreciated.

    Hello, I'm Hank Cap. Through the Veterans Administration I have received a colostomy and chemotherapy. I am grateful for this and my 725 a month SSDI.

    My condition is such, that I can no longer live in the south. When I sweat the colostomy bag fails and I need a cooler climate while undergoing chemotherapy. When I am on chemo I experience nausea and loss of appetite. I have found that marijuana offsets these symptoms and I will go where I can receive legal treatment. 

   I am moving to Portland, Oregon after happily being in New Orleans for thirty years. I have a ride with a kind friend to Oakland, California where I will take the train to Portland. I need help with the expenses of moving my belongings. Assist me in shipping one pallet (500 lbs) from New Orleans. In addition, I expect that my expenses will exceed my stipend by $200 a month for the first 3 months after I arrive. 

I am asking for $1,200.

$600 for the move

$600 for $50 a week for 12 weeks  

Come to my going away party on the 19th at 2735 C Toulouse in New Orleans where funders will Tar, Feather, and Run me out of town! There will also be a band and kind faces to wish me on my way. Thank you to everyone who has helped me with this journey, and thank you New Orleans!

UPDATE: I am now to the point where I can no longer it a solid substance. I need to have someone puree my food and feed it to me, as well as being unable to do the proper things I need to do on a daily basis to care for myself without the help of someone (that I still need to come help me). I am also becoming malnourished. My situation has become dire, and the hospital won't keep me there. Please help!

After having been passed around from service to service for the last few months, each telling me I fall just short of the criteria and recommending me to another agency, I have finally exhausted all possible avenues for care in my community. It seems not only doctors but even PSW support and home care do not recognize Red Skin Syndrome: YET. I plan to change this you see, not only once I am healed but right now.

I am two months in to my withdrawal and I realize that I cannot go any further without support. I've decided to give local youth and Personal Support Worker (PSW) students a job opportunity while giving them the chance to open their hearts and minds to my unique situation. I feel it in my heart that this is the right way. Without support I find daily routine next to impossible. Simply getting out of bed to use the washroom seems impossible at times. I know that once I get the proper supports in place I will heal in no time flat! Thank you for being part of this experience. You all have shown me that with love and support Nothing is impossible!

A very informative video about the disorder is:  http://youtu.be/bU2_ikRu4kA

This campaign is being put together by dear friends that are concerned about my well being and my daily struggles.

 http://www.itsan.org/

AWARENESS WEEK: http://youtu.be/ifKoHdIt22Y

column2: >Our planet is running out of drinkable water.
>By 2025, clean water will be in scarce supply.

column7: >""If we could ever competitively, at a cheap rate, get fresh water from saltwater, that would be in the long range interests of humanity and would really dwarf any other scientific accomplishment.""

column1: Worth a thousand words. All the water in the world (1.4087 billion cubic kilometers) including sea water, ice, lakes, rivers, ground water, clouds, etc. gathered into balls. Shown on the same scale as the Earth. It's shocking to see how little clean water is available for our use and now it's disappearing.
find out more about how the scarcity of safe water is affecting our world, please
We're here to change that with a new, revolutionary idea.
earth's seawater, artesian sources, and contaminated surface waters can
be purified into clean drinking water.
purification methods are old, expensive and leave waste that is
We have developed an innovative technical solution for the
use powerful ultrasound to blast impure water into particles of less
than 10 microns. These micro-particles evaporate and condense to
form pure water. This process leaves the salts, contaminants and sediments behind.
systems can be operated using waste heat and renewable energy,
which reduces costs for communal use.
costs are kept low, meaning this method can be efficiently deployed
Alpha prototype for our system has already been tested in a lab.
preparing for the next phase - building the Beta prototypes for
will be tested in a UK laboratory
up our team of scientists and engineers is Dr. Vladimir Shkapa, one
of the world's leading experts in the field of ultrasound.
Shkapa has years of experience working with NASA, the Ukraine
Space Agency and the Ukraine National Design Agency.
revolutionary ideas make our world a better place - we hope you'll
join us on our quest for a better future for our planet.
Our Alpha Prototype proved that our technology works in lab conditions. Now we plan to build the Beta Prototypes for commercial use.

We need to build 3 Beta Prototypes, and the projected cost for building these is $300,000 USD. We need three of them to ensure that we can perform tests at the highest regimes possible and should some tests damage a prototype or internal details we will have immediate back-ups to continue our work.
Aquavus Beta Prototypes will employ unique ultrasound units capable
of a spray of a minimum of 10 litres per hour, producing 5-micron
droplets, and consuming a maximum of 200-300 watts of electrical

From the Beta Prototypes we will get the information we need and test all the necessary elements and parameters for optimising and producing the next phase, which is the final design of the industrial units for mass production. The plan is that each industrial unit will yield a minimum of 2 liters/ minute of distilled water.
We will test the Beta Prototypes at a certified UK laboratory.

Our team of scientists are calculating the exact capacity, electrical energy, and thermal power required for the final machines. The Beta Prototypes will also be tested against extreme temperatures, climates and in environments with limited resources. Our priority is to ensure they are durable in remote, inhospitable desert or tropical climates.
• The method exploits totally new technology in the field of water distillation. Our unique ultrasound technology blasts water into a huge surface area made up of minute droplets.
After these evaporated water droplets have passed through the Aquavus chambers and a special Separator, pure distilled water is collected.

• Because these minute droplets of liquid form a huge surface area, much less energy and time are needed than existing technologies. This makes Aquavus economically and environmentally sound. Our groundbreaking process utilises much less energy than traditional distillation and reverse osmosis processes.
Let's change our social landscape. Join with us to help end thirst - one of the biggest global challenges of our time.

By building the final Aquavus systems, we'll be able to help quench the world's desperate need for clean water. By licensing our ground-breaking technology, chosen vendors across the world can be a part of this unique journey.
currently estimate the units will yield a

minimum output of 2 litres/min. This means an Aquavus Seawater Unit of 1.5 X 1.5 X 1.5 metres  will produce at least 120 litres/hour of clean, safe, purified water. An Aquavus Artesian and Surface Water Unit of 1 X 1 X 1 metres will do the same.
Artist's Rendition of an Aquavus Seawater Unit of 1.5 X 1.5 X 1.5 metres
Artist's Rendition of an Aquavus Artesian and Surface Water Unit of 1 X 1 X 1 metres
We plan to purify more than 3,000 litres of seawater, artesian sources or contaminated water per day from just one Aquavus unit.

Because of the mobile and modular design of the units we will also be able to provide clean water in mass relief operations and emergency situations such as earthquakes, tsunamis, floods, storm-waters, droughts, conflict zones, etc.
we do not reach our financial goals on Indiegogo, we will use the
funds we have raised to continue testing and improving our spray
the same time we will continue patenting our technology worldwide.
<h3>""What we do with our world, right now, will propagate down through the centuries and powerfully affect the destiny of our descendants.""

Every single day we hear more and more about the negative situations concerning the water on our planet and we can only come to one conclusion. It's a stark and undeniable fact that we have indeed reached a crisis point where drinkable and potable water are disappearing at alarming rates.
And the crisis is no longer confined to the developing world. Even in the developed world, in places like California, drought is so severe it’s having a grave economic impact on resources.
estimate 63 trillion gallons of water have been lost in the drought.
Jerry Brown has called for Californians to reduce water use by 20
percent voluntarily, and mandatory rationing could be ordered so
that homes, businesses and farms don’t run dry.
the increasing unpredictability of weather patterns leads governments
and municipalities to look at new water infrastructure investments, drought-ravaged California could

California alone, 15 desalination projects are proposed along the

have a solution. Aquavus, our revolutionary and innovative water
purification and desalination system, can be used
for seawater, artesian sources and contaminated surface
waters. Our process requires very little heat and energy.
We use low pressure pumps that are inexpensive to operate and
What's more, the CO2 impact of our technology is minimal. With our unique system, partial or full integration of purification and desalination with renewable energy sources is possible.
Aquavus can be used for a city or a village.

According to the United Nations Development Program the average water use per day per person in France is 280 litres, and in Germany it's 180 litres. Thus, a single Aquavus unit can provide for at least 10 people per day in developed nations.

However, the scale of water usage in a village in the developing world is much different. According to the United Nations each villager uses about 20 litres of water a day for drinking, cooking, and bathing, which is typical in a developing village.
In a village, just one Aquavus unit could supply enough clean water to support the needs of 150 people per day.  In real-terms, this translates to millions of lives saved.
Artist's rendition of a Solar Powered Aquavus Artesian Unit in a village.

The smart design of our mobile Aquavus technology even allows multiple units to work in tandem. This is absolutely vital in mass relief operations, emergency situations, earthquakes, tsunamis, floods, droughts and conflict zones.
Aquavus is expected to have a broad global impact on the production and distribution of water at substantially lower costs than existing technologies.
Our goal is to keep the final products at prices below $1,000.00 for the seawater unit and $500.00 for the artesian and surface water units.
Combined with lower energy costs, makes it substantially cheaper than any other existing systems of water desalination and purification producing the same litres per hour (LPH) of water per unit.
We plan to produce modular units which can be assembled serially like a “Lego set”. Aquavus is a “plug and play” device.

Economies of scale will also apply and provide greater cost advantages due to the scale, size, and/or output of operation. Costs per Aquavus unit will decrease with increasing scale as fixed costs are spread out over more units. Operational efficiency will also be greater with increasing scale, leading to lower variable costs as well.

Many water-hungry industrial applications (such as agriculture, mining and fracking) focus on the need for sustainable/closed-loop systems that meet the requirements of local legislation. We believe that smaller scale units and mobile, modular systems have a big future in the water industry.

column7: >How did we come up with Aquavus?

column1: • We originally designed the Aquavus system to find a solution for arsenic contaminated ground water in Bangladesh.
• The arsenic crisis in Bangladesh is rightly described as the worst case of mass poisoning in the history of mankind.

• Approximately 46 million people are forced to choose between arsenic-laced ground water or biologically contaminated surface water. Given the choice between slow death by poisoning or immediate sickness with water-borne pathogens – the local population inevitably chooses the arsenic-laced ground water.
• The test results were in line with our expectations. The lab results from the Alpha Prototype revealed 99% purity from the purification of contaminated water containing arsenic.
• The success of the Alpha Prototype led us to expand our unique technology to incorporate seawater desalination and many other environmental water problems that mankind faces today.

column2: >Currently, Aquavus Ltd. is primarily a research and development partnership, but our business strategy calls for finalising a series of prototype products utilising a core “ultrasound reactor” and related processes technology within all of our products.

column3: >Our operational plan, and therefore our financial plan, calls for the adequate capitalisation of the company throughout the first two years of operations without any sales. The initial sale of products will begin taking place in earnest during year three of the plan. As a result, we need to obtain enough financial backing for product development from the Beta Prototypes stage through to the completion of the industrial samples.

>The technical challenges are connected primarily to our ultrasound sprayers for the atomisation of source-water. The most important element is the time period the sprayers function before replacement or refurbishment. We expect that we can use them continuously 24/7 for at least one year at temperatures between 50 C and 95 C inside the machines. However we have not yet tested them for such a sustained period of time.

column2: >We have not yet decided on the final technologies for the disposal or collection of salt particles. We know that the existing methods of salt disposal in current reverse osmosis and thermal technologies are inadequate. We need to conduct further experiments regarding whether or not the salts in our system should be collected in dried form, returned to the source-water in a diluted form through diffusers or a combination of both. There must be flexibility regarding solutions. These are technical issues that need to be finally formulated by our team of scientists.

column3: >Our plan is to test the sprayers continuously during the year in which we will construct the Beta Prototypes, and make any necessary design corrections to them.

column2: >Regarding the salts that are removed from source-waters, our goal is to use the safest method possible in regards to the environmental impact of the process.

column3: >Although our goal is to keep the final products at prices below $1,000.00 for the seawater unit and $500.00 for the artesian and surface water units, we have a two year lead time before the units can be produced so the costs may go up more than initially projected.

>Presently, the Beta Prototypes will contain all the necessary elements for testing in order to produce an industrial sample with parameters of creating units producing 5 micron droplets and a minimum of 2 liters per minute of distilled water. In future we are interested in producing smaller droplets and expanding sprayer output in order to further increase efficiency and yield.

Bhopal, A Prayer For Rain"" is inspired by the 1984 Union Carbide disaster
in Bhopal, India, which is considered to be the world's worst
industrial disaster. Over 10,000 people died and at least 558,000

The fact that the chemicals released in the 1984 gas explosion continue to contaminate the groundwater in Bhopal, compelled Ravi to join the Aquavus project and team. The groundwater in Bhopal still has concentrations of carbon tetrachloride – a carcinogen that affects the liver, kidneys and central nervous system – which are 2,400 times above World Health Organization guidelines.

Our Alpha Prototype proved that our technology works in lab conditions. Now we plan to build the Beta Prototypes for commercial use.

We need to build 3 Beta Prototypes, and the projected cost for building these is $300,000 USD. We need three of them to ensure that we can perform tests at the highest regimes possible and should some tests damage a prototype or internal details we will have immediate back-ups to continue our work.
Aquavus Beta Prototypes will employ unique ultrasound units capable
of a spray of a minimum of 10 litres per hour, producing 5-micron
droplets, and consuming a maximum of 200-300 watts of electrical

From the Beta Prototypes we will get the information we need and test all the necessary elements and parameters for optimising and producing the next phase, which is the final design of the industrial units for mass production. The plan is that each industrial unit will yield a minimum of 2 liters/ minute of distilled water.
We will test the Beta Prototypes at a certified UK laboratory.

Our team of scientists are calculating the exact capacity, electrical energy, and thermal power required for the final machines. The Beta Prototypes will also be tested against extreme temperatures, climates and in environments with limited resources. Our priority is to ensure they are durable in remote, inhospitable desert or tropical climates.
• The method exploits totally new technology in the field of water distillation. Our unique ultrasound technology blasts water into a huge surface area made up of minute droplets.
After these evaporated water droplets have passed through the Aquavus chambers and a special Separator, pure distilled water is collected.

• Because these minute droplets of liquid form a huge surface area, much less energy and time are needed than existing technologies. This makes Aquavus economically and environmentally sound. Our groundbreaking process utilises much less energy than traditional distillation and reverse osmosis processes.
Let's change our social landscape. Join with us to help end thirst - one of the biggest global challenges of our time.

By building the final Aquavus systems, we'll be able to help quench the world's desperate need for clean water. By licensing our ground-breaking technology, chosen vendors across the world can be a part of this unique journey.

Every single day we hear more and more about the negative situations concerning the water on our planet and we can only come to one conclusion. It's a stark and undeniable fact that we have indeed reached a crisis point where drinkable and potable water are disappearing at alarming rates.
And the crisis is no longer confined to the developing world. Even in the developed world, in places like California, drought is so severe it’s having a grave economic impact on resources.
estimate 63 trillion gallons of water have been lost in the drought.

percent voluntarily, and mandatory rationing could be ordered so
that homes, businesses and farms don’t run dry.

Alpha Prototype, Condensing Chambers, Pump and Ultrasound Electronics
How did we come up with Aquavus?
We originally designed the Aquavus system to find a solution for arsenic contaminated ground water in Bangladesh.
The arsenic crisis in Bangladesh is rightly described as the worst case of mass poisoning in the history of mankind.

Approximately 46 million people are forced to choose between arsenic-laced ground water or biologically contaminated surface water. Given the choice between slow death by poisoning or immediate sickness with water-borne pathogens – the local population inevitably chooses the arsenic-laced ground water.
The test results were in line with our expectations. The lab results from the Alpha Prototype revealed 99% purity from the purification of contaminated water containing arsenic.
The success of the Alpha Prototype led us to expand our unique technology to incorporate seawater desalination and many other environmental 	water problems that mankind faces today.

Currently, Aquavus Ltd. is primarily a research and development partnership, but our business strategy calls for finalising a series of prototype products utilising a core “ultrasound reactor” and related processes technology within all of our products.

Financial Challenges - Our operational plan, and therefore our financial plan, calls for the adequate capitalisation of the company throughout the first two years of operations without any sales. The initial sale of products will begin taking place in earnest during year three of the plan. As a result, we need to obtain enough financial backing for product development from the Beta Prototypes stage through to the completion of the industrial samples.

Technical Challenges - The technical challenges are connected primarily to our ultrasound sprayers for the atomisation of source-water. The most important element is the time period the sprayers function before replacement or refurbishment. We expect that we can use them continuously 24/7 for at least one year at temperatures between 50 C and 95 C inside the machines. However we have not yet tested them for such a sustained period of time.

We have not yet decided on the final technologies for the disposal or collection of salt particles. We know that the existing methods of salt disposal in current reverse osmosis and thermal technologies are inadequate. We need to conduct further experiments regarding whether or not the salts in our system should be collected in dried form, returned to the source-water in a diluted form through diffusers or a combination of both. There must be flexibility regarding solutions. These are technical issues that need to be finally formulated by our team of scientists.
Technical Solutions - Our plan is to test the sprayers continuously during the year in which we will construct the Beta Prototypes, and make any necessary design corrections to them.
Regarding the salts that are removed from source-waters, our goal is to use the safest method possible in regards to the environmental impact of the process.

Product Pricing Challenges - Although our goal is to keep the final products at prices below $1,000.00 for the seawater unit and $500.00 for the artesian and surface water units, we have a two year lead time before the units can be produced so the costs may go up more than initially projected.

Future Improvements - Presently, the Beta Prototypes will contain all the necessary elements for testing in order to produce an industrial sample with parameters of creating units producing 5 micron droplets and a minimum of 2 liters per minute of distilled water. In future we are interested in producing smaller droplets and expanding sprayer output in order to further increase efficiency and yield.
Our Founders - A Truly International Team.

Ukrainian, Canadian, Indian and British. Our Founders have diverse backgrounds but all have developed successful projects from beginning to completion. We are united in our efforts to make this world a better place. We know deep down inside that our legacy is what we make of this world and what we leave behind, as it is for all mankind.

He was an original member of official Committee on Healthcare to
deliver PPP policy, which is part of the Government of India’s
Bhan has been Advisor on ongoing Initiatives of UNDP/UNOP, Senior
Advisor at KPMG, HID Global, ICGEB, Secretary General of DMAI and
member at Executive Board of India/Japan Global Partnership.
an exceptionally creative individual. He is an integral part of our
mutual spirit and a leader in bringing this technology forward. He
has the understanding of what it takes to create success in our
world. Not only is he deeply involved in the functioning of Aquavus
Ltd. but he is also a part-time paediatrician working for the NHS in
London, whilst also being a film writer & director having
recently completed his new film “Bhopal: A Prayer For Rain”, starring
Martin Sheen, Kal Penn and Mischa Barton, which will be released
Bhopal, A Prayer For Rain"" is inspired by the 1984 Union Carbide disaster
in Bhopal, India, which is considered to be the world's worst
industrial disaster. Over 10,000 people died and at least 558,000
were injured as chemicals leaked from the American plant. The
film was recently screened at the UN for the 2014 General

The fact that the chemicals released in the 1984 gas explosion continue to contaminate the groundwater in Bhopal, compelled Ravi to join the Aquavus project and team. The groundwater in Bhopal still has concentrations of carbon tetrachloride – a carcinogen that affects the liver, kidneys and central nervous system – which are 2,400 times above World Health Organization guidelines.
With Aquavus, we plan to provide clean drinking water to the survivors of this disaster.
want to thank you by offering perks that are interesting and
aesthetically pleasing. We really hope you like them and they will
fulfill your collector's impulse to have something connected to our
endeavors of helping to end the water crisis in our world. Our perks have a central theme which is ""drops"" of water. We look forward to you joining the ""Aquavus"" community.
Perk # 1- THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!
You will receive email updates and a personal thank you message from the Aquavus Team.
Printable Official Aquavus Certificate with your name on it for your contribution towards giving everyone in the world clean drinking water.
Perk # 3 -  A drop for me.An intriguing ""Drop"" Aquavus fridge magnet. Be reminded of your vital contribution to this cause every time you reach into your fridge for a cold drink.
A 15-ounce Aquavus Clean Clear Water Coffee Mug. Did you know that the most important element in making good coffee is the purity of the water?
Perk # 6 -  ""Nary a Drop to Drink""Light blue and white ""Drop"" T-shirt.
Dark Blue ""I Love Drinking Water"" T-shirt.
Perk # 8 -  ""Raindrops keep falling""A gorgeous green and blue ""dripping drops""  Aquavus T-shirt.
Perk # 9 -  All for one and one for all.9 piece set of exquisite fridge magnets you can share with friends and relatives.

Perk # 10 -  Do you care?A signed ""Bhopal, A Prayer for Rain"" movie poster with Dr. Ravi Kumar, the Writer and Director of the movie and a co-founder of Aquavus, personally thanking you for your donation to the Aquavus mission of providing clean water to the survivors of the disaster.
Stunningly beautiful Drop ""Wild Whitewater"" pendant with chain.
Stunningly beautiful Drop ""Wild Whitewater"" pendant with leather strap.
Drinking water jug and glasses with Aquavus logo. Share clean clear water with your loved ones.
One-of-a-kind sterling silver chain and medallion engraved with your name.

Your name on a brass plate on an Aquavus machine + a  quarterly report of how the Beta Prototypes are progressing including a video thanking you personally for your contribution, showing the ongoing construction of the prototypes and interviews with the founders. We will put your name and city on the Contributor's Wall on our website.  Be immortalized in this global movement!

A special, commemorative wall plaque thanking you for your contribution to our lifesaving project + the quarterly report and video thanking you personally for your contribution, showing the ongoing construction of the prototypes and interviews with the founders. Become a vital member of the Aquavus project community.

The sterling silver chain and medallion engraved with your name + the quarterly report and video thanking you personally for your contribution, showing the ongoing construction of the prototypes and interviews with the founders + your name on a brass plate on an Aquavus machine + the special, commemorative wall plaque thanking you for your contribution to our lifesaving project + a signed ""Bhopal, A Prayer for Rain"" movie poster with Dr. Ravi Kumar, the Writer and Director of the movie and a co-founder of Aquavus, personally thanking you for your donation to the Aquavus mission of providing clean water to the survivors of the disaster.
Perk # 18 -  Goldfinger.An elegantly and meticulously crafted gold medallion and chain with your name engraved on it.

The gold chain and medallion + the quarterly report and video thanking you personally for your contribution, showing the ongoing construction of the prototypes and interviews with the founders.  + the commemorative wall plaque + a ""Bhopal, A Prayer for Rain"" movie poster signed by Writer and Director Ravi Kumar + an Aquavus artesian machine for domestic use with your name engraved on a brass plate on your machine. Lead the way in Aquavus technology by being one of the first people in the world to use one of our groundbreaking machines in the comfort of your own home.

Perk # 20 - The Super PerkAll the above + an Aquavus seawater machine + an all expense paid trip for 2 to London including invitations to our exclusive Aquavus inauguration ceremony and gala dinner, alongside various high-profile celebrities from the music and film industries. The ultimate perk for the lifesaving technology pioneer.

middle-aged, mediocre wheelchair tennis player decides it’s high time to
achieve his long delayed athletic dreams by competing at the U.S. Wheelchair
where I’m suppose to brag on myself.
Not sure if I’m up for it.
I will say that I play tennis and I coach tennis.  I’m a USTA board member and the
Chair of the Northern New Mexico Wheelchair Tennis committee, and none of
that makes my tennis game any better.
I want that to change, which is why I practice as often as I can and play
against any able-bodied or wheelchair player I can drag out to the
any chance I have of being competitive at the U.S. Open will be directly
related to the number of tournaments and matches I play beforehand.
And while my Better Half has been exceptionally understanding and
supportive of my quest, the continual drain on our resources is a worrying
thing, which is why I’m asking for your help.
suppose to break down how the money raised will be spent:
single penny of this $5000 will go directly to my quixotic quest: gas, food,
lodging, taxes, tolls, snacks, drinks, strings, stringing, sunblock,
old-man icebags for my ailing elbow, etc…
swear to each and every one of you that under no circumstances will any of
your generous donations be used for weekend trips to Fiji or Kate Spade

The Perks

You'll get a better idea of the schwag I'm giving out at maloleche.tumblr.com, but for a quick recap see below:

  • Things that will definitely be given out: magnets, lunches, dinners, shout-outs, gorgeous 65 year old NM travel decals, rad 40 year old iron-ons, Spotify playlists, LPs, and my eternal gratitude.
  • Things that may be given out: tom yum, tiki gods, dog show trophies, books, class photographs, green chile cheeseburgers, tchotchkes, CDs, folk art, ephemera and my opinion on a subject over a meal.

Other Ways You Can Help
the word.  Seriously.  I may not have articulated it all that
well in my promo vidja, but even if you can’t help out with money, you can do
me a solid by getting this out to as many people as you can:
that raises the profile of wheelchair tennis—this side of criminal activity—can
only ever be a good thing.
let’s be honest, it might help me out, too.

Michael Fitzgerald 19 ans vit à Rawdon ,dans la nuit de dimanche a lundi il a été poignardé dans le cou et dans le dos par son meilleur ami et à subit de graves brûlures après avoir été aspergé par des produits inflammables.Le logement a été incendié dans l'incident et il a beaucoup souffert.Sa mère et lui n'ont plus de vêtements et n'ont plus de meubles.C'est un gars vraiment très gentil et il ne mérite vraiment pas ce qu'il lui arrive.C'est pourquoi nous organisons une collecte de dons pour l'aider!

Merci!

column5: >""Why Americans Are Fat and Sick is a very unique book: beautiful, informative, educational, and vital to help fight the obesity and cancer crisis in America.""
>This book has earned a five-star review from Pacific Book Review.
>Click here to read Author Interview about the book

column1: Click here for a sample of the book
Click to read full review of the book at www.ahbonbon.com

column2:
What You Get

The fund will provide a head start for Ahbonbon to launch the book in 2016.

column1: We must help Americans understand the real causes of obesity, heart disease, and cancer. This is something that your doctors or nutritionists may not tell you. This will help save many lives!
Get this book for your new-year resolution! It is the best gift to yourself and love ones!

Written based on extensive research and a wealth of scientific data, this book reveals the real causes of premature aging, obesity, heart disease, and cancer: the large amount of hidden toxins you have been consuming or exposed to. So many products with health claims on the labels contain harmful ingredients that disrupt the endocrine system. Your favorite lotions or expensive cosmetic products may contain toxic chemicals. Dangerous levels of toxins could come from your own homes. What you all thought to be healthy and safe may be harmful to your health. Why do you gain weight when eating only diet foods? Why do your kids have learning disabilities? Why are more women at risk for breast cancer?
Why Americans Are Fat and Sick: Hidden Toxins Cause Obesity, Heart Disease, and Cancer is a beautiful, informative, and easy-to-read book. It is the best guide to losing weight, looking younger, and being healthy for life.

Ahbonbon’s founder, Lynn Dangtu, is a multi-talented, multicultural, and tri-lingual strategist, researcher, and entrepreneur who graduated from the University of Southern California with BS and MBA degrees.

In 2002, she made history by winning a multi-million-dollar partnership from the US Department of Commerce to open an economic development center helping small businesses. Subsequently, she became a community leader and small business activist to negotiate with major banks and utilities companies to invest hundreds of million dollars into programs to help small businesses for a period of over fifteen years in California.

In 2012, Dangtu retired as a community leader and activist to found Ahbonbon LLC, a publishing house. She has not forgotten her solid foundation as a problem solver, researcher, and strategist. With the drive for community leadership and activism in her blood, she wants to help Americans fight cancer, obesity, and other serious illnesses by pointing out the root causes of their health problems and suggesting feasible solutions.

column2:
Challenges

There is no risk. This is our fourth publication. We know what we are doing.

This project was fully-funded on Kickstarter, raising $13,000 of our $10,000 goal!

EyeSend adjustable-view belay glasses eliminate neck strain by allowing the belayer to adjust their field of view using the optics in their glasses instead of the muscles in their neck.

Current belay glasses only elevate your field of view by a fixed 60°. If you climb on cliffs steeper than this, you’re compensating by craning your neck. The EyeSend field of view is adjustable from 60° to 120°. Belayers can use this range of adjustment to maintain a neutral, pain-free neck position while belaying, regardless of the cliff angle.

 

A more comfortable belay is a safer belay, for both the climber and belayer.

PitchSix believes in helping to sustain the outdoor environments that make climbing great. We have pledged to the 1% for the Planet movement and will plant a tree for every pair of EyeSend glasses sold. Read more below. 

Save your neck! Help offset climate change! Pledge to support EyeSend!

What Climbers are Saying
column3:
showinfo=0"">

These Climbers Have a Pair From Our Pilot Build:

""These glasses are amazing! The adjustable feature allows you to stand in a comfortable position without craning your neck to see your belayer. Who knew such a simple addition to belay glasses could be so revolutionary!?"" -- Beth Rodden, Mother, Pro Climber, Writer

“The adjustability in the PitchSix EyeSend is a game changer. As a climber with a severely injured neck, I am forced to rely on belay glasses for all belaying. I have made do with what was on offer for too long and suffered when belaying for anything but very short periods. The moveable lens in the EyeSend gives me a better range of vision than anything else I’ve used, and allows me to belay for way longer, with basically zero discomfort. Thanks PitchSix!” -- Liam Lonsdale. Passionate climber, professional photographer, pursuer of excellence.

""The  adjustable feature is brilliant! This fixes my biggest problem with my (previous) belay glasses--my neck never quite could get into a relaxed  position. You have solved this problem!""  --Eric Hörst.   Climber * Author * Performance Coach * Researcher * Speaker

""I see climbers with tight necks all the time in my clinic. Cranking your neck up to give a good belay is not what your spine is meant to do. The adjustable EyeSend glasses are way better than regular belay glasses at letting you keep a neutral neck position while not losing sight of your climber. All belayers should get a pair!"" -- Dr. Tyler Nelson.  Camp4 Human Performance, DC, MS, CSCS

""A clever improvement on a crucial piece of cragging kit.  But be  warned
column4:
I got some strange looks when I wore them to the bar."" -- Cedar Wright.  Professional Climber and Filmmaker…God Among Men

EyeSend Key Features

column1: • Increased belayer comfort and a safer belay
• Three fields of view: Through, Over, Under
• We’ll plant a tree for every pair sold

Left-Hand-Only View Adjustment

Three Fields of View

Solid Frame Withstands Crag Use

Easy On, Easy Off

Awesome Case Design

In the Box

Giving Back

We are committed to helping protect the outdoor environments that make climbing great. We’ve joined 1% for the Planet to exemplify that commitment. We’re going to plant a tree for every pair of EyeSend glasses sold as well as support climber access initiatives.

Got Big Hair?

Pick up a PitchSix Headband!

The EyeSend view angle can be so steep that you'll see your forehead. The PitchSix headband can tame those wild locks giving you an unobstructed view of your climber.

Our headbands:
• 4"" tall in the front and 1"" tall in the back
• Custom Fitzroy or Cirque of Towers designs

Patent Pending

The EyeSend Adjustable-View Belay Glasses are patent pending. 

Belay Glasses Optics 101

Belay glasses reflect the image of the climber twice. The first reflection is off the mirror-coated bottom of the prism. Like any mirror, this first reflection inverts the image of the climber. The image is reflected a second time off the top surface of the prism (due to total internal reflection), flipping the image back to normal.

Regular belay glasses use a fixed prism and therefore have a view centered around 60° from horizontal. Rotating regular belay glasses on your head does nothing to change the angle of view as increased refraction offsets the rotation. EyeSend’s adjustable prism allows the belayer to change the angle of view by adjusting the bottom mirror angle.

Designed and Built in USA

EyeSend glasses are designed and manufactured in Logan, UT. Keeping the product as local as possible helps reduce shipping environmental impact and feeds local U.S. businesses.

Our Current State of Development

We have taken the product all the way from concept to an initial, low-volume production run. This includes an investment in production-quality injection molds. Some pairs of glasses from our initial low-volume run are available after this campaign is complete. Additional pairs are projected for availability in March, 2020.

People 

Matt Cupal is the PitchSix founder and the inventor of the EyeSend Belay Glasses. Matt has been climbing for over 30 years. He lives in Logan, UT where he has spent countless hours pulling choss off the Logan canyon walls to expose numerous routes in a wide range of grades. 

In addition to his personal climbing efforts, Matt makes time to coach the local youth competitive climbing team in Logan. Coaching has brought a new focus and exploration into his climbing life and he enjoys helping others break through perceived limitations.

Matt has been a business leader in the tech industry for over 20 years and has experience manufacturing hard goods products both domestically and overseas. Development of the EyeSend Belay Glasses has been an extremely challenging, but rewarding project that combines basic physics with manufacturing knowledge to solve a compelling problem in a sport he loves. The project is also an embodiment for the environmental change he feels is needed in the world.

Parker is the mechanical engineer for the EyeSend belay glasses. He has fearlessly overcome many unique design challenges associated with bringing this product to market. Parker is a 7-year mechanical engineer educated at Utah State University. His work on the project has thus far included component design, component stress analysis, design for manufacturability and consultation with the injection mold tool design. When not working, he enjoys hiking, fishing, traveling and spending time with wife and two young children.

Risks and Challenges

EyeSend glasses have been in development for over two years. We've overcome a lot of challenges in that time. Most notably, aligning both eyes in a reproducible way has been difficult. We wanted to lower the risk for early supporters so we’ve taken the design all the way to an initial low-volume production run. This includes building injection molds to ensure we can have repeatable success in manufacturing the glasses. Taking the design this far has been costly and time consuming, but the result is that we know they can be built successfully each time.

The remaining challenges pertain to ensuring our production processes can be scaled up to higher volume. This presents a moderate risk. We’ve already contracted with an assembly house that is able to handle the production.

In addition, all component suppliers have been identified and used for the initial low-volume production run. Ordering higher volumes of components presents a low risk. Lead times for parts are well understood.

According to the Center for Disease Control and Prevention, 7.6 million people die of cancer worldwide. Many of these deaths could be prevented, with your help.

Flagler College's Chapter of Public Relations Student Society of America has been raising money for the Flagler Health Care Foundation Inc. for the past 10 years. The foundation is a not for profit organization designed to advance the quality and availability of health care services that Flagler Hospital provides through philanthropic funding.

PRSSA annually holds the STAND Against Cancer event to raise money for the Flagler Health Care Foundation for cancer research. This year instead of holding one single event, we have decided to run a 42 daylong Internet campaign. As aspiring communication professionals PRSSA members will utilize the skills they have learned in school to make this a successful campaign.  We hope to raise more money then ever before!
For more information about Flagler College PRSSA visit our Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/fcprssa.

Our goal this year is to raise $5000 for the Flagler Hospital!  However, we have decided to place the donation amount at $3000 as a conservative estimate. With every donation, you will recieve a unique perk from Flagler PRSSA.

column5: >Thank you so much for your help! Even the smallest donations appreciated. Please share our campaign and videos. Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter. Spread the word and take a STAND Against Cancer.
