My niece 4 year old Jacey Jo was diagnosed with A.L.L. lukemia in March. Jacey is a spunky, silly little girl who always had a smile on her face. Through her battle she has managed to keep a small smile on her face but she doesnt understand why she feels so icky all the time. The high doses of prenisone have her moody at times but her ""happy"" place has been in the cafeteria of the hospial. Jacey's Mom reported to us the other day that Jacey has now started to lose her eye lashes, her beautiful blond curly locks of hair are starting to thin as well. This was the hardest for Jacey to deal with. She got very upset when her Mom explained to her that she would lose her hair. But when the childrens hospital asked her what color of hair she wanted for her wig she smiled and said, ""hot pink""! So of course she will have hot pink hair. Such a awesome personality for a little girl who is going through heck right now.

Jacey's Mother is my sister and a single Mother to 4 children. Jacey is her youngest. She also has a 9 year old son who has special needs. She works a full time job caring for her children. She is loving, caring, compasionate and lives for her children.  She HAS to be able to stay with her daughter while she is battling lukemia. Being a single Mom makes it IMPOSSIBLE. She has NO extra income coming in at this time only enough to sustain the family. She is away from her three other children, in a different town at the hospital. So not seeing them everyday is so hard for them all. She has a wonderful man in her life who stepped up to help care for the other children and she has family who is helping her to care for the children..

Any and all contributions will go directly to purchase Jacey things to give her comfort for this  very long road ahead of her. Please pass this info to all of your friends and family thank you so very much for your consideration and God Bless you.

column2: >Ever since I was a little girl, before I even knew it was possible to give birth in water, I always dreamed about giving birth in the ocean. It was only about 6 years ago that I learned it was possible and that women all over the world had been doing this for hundreds of years. Long before I even got pregnant, I learned this was a way to help babies make the transition from life in the uterus to life outside of the womb, as smooth as possible. I knew deep down in my heart, without a doubt, THIS was the way I wanted to bring my baby into this world.
column3: >Of course, this dream never took into consideration the circumstances that would make it difficult for this to happen for me - almost all health insurance companies in the U.S. do not cover the costs of a midwife or home birth. When it came time to start exploring my finances for the possibility
column4: > of a home water birth, I was deeply discouraged and worried about how I was going to pay for the birth of my baby, along with all the other costs related to having a child. It broke my heart to believe my current financial circumstances were going to be what prevented me from having this once in a life time experience.
column5: >I started researching ways I can make this happen and thankfully, I found a non-profit organization through The Sanctuary Birth Center that offers grants to qualified families. I immediately

column7: > A HUGE help towards making this possible! Throughout my pregnancy, I've shared with a lot of people the importance of having this experience for me and my baby. When one friend suggested I start a fundraiser page to come up with the remainder of the cost, I was a bit hesitant... I

column19: > their help in any way.
column23: >The birth of my baby, Jairo Valentino, came 3 weeks early and because I set up this page late, the birthing center has been generous enough to extend my payment plan to six weeks after the birth in order for them to provide me with the birth I'd always dreamed of.
column25: >For those who might be unfamiliar with home water births, I've included a video that gives some reasons why women choose an out of hospital birth. For me, birth is natural and it's also a right of passage. Bringing another human into this earth is a very sacred event and I wanted to feel the experience by taking an active role in the process of birthing my baby. I knew this home birth would offer my baby a more peaceful journey from my womb and into my arms and thats exactly what I experienced!! My birth experience was blissful
column26: > and peaceful! I had a great support team that included my midwife and her assistant, my doula, my best friend, baby dad and my mom. I was able to labor comfortably in warm water with a candle lit setting, singing bowls, massages and loving encouragement from my loved ones! It was truly a euphoric experience!
column28:
>

You're contribution will not only assist me in paying for this magical experience but also give me the opportunity to spend the first couple of months of Jairo Valentino's life without having to work. Because I had been working independently, I don't have the luxury of getting a paid maternity leave.Being able to bond with my lil love during the first couple of months, is a TREMENDOUS gift. Your support will bring me so much relief and allow me to focus on my baby.


There are only 4 days left before this campaign closes and I'm asking for your support in order to make this a smooth transition for me. You will be supporting me in a huge way and it is a great help!
column29: >Thank you so much for reading my entire page, I appreciate all of you!
column31:
>Carolina Lopez Arango

","Ever since I was a little girl, before I even knew it was possible to give birth in water, I always dreamed about giving birth in the ocean. It was only about 6 years ago that I learned it was possible and that women all over the world had been doing this for hundreds of years. Long before I even got pregnant, I learned this was a way to help babies make the transition from life in the uterus to life outside of the womb, as smooth as possible. I knew deep down in my heart, without a doubt, THIS was the way I wanted to bring my baby into this world. Of course, this dream never took into consideration the circumstances that would make it difficult for this to happen for me - almost all health insurance companies in the U.S. do not cover the costs of a midwife or home birth. When it came time to start exploring my finances for the possibility of a home water birth, I was deeply discouraged and worried about how I was going to pay for the birth of my baby, along with all the other costs related to having a child. It broke my heart to believe my current financial circumstances were going to be what prevented me from having this once in a life time experience. I started researching ways I can make this happen and thankfully, I found a non-profit organization through The Sanctuary Birth Center that offers grants to qualified families. I immediately wrote a letter, sent in my application and got approved for half the cost of the home water birth… A HUGE help towards making this possible! Throughout my pregnancy, I've shared with a lot of people the importance of having this experience for me and my baby. When one friend suggested I start a fundraiser page to come up with the remainder of the cost, I was a bit hesitant... I wasn't exactly comfortable with the idea of asking for money. Then I began thinking about the tremendous love, support and encouragement I have received throughout this journey and I'm so thankful I have such amazing, supportive friends that have offered their help in any way. The birth of my baby, Jairo Valentino, came 3 weeks early and because I set up this page late, the birthing center has been generous enough to extend my payment plan to six weeks after the birth in order for them to provide me with the birth I'd always dreamed of.  For those who might be unfamiliar with home water births, I've included a video that gives some reasons why women choose an out of hospital birth. For me, birth is natural and it's also a right of passage. Bringing another human into this earth is a very sacred event and I wanted to feel the experience by taking an active role in the process of birthing my baby. I knew this home birth would offer my baby a more peaceful journey from my womb and into my arms and thats exactly what I experienced!! My birth experience was blissful and peaceful! I had a great support team that included my midwife and her assistant, my doula, my best friend, baby dad and my mom. I was able to labor comfortably in warm water with a candle lit setting, singing bowls, massages and loving encouragement from my loved ones! It was truly a euphoric experience!You're contribution will not only assist me in paying for this magical experience but also give me the opportunity to spend the first couple of months of Jairo Valentino's life without having to work. Because I had been working independently, I don't have the luxury of getting a paid maternity leave.Being able to bond with my lil love during the first couple of months, is a TREMENDOUS gift. Your support will bring me so much relief and allow me to focus on my baby.There are only 4 days left before this campaign closes and I'm asking for your support in order to make this a smooth transition for me. You will be supporting me in a huge way and it is a great help!Thank you so much for reading my entire page, I appreciate all of you!Love, peace and blessings,Carolina Lopez Arango",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

EARTHSEED YOGA IS GOING MOBILE, AND WE NEED YOUR HELP!

For the last year, we have been sharing health and wellness activities and practices with Boston's communities of color, from free yoga classes at public housing developments and community gardens, to mini-workshops for organizations and groups.

WE NEED WHEELS! We are asking for our community's help in raising $6500 to purchase a USED VEHICLE and YOGA EQUIPMENT (mats, blocks, straps, bolsters and blankets) so we can travel throughout Roxbury, Jamaica Plain, Dorchester and Mattapan to bring our yoga offerings to the people.

With a vehicle and yoga equipment, we can EXPAND OUR YOGA SERVICE PROJECTS to begin offering relaxation and stress relief sessions to more of Boston's underserved communities, including:
Low-income families who experience the stress and trauma of poverty, racism, homelessness, hunger and violence
Public school students with academic and behavioral health challenges
Social service providers, organizers and activists feeling ""burned out"" by their work
Men of color seeking to build a mind-body connection for better health
Elders in nursing homes in need of gentle and invigorating health and wellness activities to increase vitality
Individuals who are incarcerated or re-entering our communities after time served

REDUCE STRESS, RECONNECT WITH SELF, RESTORE COMMUNITY

The American Medical Association recognizes STRESS as the cause of more than 60% of all human illness and sickness.

Black and Hispanic/Latina individuals and communities experience some of the highest levels of stress among all social groups due to our racial, ethnic and gender identities, economic and educational status and the neighborhoods we live in.

Racism, poverty, employment/unemployment, incarceration, homelessness, hunger and violence cause stress that's been proven to lead to illness and disease such diabetes, heart disease, obesity, asthma, cancer and depression.

Our yoga classes are an opportunity for people to learn how to positively cope with and manage the stress they experience. When body, mind and spirit unite, peace blossoms from within. It's this sense of inner peace that can empower us to transcend individual and community-wide struggles. Through yoga activism, we can work together to grow our souls and enjoy the beauty of our community in full bloom.

Earthseed Yoga is a collective of yoga activists and enthusiasts who use spiritual and social justice principles and practices to respond to our community’s most pressing health issues. 

We cultivate HEALING, UNITY, CHANGE AND LIBERATION through classes, workshops, projects and campaigns that:

column2: >Improve our physical, mental and emotional health and reduce and prevent the symptoms and effects of chronic disease
>Increase our knowledge and awareness of inequities and disparities that impact our lives
>Create information, resources and opportunities to transform our communities and ourselves

column3: >Alerta is a, closed loop, disposable patch to assist in the individual care of a loved one living at home, for example, a person with Alzheimer’s dementia or an Autistic child. The Wedge will notify the caregiver with an audible and visual alarm if the loved one wanders from home or a safe zone of approximately 75 feet.

column1: In the course the development, we have tested the potential acceptance of this product with actual caregivers and have had an overwhelming acceptance.

In the last two years, we have developed two different approaches to the implementation of the product. This development yielded engineering models but not a product ready designs. 
Today we are working on the production version and we will have pre-production models early in 2019. We should have deliverable product in June of 2019.

column6: >The funds we generate are to help us finish the development and deliver Alerta to market.  In supporting this project you are helping provide caregivers with a product that will help prevent wandering by impaired loved ones. Alerta helps reduce the stress on caregivers who are normally members of the family. The product helps make impaired people secure.
column7: >Please support caregivers and their loved ones by supporting Alerta.

column1: Caregiver Statements About Safety Issue     Alerta is a 7-day disposable patch to tell a caregiver their loved one has wandered. Alerta & Wedge work together using radio frequency to help a caregiver monitor a loved one.    Alarms when a loved one wanders

Alerta is a, closed loop, disposable patch to assist in the individual care of a loved one living at home, for example, a person with Alzheimer’s dementia or an Autistic child. Alerta is worn by a loved one and monitored with a Wedge ( receiver) by the caregiver. The Wedge will notify the caregiver with an audible and visual alarm if the loved one wanders from home or a safe zone of approximately 75 feet. This allows the caregiver to sleep, shower, or do daily activities with some peace of mind. Peace of Mind in a Patch""Informal Caregivers"" Alerta is very exciting. It will make a significant impact on humanity by relieving some of the stress of “Informal Caregivers” who are providing 24/7 monitoring of their loved ones.The need is growing every day.  The Wedge The Wedge is dedicated to one job, to let the caregiver know if a loved one wanders. The batteries last for months so it works 24/7"" and is not subject to interruptions or connection fees.

After 7 days the Wedge signals the caregiver to remove Alerta (used patch). The caregiver peels the adhesive covering on the new Alerta (patch) and applies it beside to reduce skin irritation. Doesn't need charging like a GPS tracker Alerta uses R.F technology paired with improved medical grade skin adhesion in a disposable patch the size of a tea bag.Some devices that use GPS or cell phones need to be plugged in daily and can leave a loved one vulnerable  The Caregiver removes Alerta (patch) from the shipping card. They push the “On” switch located on Alerta. The Caregiver removes the film protecting the adhesive on the back of Alerta (patch)The Caregiver applies Alerta (patch) to a clean hair free area in the upper lumbar region of their loved ones back. Peace of Mind in a Patch! The Caregiver brings the Wedge within 3’ of the loved one after Alerta (Patch) is on and wait for the signal indicator to light up. The Wedge will notify the caregiver with an audible and visual indicator if their loved one wanders from an approximate 75’ radius. This area is typical of most homes. When the Wedge alarms, immediately go and retrieve your loved one. The Wedge will reset itself when the patch is back in range.    Size The size of a tea bag. Alerta is very soft and flexible.  Waterproof Waterproof and lasts for 7 days of normal activities. R.F Technology A low power sub 1Ghz RF transmitter designed to be used on the body. Alerta sends identification packets every few seconds to the Wedge to monitor the distance that the wearer is from the wedge. Easy to use Applied to a location on the upper back with a medical grade long term adhesive. Alerta is almost undetectable.   Size The Wedge shape makes it easy to hold and smaller than a smartphone. Audible Alarm The Wedge has an audible alarm that notifies a caregiver if a loved one wanders day or night from a safe zone. Fits Anywhere  The Wedge easily fits in a shirt pocket or purse and rests on a table or nightstand. Lasts For 6 Months The Wedge last for 6 months before the battery needs replaced with normal use. Easy to use The Wedge receives ID packets from Alerta (patch) and notifies a caregiver when loved one wanders from a safe zone with an audible as well as a visual notification.The Wedge informs the caregiver when it is time to change Alerta.      Safety Zone Range About 75 feet depending on your home.  Caregiver Statements About Safety Zone
In the course the development, we have tested the potential acceptance of this product with actual caregivers and have had an overwhelming acceptance.

In the last two years, we have developed two different approaches to the implementation of the product. This development yielded engineering models but not a product ready designs. Today we are working on the production version and we will have pre-production models early in 2019. We should have deliverable product in June of 2019.

The funds we generate are to help us finish the development and deliver Alerta to market.  In supporting this project you are helping provide caregivers with a product that will help prevent wandering by impaired loved ones. Alerta helps reduce the stress on caregivers who are normally members of the family. The product helps make impaired people secure. Please support caregivers and their loved ones by supporting Alerta.",44.0,4,"1 Campaign

column2: >Capricorn firmly believe that supporting worthy causes, small and large, plays a vitally important part in enhancing the society we live in -  making a real difference to people's lives and communities.
>Capricorn employees, friends and family were captured by Elias' story and immediately wanted to help in any way possible!

column4: >Elias is suffering from bilateral Perthes disease, with the remaining part of his right femoral bone at less than 50 % of its original - making this case serious. The surgery needed is only offered in Portugal with the renowned Dr. Lopez. This operation has high success rates. In order for progress to be made: the surgery itself, transportation and medicines need to be funded!

column3: >Our hope is to change Elias' future from one with pain and repeated surgeries to one with a functional and pain free right hip.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help

column4: >As we are doing the 'hard bit,' all we ask is that you spread the word amongst your friends and family. There are sharing tools on this page and remember that words are effortless and free. Thank you for taking your time to read this page.

column1: Capricorn firmly believe that supporting worthy causes, small and large, plays a vitally important part in enhancing the society we live in -  making a real difference to people's lives and communities.
Capricorn employees, friends and family were captured by Elias' story and immediately wanted to help in any way possible!

Elias is suffering from bilateral Perthes disease, with the remaining part of his right femoral bone at less than 50 % of its original - making this case serious. The surgery needed is only offered in Portugal with the renowned Dr. Lopez. This operation has high success rates. In order for progress to be made: the surgery itself, transportation and medicines need to be funded!
Our hope is to change Elias' future from one with pain and repeated surgeries to one with a functional and pain free right hip.
What we are doing - 3 Peaks Challenge.....
We are undertaking the adventurous, arduous and exciting challenge of walking the highest mountains - in Scotland, Wales and England within 24 hours!

This should not be underestimated. A high level of fitness, stamina and precise navigational skills will be demanded. Not to mention the lack of sleep and weather conditions that we will encounter along the way!

Donating towards Elias' Future is imperative. Support given on any scale is appreciated and a progression towards Elias' operation. Donating is quick and simple, just follow the instructions on the page.
By donating to this worthy cause you will make a difference.

As we are doing the 'hard bit,' all we ask is that you spread the word amongst your friends and family. There are sharing tools on this page and remember that words are effortless and free. Thank you for taking your time to read this page.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Cody

","I'm looking to take my first run at the professional circuit by entering into the last 6 tournaments of the Carolina Winter Series of the NGA Tour/Swingthought.com Tour in Myrtle Beach, SC. If I play well I could earn status on their PRO series, where the prize money gets pretty serious, and the opportunity to take it to the world stage begins to become a reality. Please help me raise the money for the entrance fees and money for housing while I'm there. I love you all. Thank you in advanceLove, Cody",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

There has been no smartphone holder that fulfills needs for various situations that make you fix your smartphones. But you can experience greater comfort and freedom for both of your hands with iMarvel than using existing smartphone stands.

Adhesion technology used in iMarvel is the patented one making it easy for you to stick your smartphone to and remove it.

 

iMARVEL is also a product that you can use it in your daily life anywhere and anytime. You may use something to which you can attach your goods and keep using it in that way. But if you need something detachable, iMARVEL will be your one and only solution in the world.

 

We have participated in this campaign so that we can secure funding to produce of patented materials and print required for iMarvel.
iMarvel is a versatile, practical and aesthetically good looking product that will bring extra convenience to your life.

iMarvel will make you enjoy the freedom to use both of your hands while putting your smartphone on a smooth and flat surface in different places and situations of your life and its stylish design will also serve as part of your interior props.
You can use iMARVEL in every place of your lifestyle.

You can attach iMARVEL next to TV in the living room and you don’t need to look for the remote controller anymore. You can place iMARVEL in your children’s rooms and they will no longer have to look for their stationery all over the rooms.

You can also use iMARVEL in kitchen, bathroom, living room and on dressing table and it will bring whole new convenience to you when using in your car. In addition, iMARVEL is a magic pad available for any kind of places including offices and stores.

iMarvel is a collaboration between technical skills of Winic and decent designs of an illustrator named Geumhwang, and part of her artworks applied to iMarvel products are displayed in Creative Talking Gallery at COEX Aquarium.
We have combined convenient functions with paintings by Geumhwang to create iMarvel with handy functions and decent designs.
Geumhwang always thinks of people who will feel comfortable and happy with her works before starting to draw.
So we also hope you can feel comfortable and happy with paintings on iMarvel.

column4: > Story behind the development of iMARVEL

column1: iMARVEL is finished by 9 steps of processes and one of the most important processes is to test the limit of weight that iMARVEL can stand.
We will tell you the hidden story about the weight of the product that can be stuck to iMARVEL during the development.
Do you know the weight of the heaviest smartphone?
We guess that the weight of the heaviest smartphone equipped with all possible cases and covers will not exceed 230g.
What we have used during the development was an iron mock-up that resembles a smartphone case.
Have you ever seen a smartphone case made of iron? We guess that you have never ever seen such a thing.
Give it a try to guess the weight of the iron smartphone case.
We had two iron smartphone cases. The first one weighed 405g and the other one weighed 414g.
The picture shows the iron smartphone case stuck to iMARVEL. It didn’t fall off from iMARVEL once being stuck to it.
So it would be absolutely fine with iMARVEL no matter what kind of smartphones you use.
We have performed a variety of tests while producing iMARVEL and we are really happy to share the story behind the development of iMARVEL with you.

iMarvel was designed based on shapes and forms of different smartphones and its both ends were rounded to deliver the feelings of those paintings on it and we have done a series of tests in order to make iMarvel appropriate for all kinds of smartphones with different form factors.
❖ The product colors may differ from what you see on your monitor.

iMarvel had a positive result from the tensile adhesion strength test for quality control and also successfully completed tests in compliance with the Restriction of Hazardous Substances Directive (RoHS) stipulated by the European Union and common safety guidelines for kid products.
• Remove the protective film on the back, stick it to things made of wood or glass and then remove the protective film on the front.

• Press your smartphone on iMarvel ‘a little bit hard’ to make sure that your phone was attached to iMarvel completely and then let the phone hang on it. You will understand what it feels like after a few repetitions.
• When you stick your phone in a vertical position, do not let the camera of your phone attached.
• Use your both hands when removing your phone from iMarvel.
• The backside of iMarvel will gradually be more adhesive.
• When you remove iMarvel, make some spaces by holding the both ends and then stripping it off slowly.
• Your phone will not be sticky after removing it from iMarvel.
Magic pads have no specific expiry dates and therefore you can use them anytime after long periods of storage. They are also good gifts for your family, friends and colleagues.
• iMarvel products are supplied in random designs except for ordering a full set. So if you want specific designs, please let us know it. We can send you products accordingly.
• iMarvel plus is supplied in random design.
• iMarvel stand is basically supplied vertical type. If you want to have horizontal type, please let us know it. We can send you horizontal type.
• Original postcards will be provided same as the ones in iMarvel products.
• We need one month for production after the campaign is completed. Then, the delivery will start.
• iMarvel products will have individual packaging for delivery.
• Once the campaign ends and we are ready for delivery, we will give all supporters tracking numbers.
It took more than 8 months to create iMarvel from planning, sample and prototype production, tests with various conditions to finished goods.
iMarvel is the one and only thing to perfectly fulfill your needs when you want to fix your smartphone in a vertical position.

We have completed all the necessary tests related to manufacturing processes of iMARVEL. Once the campaign ends, we will start to produce patented materials to manufacture iMARVEL. So our supporters will have iMARVEL as soon as possible.
In addition, following this campaign, we will also make a new challenge for a portable version of iMARVEL and we will be back to you when we achieve new challenge.
Have you ever heard of a song called ""GANGNAM STYLE of PSY?""
Winic is a company located in Gangnam, Seoul, Korea and has produced iMarvel which is an anti-gravity smartphone holder.
Our motto is to design an art on technology.

Our technology used in iMarvel is patented and we are planning to cooperate with various professionals including illustrators, photographers and designers so that they can express their ideas with iMarvel products.
We will participate in this campaign with products of the first collaboration between Winic and one of those artists.
What kind of smartphones and their cases can I use with iMarvel?

Your smartphone or its cover should have flat backside to put it on iMarvel. Some materials are not proper to stick it to iMarvel. So please check whether your smartphone or its case can be attached to iMarvel before using it.
What kind of materials can I stick iMarvel to?

Its backside can be attached to glass, wood, steel, plastic and tiles. However, iMarvel may not be completely attached to such materials without smooth or flat surfaces. So please check the surfaces before using it.
How long can my smartphone hold onto iMarvel?

Although your smartphone will not be separated from iMarvel once attached but please remember that iMarvel is not designed to fix your smartphone completely but to hold it for a while. So you need to be careful as its adhesion may gradually become weak.

Its durability may vary depending on frequency of repeated use and other environmental factors such as temperature and humidity. So each product may have different durations for use.
When you feel that the adhesion of iMarvel is not that strong, clean it with water and dry it out to restore its adhesion.
You can pay via credit card or PayPal. Select a perk and you'll see the available payment methods at checkout.
How do I select which iMARVEL I want?
If you want specific designs, please let us know it. We can send you products accordingly.
We can promote works by many artists to the public with this campaign and your money will be used to produce patented materials and print their artworks on iMarvel products.
We would like to thank all those supporters paticipating in this campaign. We love hearing from our backers!

THIS CAMPAIGN IS AVAILABLE FOR A LIMITED TIME ONLY! 

From a successful $115,000 Kickstarter campaign, we want to bring Indiegogo backers the opportunity to participate in a special campaign with more flexibility and options.

BACK WITH CONFIDENCE: 

Now offering Guaranteed Delivery! No risk when you back our campaign.  Receive your order within 60 days of estimated delivery or receive a full refund backed personally by the creator, Dr. Stephen Bui &
column2:
BLACKROLL® AG. 

 THE PROBLEM 

If you’re like most people, you spend A LOT of time sitting. At work, in the car, at home…and you're wondering, ""WHY is my back ALWAYS hurting?""

Here's the thing...physical therapists, doctors, even the scientists at NASA have realized that humans are not designed to sit! Our body is a perpetual motion machine! And the damage we’re doing from so much sitting can even be compared to being a smoker!

THE SOLUTION

Here's the good news...there's a new solution to your aches and pain. Even your back pain! 

It's called active standing! First, think about the way you've trained yourself to sit. Head down looking at your phone, shoulders rolled forward, leaning forward from your lower back, elbows pushed out. That doesn’t even sound comfortable! But active standing will make your body feel AMAZING! Not only are you burning calories, you're using your body the way it's designed to be used. 

THE BENEFITS 

Sitting means your muscles get less oxygen (not relaxing!) and your blood get less nutrients (not healthy!) Active standing on the SMART MOVE BOARD increases blood flow, oxygen levels, and engages your muscles in a way that actually REDUCES aches and pains.  

SMART MOVE BOARD's fun, dynamic shape will keep you moving while standing-without even thinking about it! Ease back pain, improve your balance, engage your core, and strengthen your muscles, all while working.
>MAKE YOUR OFFICE DAY MORE ACTIVE WITH HAPPY OFFICE PACKAGE:

column3:
showinfo=0"">

Dr. Stephen Bui has 22 years of experience in the healthcare arena, started as a pharmacist then as a physician and surgeon. He is a Board Certified surgeon who has performed thousands of foot and ankle surgeries. He enjoys treating various foot and ankle conditions and has special interests in posture, biomechanics, sports medicine and foot and ankle surgery. He traveled internationally and volunteered in many medical missions, performing foot and ankle surgeries including children with clubfoot, cerebral palsy, polio, etc.   

In January 2017, Dr. Bui started Active Life Solutions with goals to promote health and wellness through active lifestyles. His current clinical research includes the effects of good posture and non-surgical treatments for plantar fasciitis(heel pain) with his new invention ""The HighHealer"". Recently, he had a successful launch of his invention, the HighHealer-""the world’s first portable 5-in-1 foot trainer"" on crowdfunding. https://igg.me/at/HighHealer 

Dr. Mark Cucuzzella
column5:
showinfo=0"">

Air Force Reserve Lt. Col. (Dr.) Mark Cucuzzella is a Professor at West Virginia University School of Medicine. He is designing programs to promote healthier and better running in the military with the USAF Efficient Running Project. Mark has presented running workshops on over 50 military bases in the last 10 years and continues to teach through Healthy Running. You can view modules on here.

A competitive runner for over 35 years - with more than 100 marathon and ultramarathon finishes - and continues to compete as a national-level Masters runner. He has won the Air Force Marathon twice. He is the race director of Freedom's Run race series in West Virginia and director of the Natural Running Center, an education portal designed to teach healthier running . Mark is also the owner of Two Rivers Treads - A Center for Natural Running and Walking in his hometown of Ranson, W.Va.

In 2007, BLACKROLL® was developed in Germany by Jürgen Dürr. Two years later, in 2009, BLACKROLL® was awarded the prestigious Physio prize  for the “product with the greatest range of benefits for its users”. Experts in the sports- and medical sector quickly came to learn about the wide scope of benefits that BLACKROLL® offered to treat muscle pain and fascia issues.

As of 2012, BLACKROLL® firmly established itself on the market, and got well supported and recommended by leaders in the health - sports and therapeutic industry. In the autumn of 2013 Marius Keckeisen restructured the company BLACKROLL®  in order to enable and facilitate further growth. The shareholder company BLACKROLL AG was founded and located its headquarter office in Bottighofen, Switzerland.

Dr. Stephen Bui has 22 years of experience in the healthcare arena, started as a pharmacist then as a physician and surgeon. He is a Board Certified surgeon who has performed thousands of foot and ankle surgeries. He enjoys treating various foot and ankle conditions and has special interests in posture, biomechanics, sports medicine and foot and ankle surgery. He traveled internationally and volunteered in many medical missions, performing foot and ankle surgeries including children with clubfoot, cerebral palsy, polio, etc.

The rest of my life in pain…my last hope

EARLY HISTORY: I am a single mother who had a successful career when I was younger. During a difficult and painful divorce in which my boys and I were removed from the marital home, I discovered I had Degenerative Disc Disease. I had had the pain for years but attributed it to lifting toddlers, working, house work and yard work.  It was so extreme I was put on Social Security Disability.  There is also arthritis throughout the spine.  You can imagine that living off Social Security Disability and child support for years saving money was difficult. The worst thing was not being able to work
column2: being able to better my situation. It drove me insane and still does. So on top of the pain, major anxiety and depression sunk in and still spikes due to my situation because I was and am helpless to fix the situation.

column1: The Move: In July 2011 listening to doctor’s advice that I would be more comfortable and have the potential to be more active, I took what little saving I had and moved the boys and I to Florida. This was to be my new start. I thought that if the pain could be helped by the warmer weather that I could maybe even start a small part time job again and be able to provide a better life for my kids. At first it seemed better but there was no further relief even in the warmth and the humidity made me nauseous. Early this past summer my back became worse. I was terrified because I had nothing and the medical bills were burying us. This new pain was unbelievable and it was like no pain I had ever felt before. In general the pain is in my low back, hips and legs. This pain was higher up and was wreaking havoc with my digestive &
column2: urinary track systems for which I will save you the details.  Just doing normal tasks was too much. Then one day I started to stop feeling my legs, I was weak and to the point that I needed help to walk. I ended up in the ER. The doctor’s performed an MRI and concluded there was new and increased bulging in a disc that only had a slight tear and slight bulge before. These symptoms are still present almost 5 months after the initial increase in pain.

column1: As a Results: What I thought would be a huge change for the better for my family and health turned the opposite. The best thing I can do now is move back to north to Massachusetts where I can receive the medical care I require and where I have a support system in place. I have no support system here.
Due to the illness of my parents my family is in no position to help me so I am asking for your help to save me and my sons.

I am asking for $2,000 (even though I need closer to $10,000 because I have NOTHING and will need to find a suitable place to live. I sold everything to move down here so I have virtually nothing such as beds, kitchen supplies etc. $2000 will barely cover the moving costs). The money will pay to get me back north where I can get the care I need and where I have a great support system. My doctors are in place.

I cannot stay here. The medical system is far more expensive and I have lost everything. I fear if I can’t get help I will be homeless within the year and I will lose my children, which would destroy the three of us. Every month I get deeper in debt even though we are on a strict budget. I can barely make it in a tiny furnished apartment with the basics. I can’t even think about being homeless and my children taken from me. Here I am alone. Medical fees and care are astronomical. My back will only worsen. I have hit a wall and need your help to get over it.

Please help me move back home and get the medical care and support I need. I may have to live with constant sometimes debilitating pain, but please help me do so with my friends and family who love me, and with my boys.

The money will pay to get me back north where I can get the care I need and where I have a great support system. My doctors are in place.

I cannot stay here. The medical system is far more expensive and I have lost everything. I fear if I can’t get help I will be homeless within the year and I will lose my children, which would destroy the three of us. Every month I get deeper in debt even though we are on a strict budget. I can barely make it in a tiny furnished apartment with the basics. I can’t even think about being homeless and my children taken from me. Here I am alone. Medical fees and care are astronomical. My back will only worsen. I have hit a wall and need your help to get over it.

Please help me move back home and get the medical care and support I need. I may have to live with constant sometimes debilitating pain, but please help me do so with my friends and family who love me, and with my boys.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

We are the Mumaws: Jordan and Jami.  We met in 2005 while working at a local pool as lifeguards and started dating in 2006 and loved every minute of it.  We have been happily married since July 24, 2010.  Jordan is an avid Lego and RC car fan who works with children on social and behavior skills.  I, Jami, am a knitter and a scrapbooker who is currently looking for a job in my field of Elementary Education. Jordan was adopted as a newborn from Bolivia and he always wanted a family that he could really call his own, that are blood relatives.  The above video is just a little clip of who we are so that you can see a little bit into our lives.  The dog at the end of the video is our adopted “baby” Colbi who is now 2 years old.  (The wedding pictures are the work of the wonderful Casi Leisure and Kelsey Campbell of Casi Leisure Photography.  Visit them at http://casileisurephotography.com/.)

We knew before we got married that we wanted 4 children of our own and even had names picked out for our unborn children.  We decided to wait until I was done with school before we would start our family.  However, we were so anxious about being parents that we couldn’t wait and we started trying right before my last semester of college so that we would have a baby shortly after I graduated.  Eight months of no success later, we were worried that something was very wrong, so I went to the doctor.  We were diagnosed with unexplained infertility and shortly thereafter, I was diagnosed with hyperinsulinemia (pre-diabetes) and hypothyroidism, both of which affect our odds of conceiving.  We were absolutely stunned.  Almost every woman in my family was a “fertile Myrtle” so when we didn’t get pregnant right away, we had no idea what could be wrong and couldn’t believe that something could be.  Our odds weren’t looking very good so we consulted a fertility specialist who decided that intrauterine insemination would be our next step.  After that failed we were left with 3 options: in vitro fertilization, adoption and fostering.  While I had always dreamed of adopting one child from the same town that Jordan was adopted from in Bolivia, I never thought that our entire family would be the result of adoptions instead of biological children.  While we are considering all 3 avenues as possibilities, we have both agreed that we want to exhaust all options for us to have a biological child and have chosen to give IVF one shot.

IVF, while being our last shot at having our own children, comes with a hefty price tag.  We live in Indiana and insurance companies here are not required to cover assisted fertility.  We can’t even have the costs billed to our deductible.  So that leaves us with a large sum of money to come up with from a one-income household and to pay up front for the procedure.

Essentially, we need around $12,000 for the IVF procedure and another $3,000 for the medications that I would need to take.  However, $15,000 seems like an awful lot to ask from any group of people.  We are asking for around $2,000 in donations over the next 60 days to help us towards our goal of IVF.  This even seems like a lot to ask for.  So here is what you can do to help us…
What You Can Do To Help Us

If just 200 people are willing to donate only $10 we will have met our goal.  Even small contributions will mean the world to us.  So whether you can donate $1 or $100, we will thank you graciously and you will always be in our hearts as someone who supported our dream and helped us make it a reality.  If you are unable to donate, we understand, but if you still support our cause, share our story in whatever way you want to.  Feel free the share our story using the tools provided by IndieGoGo.  We are eternally grateful for any support we can receive.  Thank you so much for taking the time to read our story!

A singer songwriter from Liberia, West Africa. David was involved in an accident in Monrovia. A generator exploded while he was putting it on. He sustained burns.

Cash is needed to help purchase quality medial supplies for him.The healthcare system is not one of the best in Liberia. To help with his recovery the aftercare is so important. The correct medical supplies are essential.
We need $1000.00 to help with the purchase. Whatever we received we will be grateful for.
Thanks to his fans all over the world for their prayers.

My name is Tami Zilka. I am a stay at home mom and have 2 beautiful girls, Zoey who is 3 and Sophie who is 3 months. Sophie was born April 26 2012 weighing 7.5lbs she seemed like a healthy newborn. She began having difficulty eating and after changing her formula several times we found one that she could use and thought our troubles were over. May 23rd Sophie made a horrible screeching sound and when I came into her room she was blue in her crib. I began stimulating Sophie and her color returned to normal. She was admitted to the hospital and weighed 6lbs. May 25, Sophie was transferred to Childrens Hospital in Minneapolis never in my dreams did I think we would spend a month in ICC at Childrens.

It was determined that Sophie was aspirating on her food and a feeding tube was surgically placed on June 6. June 8th she was diagnosed with Angelman Syndrome a rare genetic disorder that occurs in 1/15,000 live births often misdiagnosed as Cerebal Paulsy or Autisim.

Characteristics of Angelman Syndrome are seizure,developmental delay, balance and mobility issues, Autistic traits, little or no speech.More information about Angelman Syndrome can be found at www.Angelmandfoundation.org

A service animal was recommended. The service animal will alert to seizure prior to it happening. The animal will also encourage development and mobility. We were lucky enough to find an organization who was willing to place a dog with Sophie. Huge thanks to 4Pawsforability! More information can be found at www.4pawsforability.org

Our fundraising requirement is $13,000 all proceeds will go towards the service animal. I am willing to take on this challenge to help my daughter reach her full potential. Every donation is greatly appreciated as we can not do this on our own. There are not enough words to express my grattitude for your support.

A Benefit is being held Saturday October 13 at the VFW in Randall. There will be a Spaghetti dinner, bake sale, silent acution, Music provided by Power of Cheese. If you would like to donate towards dinner, bake sale or silent auction please feel free to contact us for more information. Once again I would like to thank everyone for their support in helping us get Sophie's service animal here as soon as possible!!

column2: >In February 2012, Trevor Murphy stepped in the Disc Golf world. Purchasing his first ""real"" set of discs from a local disc golf shop in Orlando Florida. Trevor took on the likes of the Rock Spring Ridge DGC, Barnett Park, Bill Fredrick's DGC, as well as a short 9 at Lincoln Park DGC in Mt. Dora Florida.

>In May 2012, Trevor returned to the North Eastern Ohio / Western PA area and realized that Disc Golf was so much more. Playing relentlessly in his ""new"" home of Disc Golf, traveling to local courses, and playing in a winter points series, Trevor's passion for an organized Disc Golf Club grew. Realizing that newer players were the future of Disc Golf. He decided to start a Club that would bring New Players in with Seasoned Veterans of the game to help encourage the Growth of Disc Golf. With the help of Chuck Coristin, 1 year player, and Becky Caszatt, less than 1yr playing, a team that would help him achieve this goal.

>We are the ValleyDGA, Valley Disc Golf Association, catering to the Disc Golf community in the North Eastern Ohio and Western Pennsylvania area. ValleyDGA was formed in early 2013 by a group of Disc Golfers that want to help grow the sport of Disc Golf.
>Becky Caszatt - Club Treasurer and Secretary - PDGA# 56820

>With the combined talents of the three and their passion for the sport. ValleyDGA looks to be a promising club for the future of the area. With their emphasis on growing the sport with new disc golfers yet keeping it challenging for the seasoned vets.

>This campaign is to help raise funds for ValleyDGA. To help them to become the best disc golf club in the area. To be able to hold awesome Events such as Leagues, Tournaments, and the possibility of creating New Courses in the area.
>This campaign is the most important one of them all. The contributions that are made will not only help to start the club but fuel it for many years to come.

>In the NEOhio/WestPA area, Disc Golf is slowly growing, but at what rate? With not much in the way of a solid, organized Club to help new players gain confidence, skill, and understanding for the game, the ValleyDGA is going to do just that. We are wanting to see more disc golfers out there!!
>With your contributions you could help us to grow the sport in the area.
>What do you need this Money for?

>We hold no information back. We want you to know exactly what we are raising funds for, not to hide behind some organizational logo. We are raising funds for the only thing that matters within our club, the whole reason this was founded, for YOU!

>Every penny earned in this campaign is going straight back into our Club Bank to purchase Club Plastic for you to choose from. Whether a Mini Game award, CTP Challenge Payout, Winning the Session, or taking the BagTag Challenge award!! It is all coming back to you! For Prizes and for Purchase to help fuel the Club to the next year! We aren't trying to make a dime for ourselves. We want our Club to payback to the one thing that keeps it going.
>We will have all sorts of products from DiscGolf Bags, Towels, and other Accessories. As well as your favorite plastic brands. An exclusive DiscGolf shop for all of our Members!

>All of our Perks listed will be Purchased with the funds raised in this campaign. Starting in an awesome direction already. The funds raised will help what we already have Club Bank. Again, your contributions only help you in the long run.
>If we don't reach our goal. It will break our hearts, but we will heal.. Lol
>All funds raised if we don't reach our goal STILL go back to the club to raise money for Prizes and Giveaways when you are a Club Member.
>No matter whether we hit it or miss it.. All the Funds are payed back out to you in Prizes and Fun Stuff!!!
>What will be the Impact of the ValleyDGA?

>Valley’s sole mission is to help expand the growth of Disc Golf. As well as to give people a reason to leave the computer and go outdoors and enjoy the community, city, and state parks that have been created. You as a contributor are fueling our fire for activity! You will be helping us to encourage not only the sport, but for the health of others. Being active is one of the things we seem to take for granted. In addition to being out in nature. Being a disc golfer or not, being outdoors is just fun and healthy!
>The ValleyDGA also believe in having events to raise money and awareness to Charity's and Community Action. Giving back to the community and to the world is another part of our key mission.
>Can't afford to Contribute? Of course you can!

>Even if you can't financially afford to contribute you can still help! Spread the word about our campaign. Share us on Facebook and Twitter. Email your friends. Indiegogo makes it easy with their Share Tools.
>The more people know, the bigger we can grow!
>To keep updated on what's happening around the Club. Please visit our website at ValleyDGA.com
>Any questions or concerns feel free to email Trevor@ValleyDGA.com
>We look forward to seeing you out on the course!

column1: In February 2012, Trevor Murphy stepped in the Disc Golf world. Purchasing his first ""real"" set of discs from a local disc golf shop in Orlando Florida. Trevor took on the likes of the Rock Spring Ridge DGC, Barnett Park, Bill Fredrick's DGC, as well as a short 9 at Lincoln Park DGC in Mt. Dora Florida.

In May 2012, Trevor returned to the North Eastern Ohio / Western PA area and realized that Disc Golf was so much more. Playing relentlessly in his ""new"" home of Disc Golf, traveling to local courses, and playing in a winter points series, Trevor's passion for an organized Disc Golf Club grew. Realizing that newer players were the future of Disc Golf. He decided to start a Club that would bring New Players in with Seasoned Veterans of the game to help encourage the Growth of Disc Golf. With the help of Chuck Coristin, 1 year player, and Becky Caszatt, less than 1yr playing, a team that would help him achieve this goal.

We are the ValleyDGA, Valley Disc Golf Association, catering to the Disc Golf community in the North Eastern Ohio and Western Pennsylvania area. ValleyDGA was formed in early 2013 by a group of Disc Golfers that want to help grow the sport of Disc Golf.
Becky Caszatt - Club Treasurer and Secretary - PDGA# 56820

With the combined talents of the three and their passion for the sport. ValleyDGA looks to be a promising club for the future of the area. With their emphasis on growing the sport with new disc golfers yet keeping it challenging for the seasoned vets.

This campaign is to help raise funds for ValleyDGA. To help them to become the best disc golf club in the area. To be able to hold awesome Events such as Leagues, Tournaments, and the possibility of creating New Courses in the area.
This campaign is the most important one of them all. The contributions that are made will not only help to start the club but fuel it for many years to come.

In the NEOhio/WestPA area, Disc Golf is slowly growing, but at what rate? With not much in the way of a solid, organized Club to help new players gain confidence, skill, and understanding for the game, the ValleyDGA is going to do just that. We are wanting to see more disc golfers out there!!
With your contributions you could help us to grow the sport in the area.
What do you need this Money for?

We hold no information back. We want you to know exactly what we are raising funds for, not to hide behind some organizational logo. We are raising funds for the only thing that matters within our club, the whole reason this was founded, for YOU!

Every penny earned in this campaign is going straight back into our Club Bank to purchase Club Plastic for you to choose from. Whether a Mini Game award, CTP Challenge Payout, Winning the Session, or taking the BagTag Challenge award!! It is all coming back to you! For Prizes and for Purchase to help fuel the Club to the next year! We aren't trying to make a dime for ourselves. We want our Club to payback to the one thing that keeps it going.
We will have all sorts of products from DiscGolf Bags, Towels, and other Accessories. As well as your favorite plastic brands. An exclusive DiscGolf shop for all of our Members!

All of our Perks listed will be Purchased with the funds raised in this campaign. Starting in an awesome direction already. The funds raised will help what we already have Club Bank. Again, your contributions only help you in the long run.
If we don't reach our goal. It will break our hearts, but we will heal.. Lol
All funds raised if we don't reach our goal STILL go back to the club to raise money for Prizes and Giveaways when you are a Club Member.
No matter whether we hit it or miss it.. All the Funds are payed back out to you in Prizes and Fun Stuff!!!
What will be the Impact of the ValleyDGA?

Valley’s sole mission is to help expand the growth of Disc Golf. As well as to give people a reason to leave the computer and go outdoors and enjoy the community, city, and state parks that have been created. You as a contributor are fueling our fire for activity! You will be helping us to encourage not only the sport, but for the health of others. Being active is one of the things we seem to take for granted. In addition to being out in nature. Being a disc golfer or not, being outdoors is just fun and healthy!
The ValleyDGA also believe in having events to raise money and awareness to Charity's and Community Action. Giving back to the community and to the world is another part of our key mission.
Can't afford to Contribute? Of course you can!

Even if you can't financially afford to contribute you can still help! Spread the word about our campaign. Share us on Facebook and Twitter. Email your friends. Indiegogo makes it easy with their Share Tools.
The more people know, the bigger we can grow!
To keep updated on what's happening around the Club. Please visit our website at ValleyDGA.com
Any questions or concerns feel free to email Trevor@ValleyDGA.com
We look forward to seeing you out on the course!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

weight. This position eliminates all gravitational
compression. Inversion therapy is the safest, quickest and most
effective way to increase the space between your vertebrae. Numerous
clinical studies published in reputable medical journals have
confirmed that inversion really does increase the separation between
the discs of the spine, which brings relief from back pain.

What is the Yogena Inversion Sling?



The Yogena Inversion Sling is a patent pending (USPTO Application # 61/853,846) recreational hammock &
that can be used as a yoga prop, a suspension trainer and can be used indoors or outdoors. The
hammock weights only 5 lbs, comes with its own bag and can be set up in
less than 2 minutes on any support beam or two points that are strong
enough to hold your weight. The hammock is made from parachute nylon and
polyester webbing and can hold up to 700 lbs.
It comes with 4 carabiners (strength 12 kN or 2,697 lbs each)
and includes 2 daisy chains (4.5 feet each) with 22 pockets.The actual

Swaziland is home to the world’s highest prevalence of HIV,
with nearly 30% of adults suffering from infection.  The disease has wreaked havoc on all facets
of society here, leaving many children parentless.  NGOs in Swaziland have taken action in recent
years to address the needs of these orphans and vulnerable children (OVCs) by
establishing Neighborhood Care Points (NCPs) in communities throughout the
Kingdom.  These NCPs essentially serve as
soup kitchens and child care centers for these children.  The NCP in our community operates on food
donations from the World Food Program.
Donations are intermittent and the center shuts down in the absence of
food.  When food is available, meals
consist of maize porridge and beans.
While these staples help to meet the caloric requirements of the growing
children, they lack the micronutrients necessary for optimal development.  <b>We hope to address these concerns by building
a garden on the premises of the care point to address this need for a
consistent, local food source and for dietary diversity.  The community is committed to taking the
leadership on this project and has agreed to provide the labor necessary to
construct the garden.  This project will
also include a week-long workshop for the five women who volunteer as
caregivers for these children.  They will
be trained in sustainable gardening techniques as well as basic nutrition.  They will gain the knowledge needed to
prepare balanced and nutritious meals for the 36 children served by the center.  The funds raised through this campaign will
be used to effectively fence the premises to protect the center as well as the
garden from robbery and to purchase the materials and seeds necessary to
appreciate any contribution, no matter the size, that will help us provide
access to fresh produce for a group of Swaziland’s orphans and vulnerable

be trained in sustainable gardening techniques as well as basic nutrition.  They will gain the knowledge needed to
prepare balanced and nutritious meals for the 36 children served by the center.  The funds raised through this campaign will
be used to effectively fence the premises to protect the center as well as the
garden from robbery and to purchase the materials and seeds necessary to
appreciate any contribution, no matter the size, that will help us provide
access to fresh produce for a group of Swaziland’s orphans and vulnerable

Short Summary

  • This campaign is brought to you from Real Deal to raise money and awareness for Chubbs who is a local producer from Pittsburgh battling cancer.


  • We are here to make sure that we can assist our loved ones that are in their time of need.


  • Every donation will help no matter the size, its time to band together and come together for a good cause.
column7:
What You Get


  • The money will go straight to his family to help out with all of the hospital bills and medications. 


  • For everyone that donates $50 or more you will get a free beat from Chubbs, and also get a feature from Pittsburgh's own Real Deal. 


  • If you want to record with Real Deal in the same studio James Webb from ""The Plug Media""  has agreed to donate a percentage of the recording cost to the cause. 


The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • We can help out a family in need, and band together to show support.


  • Wether your a friend, family member, or musician there is an opportunity to help a noble cause. 

Other Ways You Can Help


  • If you cannot help out monetarily then help us by sharing the word! That means Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and that would be a ton of help for us.   


  • It is as simple as clicking the share tools on the campaign and you'll be on your way to helping someone in need.

column3: >

column1: Dancing Lotus Fitness started in 2009 with the simple goal of bringing fun and unique fitness classes that would be accessible to all ages and abilities, into our community. Meriah Jacobs-Frost began an initial offering of ZUMBA Fitness classes a few days a week, and in those first months the classes had one or two people attending. We stuck with our classes and after a few months we celebrated the glorious day that we had seven people in our classes!  Now after over two and a half years of hard work and dedication we regularly have more than 25 people in our classes--huge numbers for the area we serve! What Meriah initially intended to be a small hobby has now grown to a small business, offering 16 classes each week in three local communities. Dancing Lotus now sees about 100 individuals taking advantage of their mind-body fitness classes each month.

Dancing Lotus is committed to delivering a fun, motivating and effective class that anyone can enjoy--in a safe, relaxed atmosphere. These are classes that that people want to share with their friends and family. Dancing Lotus classes can become girl's night out, or even a family reunion. We sometimes have three generations in our classes! Our classes are all unique workouts that our participants look forward to. We now offer ZUMBA Fitness, PiYo, Yoga, and Hoop Dance classes. These classes are made more accessible than they might otherwise be by Meriah's dedication to education and training so that we can tailor each person's workout to what they need. Our overwhelming success comes from our passion for what we do. We love our participants and the way our classes affect their lives. People feel like part of the Dancing Lotus ""family"" rather than members of a gym. Through our commitment to education and providing fun yet effective classes, we make wellness an integral part of people's lives.

column5: >The Impact of the Dancing Lotus Fitness Studio

column1: The Dancing Lotus Fitness Studio will allow us to take the mission of providing Fun and Unique Fitness to the next level. We currently rent space in multiple locations with less than ideal conditions and restrictions on space and scheduling. The Studio will allow us to create a schedule that better suits the needs of our participants and ensure that we provide a safe environment for our classes. To make the most out of our classes, we need to have sufficient open space, appropriate flooring, and proper heating and air conditioning. Finally, the studio will also allow Dancing Lotus to expand our offerings to include programming that will positively impact wellness in other areas of our participants lives.

The success of our studio will help us to continue to promote and increase wellness in the community. In the first two months of 2012 our participants have lost over 120 pounds through our free weight loss support! We love hearing stories of people going to their health care providers and being told to keep up whatever it is they're doing that has their test results coming back with such marked improvement (That would be their Dancing Lotus Fitness classes and healthier eating!)! Dancing Lotus is designed to do even more than just make people's bodies healthier.  Our classes also work to make our participants feel empowered, strong, and increase a positive self image. They give individuals the opportunity to express themselves through creative movement as their bodies get stronger! The studio will mean increased health and happiness for the communities we serve.

column3: />The Dancing Lotus Studio needs Grassroots support to get up and running. While the business has seen incredible success, it is still a small, family-owned operation. The backing of the community and individuals who support the vision of wellness for everyone can help take us to the next level. We need approximately $12,000 towards the down payment for our own building. We have set our minimum goal here to allow us to at least secure the space for the studio. We know that we will need an additional $5,000 to make the critical improvements and purchases to get classes up and running (namely flooring and equipment such as yoga mats). We wold love to exceed this minimum goal and be able to open the studio even sooner.

column1: In exchange for your assistance with opening the Dancing Lotus studio, we are offering a number of unique incentives! Choose from everything between a simple thank you and acknowledgment to an exclusive behind-the-scenes opening, to a private fitness party! Not from the area, or maybe you'd rather donate your incentive? If you choose, we will set aside classes for those who may not otherwise be able to afford them in lieu of the listed perk. Donors will also be acknowledged in various ways, from on our website to an eventual permanent installation in the studio. (If you choose to remain anonymous in your donation we will, of course, honor your wishes!)

NEW 3/26/2012! We are so excited to be adding Hoopnotica Travel Hoops and DVDs to the available perks. These are now available thanks to a very generous donation by Hoopnotica! We are so grateful for their support in making this dream come true. Choose from one of the wonderful Hoopnotica DVDs or a Hoopnotica Travel Hoop! Hoopnotica is the format we teach at Dancing Lotus Fitness, and we highly recommend both the DVDs and Travel Hoops!

If the funding goal is reached and we are unable to purchase a building, or if we do not reach the full amount we need to purchase a building, the money will be held in a savings account until we are able to successfully find an appropriate space and move forward with the purchase (or possible lease) of a studio space. If we are in a situation where we need to lease, the money collected will be used to defer our startup expenses and assist us in transitioning into the new space. In either case, we will appreciate everyone's patience with the incentives that involve the studio itself. Should we exceed our goal, the excess will go towards the aforementioned necessary improvements. Any additional funds raised would assist us with additional improvements and the basic operating expenses in kickstarting the studio.

You can help us to reach our goals by asking your friends to support our project! E-mail your friends, share on Facebook and Twitter, and ask your friends to do the same! Maybe you know of someone who would like to help fund a growing business with a positive community impact. Please let them know about our project!

You can also help the campaign by donating services or merchandise that can be used as ""Perks"" for our contributors. Please contact us if you are interested in donating. Your support means the world to us!

What We Need & What You Get
